The account had been at Chiat/Day/ Mojo until July, when Veryfine pulled the business, citing a growing conflict with another Chiat beverage account, Soho. Mullen, which is in Wenham, Mass., bested Scali, McCabe, Sloves and Cliff Freeman & Partners, both of New York, in the account competition.

title: Dr. Vivian Chang, 58, Public Health Official
description: Dr. Vivian Chang, an assistant Surgeon General in the United States Public Health Service, died in an automobile accident Sunday near Wilmington, Del. She was 58 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: Financing Race For Governor
description: In 1974 New Jersey became the first state to enact a law providing public financing for gubernatorial candidates. The limit on spending has been raised several times, and in 1980 the law was extended to cover primary elections for governor as well as the general election.

title: Arnold M. Picker Is Dead at 76; Film Executive Was Fund-Raiser
description: Arnold M. Picker, former head of international operations for United Artists Pictures Inc. who was a prominent fund-raiser for Democratic political candidates, died of pneumonia on Sunday at New England Deaconess Hospital in Boston. He was 76 years old.

title: Treasury Securities Are Mixed
description: Prices of Treasury securities were narrowly mixed in sluggish trading yesterday, as dealers used comments by Alan Greenspan, the Federal Reserve Board chairman, as an excuse to take some profits.

title: Baker Is Seeking Talks on Mideast in Washington
description: In an effort to revive the faltering Middle East peace process, Secretary of State James A. Baker 3d is seeking to organize a meeting in Washington between the Foreign Ministers of Egypt and Israel to pave the way for negotiations between Israelis and Palestinians.

title: Belgians Raise Rates
description: The Belgian central bank raised short-term interest rates today for the fourth time in two weeks. Belgium's three-month treasury bill rate, considered the key rate, was raised by a quarter of a point, to 9.55 percent. The one- and two-month rates were raised to 9.55 percent each from 9.2 and 9.25 percent, respectively. The central bank did not comment on the rate increases.

title: Chief of P.&G. Is Stepping Down
description: In a surprise announcement, the chairman and chief executive of the Procter & Gamble Company said yesterday that he plans to step down from those posts on Jan. 2, nearly three years before mandatory retirement.

title: 3-Month Closing For Ford Plant
description: Production at the Ford Motor Company's Wayne assembly plant will stop for about three months to retool the factory for the next generation of Escort subcompact cars, the company said today. The United Automobile Workers union said it expects fewer than 100 layoffs because of the change-over.

title: Mayoral Camps Meeting Today On Debate Plan
description: A debate about debates begins today, with representatives of the New York mayoral candidates planning to meet to discuss the number, dates, locations and formats of debates.

title: Chip Orders Decline
description: The semiconductor industry's leading indicator continued falling in September as United States semiconductor shipments rose, but orders declined, a trade group reported today.

title: Review/Theater; 'Earnest' in Hartford Has the Director in the Lead
description: ''In matters of grave importance, style, not sincerity, is the vital thing,'' says Gwendolen, one of the perceptive if frivolous dilettantes in Oscar Wilde's ''Importance of Being Earnest.'' In his new production of the play at the Hartford Stage, Mark Lamos has taken Gwendolen's dictum to heart, staging an ''Earnest'' that delivers the bon mots born of boredom in turn-of-the-century British drawing rooms and country estates. But in his production, the characters rarely emerge as much more than stylish mouthpieces for Wilde's famous wit.

title: After the Ball Is Over
description: While edging toward coma during the endless years of baseball this week I suddenly realized I didn't know what a slider was.

title: Inquiry Cites Retaliation Against Whistle Blower
description: A New York City Housing Authority manager was singled out for retaliation after he warned authority officials about suspected corruption in the agency, the city's Department of Investigation has determined.

title: Dravecky Injured Again
description: Dave Dravecky re-fractured his left arm when he was bumped from behind during the on-field celebration Monday after San Francisco won the National League pennant, the Giants said today.

title: An Apolitical City Sadly Notes a Scandal
description: Residents here are regarding the current mayoral contest in New York with a gloomy pride. Pride because we have had a black mayor for 16 1/2 years; gloom because that Mayor, Tom Bradley, is now in a bit of a pinch. And it is hard to find anybody - left, right or center, black or white, politician or civilian - who is happy about that.

title: Bush Will Attend Latin Drug Talks
description: The leaders of Colombia, Peru and Bolivia urged President Bush today to meet them within 90 days to discuss ways to curb the cocaine trade, and the President quickly agreed.

title: Mary Byrne Bocklett, Teacher, 76
description: Mary Byrne Bocklett, a teacher in Long Beach, L.I., before her retirement, died of a heart attack Saturday at the home of her son, John J. Ferguson, in Greenwich, Conn. She was 76 years old and lived in Naples, Fla.

title: Rutgers Reserves a Dorm for Women in Science
description: On Thursday, Douglass College here will dedicate a dormitory for 110 women as part of an innovative program to address the national shortage of female scientists and engineers.

title: Market Place; A Clean-Air Bet On Sun Electric
description: INVESTORS looking for a pure play in the growing trend toward stricter automotive emissions controls will not look at Sun Electric at first, but it could prove to be one of the biggest winners in the field.

title: Critics Accuse Cuomo Of Budget Double Talk
description: In the face of tremendous fiscal problems, Gov. Mario M. Cuomo this year proposed the tightest state spending plan in a decade and reproached many of his critics for demanding more money. ''I would put the emphasis on tighter management and spending discipline,'' he said.

title: Garcia Trial Testimony Ends; Summations Will Start Today
description: After three weeks of testimony, prosecutors yesterday completed the presentation of their case against Representative Robert Garcia of the Bronx and his wife, Jane Lee.

title: Science Fraud Charges Baseless and Irrelevant
description: To the Editor:

title: The Dollar Rises Sharply After Greenspan's Remarks
description: Spurred in part by comments from Alan Greenspan, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, the dollar rose sharply yesterday, passing the important 1.90-mark level again and breaching 144 yen. The British pound also fell sharply against the dollar and other currencies.

title: Alan F. Conwill, 67, A Lawyer and Official
description: Alan F. Conwill, a lawyer and former director of the division of corporate regulation of the Securities and Exchange Commission, died of heart failure in his sleep Monday during a trip to San Antonio, Tex. He was 67 years old and lived in Wyckoff, N.J.

title: Real Estate; 5-Year Commercial Revival Brings Lift to South Bronx
description: WHEN Zaro Bakeries, Farberware Inc., Empire Glass and other companies opened operations in the South Bronx several years ago, they were viewed as risk takers in an area that had come to represent urban decline.

title: Security Council Bars Drug Fight
description: A group of third world nations have blocked a British attempt to involve the Security Council in the battle against drug trafficking, saying they want the Council to deal only with direct threats of military hostilities, diplomats said today.

title: Major Quakes in California
description: Major earthquakes, in order of magnitude as measured on the Richter scale, that have struck California this century. The measurement for the 1906 San Francisco quake is an estimate, because the quake occurred before the Richter scale was developed.

title: Lawrence Goossen, 46, Producer and Manager
description: Lawrence Goossen, a co-producer of plays and a company manager, died of AIDS on Monday at his home in Greenwich Village. He was 46 years old.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: The arrival of fall is not good news for me. It revives my fear of math.

title: Corrections
description: An article in Business Day yesterday about the USAir Group misstated the period this year in which the airline's passenger flights were less full than in 1988. Last month, USAir flights were 56.3 percent full, compared with 57.4 percent in September 1988.

title: Topics of The Times; Bedside Lawyers
description: AIDS patients have many needs, and not the least of them is for legal advice they may be unable to afford. Now trust and estate lawyers from some of New York City's top law firms are volunteering to help out. The project deserves praise and replication elsewhere.

title: Let's Have No More Language Bigotry
description: To the Editor:

title: Review/Theater; Version of the Creation In a Gospel Musical
description: In the sermons of James Weldon Johnson, whose writings form the heart of the 1969 gospel musical ''God's Trombones,'' famous Bible stories are told in fervent oratorical cadences and embellished with storybook imagery that turns them into stirring folk tales. An early 20th-century poet, civil-rights leader, diplomat and preacher, Johnson likened the sound of gospel voices to fanfares of trombones.

title: South Korea Rebuffs U.S.
description: The United States trade representative, Carla A. Hills, received an early rebuff today when South Korea's Agriculture Minister rejected her demand that Seoul liberalize beef imports.

title: Dow Slips 6.08 Points, Ending 6-Day Surge
description: Stocks fell moderately yesterday as some futures-related trading ended a six-day surge that had carried the Dow Jones industrial average to a gain of nearly 100 points.

title: We Can't Keep Turning Farms Into Cities
description: To the Editor:

title: Du Pont Offers $300 Million Issue
description: E.I. du Pont de Nemours & Company is offering $300 million in notes due 1996 through Shearson Lehman Hutton Inc.

title: Soviet Pros at Home
description: Natalya Zvereva has played professional tennis all over the world, except, until yesterday, in her own country.

title: Book Notes
description: Keillor on Radio Again

title: LAWMAKERS SPURN CURBS ON ABORTION IN FLORIDA SESSION
description: The Florida State Legislature today rebuffed a call for tighter restrictions on abortion that the Governor made after the United States Supreme Court opened the way for tougher state laws.

title: Charleston Unemployment Rises After Storm, but Mayor Is Hopeful
description: Hurricane Hugo put a lot of people out of work temporarily but should not cause long-term damage to Charleston's economy, Mayor Joseph P. Riley Jr. says.

title: MIPS Agreements With Nixdorf, Bull
description: MIPS Computer Systems Inc., a maker of microprocessors and computers based in Sunnyvale, Calif., reached agreements on technology and marketing with Nixdorf Computer A. G. of West Germany, and Groupe Bull of France. MIPS's products are based on RISC, or reduced instruction set computing, which speeds data processing by limiting nonessential tasks.

title: Swiss Inflation at 3.4%
description: Switzerland's annual inflation rate rose to 3.4 percent last month, the highest since July 1985, the Federal Statistics Office announced today. Higher prices for heating oil and vegetables were leading factors in the increase, a news statement said. The annual inflation rate had remained stable at 3 percent from May through August.

title: Woman Is Charged in Death Of Husband on Nudist Beach
description: A woman who told the police her husband was shot to death at a a nudist beach by strangers was charged today with plotting to murder him for financial gain.

title: Dell City Journal; After Fire, A Town's Strength Is Tested
description: The people of Dell City want to make it clear that they did not fall apart when their only grocery store burned to the ground last month.

title: Clayton Homes reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Leonard Davidow, 89, Publishing Executive
description: Leonard S. Davidow, a publisher and executive of Sunday supplements and other publishing operations, died Tuesday at Highland Park Hospital in Illinois after a brief illness. He was 89 years old and lived in Highland Park.

title: BRIEFS
description: Debt

title: International Paper Co reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: * American Health Cos., Rexburg, Idaho, promoted its founder, Sybil Ferguson, to chairman of the company and its subsidiary, Diet Center Inc.

title: Motorola's Profit Rises 2.3%
description: Motorola Inc. today reported a 2.3 percent rise in third-quarter earnings on a sales increase of 19.9 percent.

title: Kentucky Utilities Co reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an adjustment gain of $11,470,000, or 30 cents a share, from the cumulative effect of an accounting change.

title: Advanced Micro Devices Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 24
Boeing's Fight Over Bonuses
description: The issue at the heart of the Boeing Company strike, which has idled 58,000 workers for more than a week, is a new one in the American labor movement - one that is forcing union leaders to confront not only management but also their own members.

title: For Giants, Supremacy In Division Is on the Line
description: After the Giants' 21-19 loss to the Eagles on Sunday in Philadelphia, many of the Giants' players were angry and sullen. On Monday, they were essentially the same. Today, they were almost benign. The past seemed past.

title: What Price Luxury? Bigger Deficit
description: As the first luxury models from Japan's two biggest automobile makers reach the United States this fall, each car is adding three times as much to the American trade deficit as the far less expensive vehicle it replaces under the current import-quota agreement.

title: Pennsylvania Power and Light
description: The Pennsylvania Power and Light Company is offering $250 million in first-mortgage bonds due 2019 through underwriters led by the First Boston Corporation.

title: Chhainsa Journal; Food Aplenty for Children, for Bodies and Minds
description: If she had been left to the bleak statistics of rural India, Savita Devi, born 12 years ago into the large family of a poor rural shopkeeper, might have little more to look forward to now than an early marriage, perennial motherhood and a world circumscribed by one small hamlet.

title: The U.N. Today
description: General Assembly Meets at 10 A.M. and 3 P.M. SOCIAL, HUMANITARIAN AND CULTURAL COMMITTEE - 10 A.M. and 3 P.M. DECOLONIZATION COMMITTEE - 10 A.M. LEGAL COMMITTEE - 10 A.M.

title: Child Welfare Transcends Church-State Barrier
description: To the Editor:

title: Machinists Ask Inquiry On UAL Deal
description: The buyout of the UAL Corporation has taken an important step forward with the overwhelming vote by its pilots to commit $200 million from their pension fund, but the machinists' union, which is opposed to the deal, asked the Labor Department yesterday to examine the transaction to determine whether it is fair.

title: Fund Yields Hold Steady
description: Yields of money-market mutual funds surveyed by the IBC/Donoghue's Money Fund Report were unchanged to slightly lower for the week ended yesterday.

title: Kelly McGillis Tries Classics to Cure Film Ennui
description: ''I wanted to do some classical theater,'' says Kelly McGillis, ''to do something that challenged every part of my being -from my speech, to my diction, to my understanding of poetry and form and text to the physical demands of playing period roles as opposed to contemporary ones. I really wanted to work hard - and this is much harder than making a movie.''

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''Noriega is very astute. The next time, he has to be the first to be killed.'' - Adela Bonilla de Giroldi, widow of Panamanian coup leader. [ A12:2. ]

title: Judge Revokes Inmate's Bail After He Is Freed by Mistake
description: A judge revoked bail today for an inmate who was re-arrested after being mistakenly released in a publicly-funded bail program, officials said.

title: Roll-Call Vote to Allow Payment for Some Abortions of Poor
description: Following is the roll-call vote of 216 to 206 by which the House of Representatives agreed today to allow the Federal Government to pay for abortions for poor women whose pregnancies result from rape or incest. A ''yes'' vote is a vote to get rid of the restrictions. Voting ''yes'' were 175 Democrats and 41 Republicans. Voting ''no'' were 72 Democrats and 134 Republicans. Y is a ''yes'' vote. N is a ''no'' vote. X denotes those not voting. There are two vacancies in the 435-member House. ALABAMA Democrats - Bevill, N; Browder, Y; Erdreich, Y; Flippo, Y; Harris, Y. Republicans - Callahan, N; Dickinson, Y. ALASKA Republican - Young, N. ARIZONA Democrat - Udall, Y. Republicans - Kolbe, Y; Kyl, N; Rhodes, N; Stump, N. ARKANSAS Democrats - Alexander, Y; Anthony, Y. Republican - Robinson, N; Hammerschmidt, N. Republicans - Bilirakis, N; Goss, Y; Grant, N; Ireland, N; James, N; Lewis, N; McCollum, N; Ros-Lehtinen, N; Shaw, N; Stearns, N; Young, N. GEORGIA Democrats - Barnard, N; Darden, N; Hatcher, Y; Jenkins, N; Jones, Y; Lewis, Y; Ray, N; Rowland, Y; Thomas, Y. Republican - Gingrich, N. HAWAII Democrat - Akaka, Y. Republican - Saiki, Y. IDAHO Democrat - Stallings, N. Republican - Craig, N. ILLINOIS Democrats - Annunzio, N; Bruce, N; Collins, X; Costello, N; Durbin, Y; Evans, Y; Hayes, Y; Lipinski, N; Poshard, N; Rostenkowski, N; Russo, N; Sangmeister, Y; Savage, Y; Yates, Y. Republicans - Crane, N; Fawell, Y; Hastert, N; Hyde, N; Madigan, N; Martin, Y; Michel, N; Porter, N. INDIANA Democrats - Hamilton, N; Jacobs, Y; Jontz, Y; Long, Y; McCloskey, Y; Sharp, Y; Visclosky, Y. Republicans - Burton, N; Hiler, N; Myers, N. IOWA Democrats - Nagle, Y; Smith, Y. Republicans - Grandy, N; Leach, Y; Lightfoot, N; Tauke, N. KANSAS Democrats - Glickman, Y; Slattery, N. Republicans - Meyers, Y; Roberts, N; Whittaker, Y. title: Gandhi Draws Fire in Parliament
description: Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi was shouted down by opposition calls for his resignation today as he tried to address the Indian Parliament at the opening of a special legislative session.

title: Hickam (Dow B.) Inc(O) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
CLOSE TO HOME
description: WE were up in an attic, three women, opening trunks and tearing the tape off boxes that had been sealed two years earlier. Dust and the sharp scent of mothballs were tickling our noses, and once in a while one of us would sneeze. There was no air in this attic and little light, and getting to it meant climbing a series of 2-by-4's nailed to a wall.

title: Chase Has $1.1 Billion Loss
description: The Chase Manhattan Corporation announced yesterday that it had lost $1.1 billion in the third quarter, about the same amount as it had estimated last month.

title: Early Retirees Are Happy, Study Says
description: Most workers who take early retirement are happy with their decisions, a new study says.

title: KEY RATES
Reviews/Music; Icons Who Rock: The Stones Play Shea
description: With planes regularly roaring overhead and sightlines more appropriate for landscape artists than for concertgoers, Shea Stadium isn't the perfect setting for a rock show. But the Rolling Stones, who opened a six-night engagement on Tuesday, quickly made 66,000 fans feel comfortable. Four or five songs into its two-and-a-half-hour set, the group dug into the rhythm and proved it could still summon the authority necessary to maintain its status as one of the world's greatest rock-and-roll bands.

title: Giants Say No to Walker
description: The Giants have no interest in Herschel Walker, the Dallas Cowboys' running back, even though Walker has said he would like to be traded to the Giants.

title: Burlington Resources reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included income from discontinued operations of $20,981,000, or 14 cents a share, and a gain of $265,611,000, or $1.77 a share, from sale of Plum Creek Timber Co. completed in June. c-Included income from discontinued operations of $13,936,000, or 9 cents a share, for the quarter and $38,093,000, or 26 cents a share, for the 9 months. The income from continuing operations for year-ago 9 months included non-cash charge of $230,000,000 ($143,000,000 after taxes) related to company's estimate of its natural gas take-or-pay contract exposure.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; People
description: * George T. Hayes Jr., a senior vice president at McCann-Erickson/New York, has been promoted to director of media planning.

title: Cup Team Named
description: Mark McCumber and Paul Azinger will defend the World Cup championship for the United States next month in Spain. A total of 32 nations will enter two-player teams in the $1 million tournament, which is scheduled for the Club de Golf Las Brisas in Marbella from Nov. 16-19. The United States has won the cup 17 times.

title: Quilts Illustrating Images From Urban Landscape
description: STAINED-glass windows, skyscrapers and Central Park, these are some of the images depicted in ''Quilts for an Urban Landscape,'' a show of 13 quilts by the 12 members of the Manhattan Quilters Guild.

title: Walgreen Co reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
New Ice Partnership: Soviet Skating Stars Join Torvill and Dean
description: It is obviously not your usual ice show when Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean, the British ice-dance idols, team up with top Soviet skaters to evoke the life of the Egyptian Pharaoh Akhenaten and his wife, Nefertiti. The inspiration behind Mr. Dean's choreography, moreover, comes from the ''Egyptian'' ballets of the mother and father of American modern-dance, Ruth St. Denis and Ted Shawn; the music is by Philip Glass.

title: 3 Teen-Agers Arrested in Bias Attack
description: Three Brooklyn teen-agers were arrested late Tuesday and charged with assaulting three Jewish students at Brooklyn College in what the police have characterized as an anti-Semitic attack.

title: In Glasgow, An Infatuation With Art Deco
description: LAST year the Scottish Opera put on a new production of Johann Strauss's operetta ''Die Fledermaus,'' set in contemporary Glasgow. Instead of taking place in the usual 19th-century drawing room in Vienna, Act I unfolded in a smart Glasgow apartment with cool white walls.

title: 10 Rules To Prevent Boorish Behavior
description: GARDENERS who are content to take pleasure from their own gardens and only theirs live impoverished lives, I believe. The best gardeners I know regularly visit other gardens. In return they often invite people to visit theirs. Knowledge of gardening is dispensed in books (and newspaper columns), but gardens themselves, not words about gardening, are the best teachers of gardening's arts and crafts.

title: Official Says Navy Didn't Malign 2 Sailors on Iowa
description: The Navy's investigation of the explosion that killed 47 sailors in a gun turret of the battleship Iowa last April was ''thorough, complete and expeditious'' and did not malign the character of two sailors on whom the inquiry focused, the Defense Department's inspector general said in a report obtained today.

title: 2 Held Under Fetal Drug Law
description: Two pregnant women who tested positive for drug use when they went to a hospital for abdominal pains have been jailed on charges of distributing cocaine to a minor: their fetuses. Prosecutors said the arrests marked the first use of a new South Carolina law dealing with such cases.

title: Nuclear Course Set by Pakistan Worrying U.S.
description: The Bush Administration has certified to Congress that Pakistan does not possess a nuclear device, but it expressed concerns at the same time about Pakistan's continuing efforts to develop nuclear weapons.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; WPP Shift in Europe
description: Michel Richardot, the vice chairman of Ogilvy & Mather Europe, has joined his agency's parent company, the WPP Group P.L.C., as group director of Europe. Mr. Richardot, who will report to WPP's group chief executive, Martin Sorrell, had helped build Ogilvy's agency network in France as president and later chairman of Ogilvy & Mather Paris.

title: CBS Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary loss of $200,000 on the extinguishment of debt. c-After an extraordinary loss of $100,000 on the extinguishment of debt and a gain on the disposal of discontinued operations of $866,600,000, or $33.70 a share. The company said the decline in share net for the third quarter was primarily due to lower net income from joint ventures. The company also said third-quarter earnings from its broadcast group rose over the prior-year period.

title: Helen Hayes Honored on 89th Birthday
description: The actress Helen Hayes was honored on her 89th birthday Tuesday at a champagne reception at the Algonquin Hotel in Manhattan. The celebration included a progress report on the drive to raise $4 million for the restoration of the Tappan Zee Playhouse in her hometown, Nyack, N.Y.

title: In Indonesia, A Quiet Pope Steps Lightly
description: The Javanese, the dominant ethnic group in this country, have a reputation for indirection and for avoiding confrontation, and as he hopscotches across the Indonesian islands, Pope John Paul II has been a paradigm of Javanese temperament.

title: Bush Proposal For Clean Air Is Dealt a Blow
description: After a confused White House lobbying effort, a House subcommittee voted narrowly today to weaken a major section of President Bush's clean air legislation that was intended to increase the use of fuels other than gasoline in motor vehicles.

title: Corrections
description: Because of an editing error, an obituary yesterday about Dr. Vivian Chang misstated some aspects of her career. At her death she was both an assistant surgeon general of the United States Public Health Service and regional health administrator for the Federal Department of Health and Human Services in New York City. She moved to New York after serving as a doctor in the Peace Corps in Africa.

title: CRUCIAL JET PART FOUND BY FARMER
description: A farmer harvesting corn has found the engine part suspected of causing the United Airlines jumbo jet crash that killed 112 people at the Sioux City airport in July.

title: Mead Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 1
description: The latest quarter and 9 months included a non-recurring gain of $15.5 million, or 23 cents a share, from the sale of Mead release products. Year-ago quarter and 9 months included a gain of $100.9 million, or $1.50 a share, from the sale of the company's 50 percent stake in Brunswick Pulp and Paper Co. Year-ago 9 months included a gain equaled to 17 cents a share from the sale of the company's paperboard division.

title: Polonia Begins Penalty
description: The Yankees' outfielder Luis Polonia, who pleaded no contest to a charge of having sexual relations with a 15-year-old girl during the team's trip to Milwaukee in mid-August, began community service work Tuesday for a social services agency in Milwaukee. Polonia, 24 years old, received permission last week from Milwaukee County Circuit Judge Thomas P. Dougherty to do the service as an alternative to serving two months in jail. The outfielder is working at the Spanish Center. A spokesman for the council said Polonia would do a ''little bit of everything: Cleaning, painting, cutting grass or whatever needs to be done.''(AP)

title: Milwaukee Helps Pace U.S. As Innovator for Workplace
description: Without methodical planning or a grand design, this breezy and muscular city on Lake Michigan has become a flourishing laboratory of the kinds of workplace innovations that national policy makers and private businesses are only beginning to experiment with.

title: Review/Music; Australian Boys' Choir Ends World Tour
description: The Australian Boys' Choral Institute was founded in Melbourne in 1939 and is celebrating its 50th anniversary by sending its Boys' Choir and Vocal Consort on a world tour. The final concert of the tour was on Tuesday evening at the Church of St. Mary the Virgin in Manhattan.

title: Valvano Steps Down
description: Jim Valvano has formally stepped down as athletic director at North Carolina State and has been replaced on an interim basis by Harold Hopfenburg, the school's associate dean of engineering since 1987.

title: Bush and Senators Meet On the Coup That Failed
description: President Bush met with the Democratic and Republican leaders of the Senate Intelligence Committee today to smooth relations with them over the Administration's handling of the failed coup in Panama.

title: Campaign Matters;
description: Sitting amid a sea of paper and sipping cranberry drink on ice, Terrie Henry sounded yesterday about the way anyone would who is having the President of the United States and a thousand other people to dinner tonight. But she won't even get to eat. Mrs. Henry's telephone rings. An assistant hands her a pink message slip. ''He called back to say this is not a pledge,'' the assistant says. ''He just hopes to do $2,000. But he doesn't want you to misunderstand.'' Another aide approaches with a list. ''You guys can promise me that you've checked the spelling of the names and I don't have to go over it again?'' Mrs. Henry asks.

title: State Dept. Drafts Plan to Rebuild Bugged American Embassy in Moscow
description: State Department officials say they have drafted a new plan to tear down and rebuild part of the unfinished American Embassy office building in Moscow, which is riddled with Soviet eavesdropping devices.

title: 'Junk Bond' Market Comes Under Selling Pressure
description: The 'junk bond' market came under further selling pressure yesterday, swept with rumors about large blocks of bonds being sold by dealers and investors. Prices of some large, actively traded issues like RJR Holdings were quoted down a point and a half, or $15 for every $1,000 face amount.

title: Results Plus
description: GOLF Jersey Wins Dodge Cup: The New Jersey section of the Professional Golfers Association captured the sixth annual Dodge Challenge Cup over the Met section of the P.G.A. in a one-hole sudden-death playoff yesterday at Rockaway River Country Club at Denville, N.J. The two eight-player teams were tied at 72 points after a 27-hole format that included best-ball, alternate-shot and singles matches. Ed Whitman of Knickerbocker Country Club, forced the sudden death by taking 7 1/2 of 9 possible points in his singles match against Bruce Zabriski of Oyster Bay, L.I. New Jersey took the sudden-death playoff with a total of 34 strokes from its eight players, each of whom earned $500. The eight players from the Met section carded a total of 39 strokes and earned $300 each. TENNIS Lendl Breezes: Ivan Lendl powered to a 6-2, 6-0 victory over Mauro Menezes of Brazil last night to move into the second round of the Australian Indoor Championships at Sydney. In another first-round match, Mark Kratzmann of Australia stunned second-seeded Jakob Hlasek of Switzerland, 6-1, 2-6, 7-6. In second-round play, third-seeded Carl-Uwe Steeb of West Germany lost to Lars Wahlgren of Sweden, 1-6, 6-4, 6-4, and eighth-seeded Wally Masur of Australia was beaten by Thomas Hogstedt of Sweden, 5-7, 6-4, 6-2.(AP) McEnroe Advances: Top-seeded John McEnroe had to rally to beat Thierry Tulasne yesterday in the first round of the Toulouse Grand Prix tournament in France. McEnroe, who was down by 3-0 in the third set, beat the Frenchman, 4-6, 6-1, 7-6. McEnroe advanced to a second-round match against Ramesh Krishnan of India.(AP) Agassi Upset: Ronald Agenor of Haiti upset second-seeded Andre Agassi, 6-3, 6-2, yesterday in the opening round of the Hong Kong Marlboro Championships.(AP) Seles Beats Hanika: Monica Seles of Yugoslavia defeated Sylvia Hanika of West Germany, 6-3, 6-4, and Helena Sukova lost to her fellow Czechoslovak Radka Zrubakova, 6-3, 6-2, yesterday in the International tournament in Filderstadt, West Germany. Second-seeded Zina Garrison routed Elna Reinach of South Africa, 6-4, 6-1, and Mary Joe Fernandez easily put away Sandra Wasserman of Belgium, 6-1, 6-0. Dianne van Rendsburg of South Africa beat Claudia Porwik of West Germany, 7-5, 6-3.(AP) SOCCER England Gains World Cup Finals: England became the eighth nation to claim a spot in the 1990 World Cup finals by playing to a scoreless tie last night in Poland. The English team and the 40-year-old goaltender Peter Shilton did not give up a goal in six qualifying matches. England scored 10 times as it won three games and tied three. Other nations that have qualified are Italy, Spain, Yugoslavia, Argentina, Brazil, Uruguay and Costa Rica.(AP)

title: Weis Markets Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
May Stores To Sell Its Caldor Unit
description: Moving out of discount retailing after 19 years, the May Department Stores Company said yesterday that it had agreed to sell its 118-store Caldor chain and to spin off its 73-store Venture Stores unit.

title: Oil Is Found Off Angola
description: An international consortium led by Texaco Inc. has discovered high-quality crude oil in a previously unexplored area 17.5 miles off northern Angola, the company announced Tuesday. The well is producing more than 6,100 barrels a day from about a mile and a half below the ocean floor.

title:
Review/Dance;
Collaborators Join Again, But With a Different Effect
description: LEAD: Times have changed. Lucinda Childs, experimental dancer and choreographer, and Sol LeWitt, visual artist, collaborated on ''Dance'' in 1979. Miss Childs's choreography looked very pure and surprisingly rich within its deliberately repeated austere limits. Mr. LeWitt created film and lighting that reflected his concern with gridlike patterns and gave the dancing, sometimes simultaneous on film and on stage, an authentically solid dimension.

title: Washington Talk; Congress Takes Notice Of the Youngest Citizens
description: Baby-kissing is an old political tradition, but lobbyists for the babies have historically had a rough time translating photo opportunities into money and support.

title: Japan Lifts Discount Rate; Dollar Still Gains
description: The Bank of Japan surprised the foreign exchange market here today by abruptly raising its discount rate a half-percentage point in an effort to stem the dollar's surge. But the increase, announced at midday, had a negligible impact, prompting concerns that central banks are running out of tools for taming the dollar.

title: The Real Columbus Day, at Last
description: Notwithstanding the official U.S. holiday this Monday or New York City's Columbus Day parade last Friday, today is Columbus Day. It is the 497th anniversary of Christopher Columbus's first landing in the New World, properly celebrated as such in most of Latin America and the Caribbean.

title: PARENT & CHILD
description: A FEW weeks ago Sally Minard, an advertising executive in Manhattan, watched as her 15-year-old daughter, Gillian Garfinkle, went out on her first date with a boy.

title: Personal Health
description: Many women at or past the age of menopause are worried and confused about taking hormones to replace the ones their ovaries are no longer producing in ''adequate'' amounts.

title: Mario Fantini; Was Educator And Author, 62
description: Dr. Mario D. Fantini, a former dean of the School of Education at the University of Massachusetts at Amherst who had a major role in the decentralization of New York City's public schools, died Friday at Kaiser Permanente Hospital in Woodland Hills, Calif., after a long illness. He was 62 years old and lived in Woodland Hills. In the late 1960's, Dr. Fantini was one of those involved in establishing an experimental local school district in the Ocean Hill-Brownsville section of Brooklyn. It became the forerunner of the city's decentralized districts. He spent his career as an education reformer, advocating school systems with greater community participation and schools that were better adapted to urban students' needs.

title: Lebanese Official Cancels Speech to U.N.
description: Lebanon has canceled plans to address the United Nations General Assembly, while King Fahd of Saudi Arabia urged all Lebanese parties today to step up their efforts to reach an agreement in the current peace talks.

title: Give Economy Priority In Mayoral Campaign
description: To the Editor:

title: Virtues and Pitfalls of TV Pilots
description: Last month CBS announced a new policy of making pilots for weekly television series. CBS decided to spread out making pilots over the full year rather than concentrating it in the winter and spring, as all three networks traditionally have.

title: IP Timberlands Ltd reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The share earnings represented class A depositary units.

title: Edward Muldoon, 75, Petroleum Executive
description: Edward Gerard Muldoon, a retired petroleum executive, died Monday at his home in Hilton Head Island, S.C., after a short illness. He was 75 years old.

title: Hispanic Population Passes 20 Million, U.S. Says
description: As Congress wrestled with the question of whether illegal aliens, many of them Hispanic, should be included in the 1990 census, the Government announced today that the nation's Hispanic population had passed a statistical landmark this year, exceeding 20 million people for the first time.

title: Bridge
description: Few players realize that there are considerable opportunities for effective deceptive plays in the trump suit. There is, for example, a whole family of doubleton tenaces: jack-nine, queen-ten, king-jack and ace-queen. In each case, it is sometimes productive to play the higher honor unnecessarily and lead the declarer down a tempting path.

title: Provena Foods Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Fragrant Colors
description: To The Home Section:

title: Murdoch View On MGM/UA
description: Rupert Murdoch, owner of a multinational collection of publications and entertainment companies, said today that he was lukewarm about re-entering the race to take control of the MGM/UA Communications Company, which on Tuesday terminated a $1.5 billion agreement to be acquired by Qintex Australia Ltd. MGM/UA said its deal with

title: How the A's and the Giants Line Up
description: Catchers(Average, home runs, r.b.i.) 36Terry Steinbach (.273, 7, 42; .200, 0, 1) Hit .216 in second half of season and didn't do much in playoff. 24Ron Hassey (.228, 5, 23; .167, 0, 1) Could split time with Steinbach. Infielders(Average, home runs, r.b.i.) 25Mark McGwire 1b (.231, 33. 95; .389, 1, 3) Didn't hit for average in season but recovered in playoff, when only Lansford and Rickey Henderson hit better for A's. 2Tony Phillips 2B (.262, 4, 47; .167, 0, 1) His well-placed bunt helped win Game 1 of playoff, and his defense at second and third was sparkling. 9Mike Gallego ss (.252, 3, 30; .273, 0, 1) An exceptional defensive player who gave offensive punch to bottom of order in playoff. 4Carney Lansford 3b (.336, 2, 52; .455, 0, 4) Missed final two playoff games with pulled left hamstring but should be fine by Saturday. Outfielders(Average, home runs, r.b.i.) 24Rickey Henderson lf (.274, 12, 57; .400, 2, 5) Proved he can dominate a series. Will be Giants' chief concern if he gets on base, which he did 14 times in playoff. 42Dave Henderson cf (.250, 15, 80; .263, 1, 1) Had four extra-base hits in playoff. 33Jose Canseco rf (.269, 17, 57; .294, 1, 3) Recovered nicely after slow playoff start. Hit unforgettable home run into upper deck at Skydome in fourth game. D. H.(Average, home runs, r.b.i.) 39Dave Parker (.264, 22, 97; .188, 2, 3) Hit two homers in playoff, but slow strut around bases infuriated Blue Jays. Starting Pitchers(Record, e.r.a.) 34Dave Stewart rh (21-9, 3.32; 2-0, 2.81) Dogged competitor who won two games against Toronto and will likely open against Giants in Game 1. 23 Mike Moore rh (19-11, 2.61; 1-0, 0.00) Held Blue Jays to one unearned run in seven innings to win second game. Among league e.r.a. leaders in regular season. 14Storm Davis rh (19-7, 4.36; 0-1, 7.11) Lost third game of playoff but pitched into seventh inning. 35Bob Welch rh (17-8, 3.00; 1-0, 3.18) Had tired arm at end of season and struggled against Blue Jays, but he is veteran of A's staff. Relievers(Record, e.r.a., saves) 42Dennis Eckersley rh (4-0, 1.56, 33; 0-0, 1.59, 3) Saved three playoff victories and withstood accusations from Cito Gaston, Blue Jays' manager, that he doctors ball. 40Rick Honeycutt lh (2-2, 2.35, 12; 0-0, 32.40, 0) Miserable against Toronto, allowing 11 baserunners in one and two-thirds innings. But La Russa will still go to him. 19Gene Nelson rh (3-5, 3.26, 3; 0-0, 0.00, 0) Used once in playoff but ended season as A's hottest pitcher. 54Todd Burns rh (6-5, 2.24, 8; 0-0, 0.00, 0) Sat during playoff but appeared in 50 games during season. 20Matt Young lh (1-4, 6.75, 0; 0-0, 0.00, 0) Walked two batters in one-third of an inning against Toronto. 29Curt Young lh (5-9, 3.73, 0; 0-0, 0.00, 0) Started 20 games during season; sent to bullpen for playoff. Reserves(Average, home runs, r.b.i.) 12Lance Blankenship if (.232, 1, 4; .000, 0, 0) Appeared in one game after Lansford was hurt. 28Stan Javier of (.248, 1, 28; .000, 0, 0) Has exceptional glove. 7Walt Weiss ss (.233, 3, 21; .111, 0, 0) Seems recovered from regular-season defensive woes. 44Ken Phelps 1b (.242, 7, 29; 1.000, 0, 0) Hit pinch double in third game. Led league in pinch-hits. San Francisco Giants Catchers(Average, home runs, r.b.i.) 16Terry Kennedy (.239, 5, 34; .188, 0, 0) Slow-footed but experienced 10-year veteran of four clubs who arrived from Baltimore last winter. 17Kirt Manwaring (.210, 0, 18; .000, 0, 0) Backup catcher with an outstanding arm. Infielders(Average, home runs, r.b.i.) 22Will Clark 1b (.333, 23, 111; .650, 2, 8) Superman of San Francisco. Playoff most valuable player. The power partner to Kevin Mitchell. 6Robby Thompson 2b (.241, 13, 50; .278, 2, 3) No. 2 in lineup behind Brett Butler, and they set the stage for power, although he hit two home runs in playoff. 9Matt Willams 3b (.202, 18, 50; .300, 2, 9) No longer a strikeout pigeon. Hit 26 home runs in minor leagues in 76 games and 18 with Giants in 82 games. 23Jose Uribe ss (.221, 1, 30; .235, 0, 1) Not likely to sting you with bat, but led league's shortstops in chances and double plays. Outfielders(Average, home runs, r.b.i.) 7Kevin Mitchell lf (.291, 47, 125; .353, 2, 7) Cleanup hitter and power broker who led majors in home runs (47) and runs batted in (125). 2Brett Butler cf (.283, 4, 36; .211, 0, 0) The leadoff hitter and usually the catalyst in the Giants' attack who scored more than 200 runs in two years. 21Candy Maldonado rf (.217, 9, 41; .000, 0, 1) Veteran of seven seasons with Dodgers and Giants. 25Pat Sheridan rf (.205, 3, 14; .154, 0, 0) Platoon partner to the right-handed Maldonado. Starting Pitchers(Record, e.r.a.) 50Scott Garrelts rh (14-5, 2.28; 1-0; 5.40) Expected to pitch Series opener. 48Rick Reuschel rh (17-8, 2.94; 1-1, 5.19) At 40, Big Daddy was chased early in second game of playoff, but did better in fifth. 31Don Robinson rh (12-11, 3.43; 1-0, 0.00) Strained right knee remains a problem. 29Mike LaCoss rh (10-10, 3.17; 0-0, 9.00) Worked three stormy innings in playoff. Relievers(Record, e.r.a., saves) 40Steve Bedrosian rh (3-7, 2.87, 23; 0-0, 2.70, 3) Got into four of the five playoff games, and was there at the close of the final game. 40Jeff Brantley rh (7-1, 4.07, 0; 0-0, 0.00, 0) Serves as set-up man for Bedrosian. 19Kelly Downs rh (4-8, 4.79, 0; 1-0, 3.12, 0) Pitched eight innings of long relief games against Cubs. 14Atlee Hammaker lh (6-6, 3.76, 0; 0-0, 0.00, 0) Left-hander with experience, he was ranking starter until rotator-cuff surgery caused him to miss all of 1986 season. 32Craig Lefferts lh (2-4, 2.69, 20; 0-0, 9.00, 0) When Roger Craig needs a left-hander late in game, he will call for Lefferts. Reserves(Average, home runs, r.b.i.) 30Donell Nixon of (.265, 1, 15; .000, 0, 0) Stole 10 bases in 13 attempts. Will substitute anywhere in the outfield. 10Ken Oberkfell if (.269, 2, 17; .000, 0, 0) Led league with 18 pinch-hits. 1Ernest Riles if (.278, 7, 40; .000, 0, 0) Can supply some punch off the bench. 18Bill Bathe c (.281, 0, 6; .000, 0, 0) After nine years in minors, made the varsity this summer. 15Greg Litton if (.252, 4, 17; 1.000, 0, 0) Substitute at six positions.

title: ABORTION ACCESS STANDS IN FLORIDA
description: The Florida Legislature ended its special session on abortion today after killing every proposal by Gov. Bob Martinez for tougher state laws.

title: In Mayor Race, Help From Out of Town
description: Speaking at $80,000 a minute, President Bush, in just 10 minutes tonight, is expected to raise one-fourth or more of Rudolph W. Giuliani's mayoral campaign budget at a dinner in New York City.

title: Have the Democrats Lost Their Soul?; Yes: Blame Election Funds
description: Two things have happened to Congressional Democrats in the 1980's: They have lost their identity; their campaign funds have swollen. There's a single story here.

title: J.B. Hunt Transport Services Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
NEWS SUMMARY
description: INTERNATIONAL A3-19 A need exists in East Germany ''to discuss all the basic questions'' of the society, and to learn the causes of the flight of nearly 50,000 East Germans to the West, the country's ruling Politburo said. Page A1

title: Ex-Defense Official Appointed by Vickers
description: Sir Colin Chandler, the former head of the British Ministry of Defense's export services department, was appointed yesterday as managing director designate of Vickers P.L.C., an engineering, military equipment and luxury car group.

title: Laidlaw Transportation Ltd reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
description: b-After an extraordinary gain of $12,306,000, or 6 cents a share, for the quarter and year.

title: Health & Rehabilitaton Properties Trust reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Superior Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Share earnings in the third quarter reflected the 5-for-4 stock split issued July 12.

title: Andover Togs reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
Ferre's Clothes Dazzle, As Krizia's Softly Charm
description: The spring and summer collections here have taken a turn toward grandeur. Not content with the cheerful, relaxed look that has dominated the runways since the shows began on Saturday, Gianfranco Ferre presented a collection of elaborately styled ready-to-wear clothes that had the precision detailing of made-to-order fashions. Was he aiming at couture quality, Mr. Ferre was asked after his Tuesday night opening, which ended in a blaze of richly jeweled outfits fit for an Eastern potentate's wife.

title: Mcorp Unit to Ameritrust
description: The Ameritrust Corporation, a regional bank holding company based in Cleveland, has agreed to pay $120 million to acquire the Mvestment Corporation, the trust and investment subsidiary of Mcorp, the two companies said today.

title: Failed Coup Puts Noriega 'Out on Limb'
description: Within hours after the abortive coup attempt last week, soldiers had plastered over the bullet holes at army headquarters and touched up the paint. Gen. Manuel Antonio Noriega's base of power never looked better.

title: American President reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 22
description: Certain amounts for 1989 and 1988 were reclassified to conform to the 1989 presentation. Primary earnings available to common stock for the latest third quarter and 9 months are net of dividends on preferred stock of $3.4 million and $10.3 million, respectively; year-ago quarter and 9 months are $2.6 million and $6.1 million, respectively. The company said weighted average common shares for the latest 9 months reflected the repurchase of 500,000 and 4.4 million shares of the company's common stock during the first quarter of 1989 and fourth quarter of 1988, respectively. Additionally, weighted average common shares for the latest third quarter and 9 months reflected the conversion of 900,000 of the company's series B preferred stock during the third quarter.

title: Generic Drugs: Are They as Good as the Original?
description: Just how good are generic drugs?

title: Review/Film; 2 Old Sisters and a Love Interest for One
description: The best that can be said for ''An Unremarkable Life,'' the genteel soap opera opening today at Cinema 2, is that it strikes a blow against prejudice, provincialism, depression, loneliness and fear of the unknown. The worst to be said is that the blow lands with an awful thud.

title: Q-Med Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
P.L.O. Puts Off for 2 Years Application to Join Unesco
description: The P.L.O. today deferred for two years a longstanding bid to become a full member of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization.

title: Review/Television; Another Sleuth Joins the 'Mystery' Team
description: Reeling from the fast-paced adventures and rapid-fire jokes of network prime time? Relief is at hand. Tonight at 8 on Channel 13, ''Mystery'' begins its 10th season on public television. Now joining Miss Marple and Inspectors Morse and Dalgleish in this revolving repertory of sleuths from Britain is Albert Campion, who is a bit of a mystery himself. He uses pseudonyms and travels about with an odd manservant named Magersfontein Lugg, formerly a burglar.

title: Analysts Expect More Banks to Post Loan Losses
description: Led by large New York banks that have already announced plans to take heavy losses on their loans to less-developed countries, other banks are likely to report poor earnings for the third quarter, analysts say.

title: Toyota Sees Need to Expand Plants
description: The Toyota Motor Corporation's United States manufacturing cpaacity must increase by two-thirds to meet American sales expectations, a company official said.

title: United Insurance Co of Amerca reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago revenue figures are restated for accounting change.

title: Plan to Decommission Shoreham Lags
description: Three months after the Long Island Lighting Company gave final approval to the sale of its $5.5 billion Shoreham nuclear power plant to New York State, the reactor has been stripped of its uranium fuel rods and its staff has been reduced by more than a fourth.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; Financial World to Get A Redesign Next Month
description: Gentlemen's Quarterly became GQ, House & Garden became HG, and now Financial World magazine has announced that next month it will be transformed as FW. The new logotype and cover design for the magazine - whose name formally remains Financial World - reflect what its president and publisher says has been its gradual evolution to a more contemporary content.

title: Lexington Precision Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
description: b-Net income and included an extraordinary gain of $325,000, or 8 cents a share, from the utilization of loss carryforward. The company said that results for the latest first quarter included those of the business of Elastomeric Products Inc., which was acquired on Dec. 2, 1988, and the results of Wise Die Casting Inc. since June 29, the date the company acquired certain assets of Wise Die Casting Corp. The net in the year-ago first quarter included net gains from sales of marketable securities of $4,224,000 and writedowns of marketable securities of $428,000.

title: Senior Service Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
description: b-Net income

title: Hospital Must Pay $25,000 For Loss of a Stillborn Baby
description: The Westchester County Medical Center was ordered today to pay a Poughkeepsie woman $25,000 for losing the body of her stillborn baby in 1986.

title: Oh, What a Puss Has the Hippopotamus
description: To the Editor:

title: Decorating Remodeling Gets a New Top Editor
description: Olivia Buehl, a former editor and executive of the Working Woman/ McCall's Group, has been named editor in chief of Decorating Remodeling magazine, a publication of The New York Times Company Magazine Group. Ms. Buehl, 45 years old, was editor in chief of Working Mother and Home magazines, and, most recently, a consulting editor at Elle Decor magazine.

title: Second Debate In New Jersey Turns Nasty
description: In a debate that at times turned nasty, the candidates for governor of New Jersey clashed tonight on more than a dozen issues, including their records on abortion and whether teachers or children infected by the AIDS virus should be allowed to continue in the classroom.

title: Poll on Values Ranks Abortion Issue Low
description: Politicians who say they are fighting for family values by battling abortion and promoting prayer in school may be off target, a new study on the American family indicates.

title: The Israeli Occupation Must Come to an End; Worst of Situations
description: To the Editor:

title: A Mix of Roosevelt Island Housing Planned
description: New York City and New York State have developed a plan for almost 2,000 new mixed-income apartments on Roosevelt Island, next to the Queensboro Bridge.

title: Jackson Resorts To Raider Camp
description: Bo Jackson went from outfielder to running back yesterday when he reported to the Los Angeles Raiders. There was a chance he would play in a limited capacity Sunday against the Kansas City Chiefs. Jackson had a big year for the Kansas City Royals, hitting 32 home runs and driving in 105 runs. He took 10 days off before reporting to the Raiders for his third National Football League season. He reported just two days after the starting Los Angeles tailback, Marcus Allen, suffered a knee injury. (AP)

title: Notes on China; 2 Birthdays: Li's at a Villa and Zhao's Under Guard
description: Two of the best-known men in China celebrate their birthdays this month in their homes in the center of the capital, but they are unlikely to exchange cards.

title: In Suffolk, Taxpayers Want to Know Where School District's Money Goes
description: Over the last decade the number of students in public schools here has dropped by a third, to 4,212 from 6,441. But the cost of education has more than doubled. People say they do not know where the money goes.

title: Motorola Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company said the 1989 figures reflected a pre-tax provision of about $43 million to cover anticipated severance costs and decrease in the full- year tax rate.

title: Health Worker Seized In '70 Killing in West
description: A New York City Health Department employee was arrested at his East Village apartment yesterday and charged with the murder of a man in Los Angeles 19 years ago, the police said.

title: Candidates' Aides Argue on Debates
description: Both sides seemed confident and the atmosphere seemed agreeable when representatives of David N. Dinkins and Rudolph W. Giuliani met yesterday to schedule mayoral debates.

title: Study Cautious on Surgery For Some Small Aneurysms
description: Small bulging weak spots in the main blood vessel in the abdomen do not need to be routinely repaired in most patients, unlike large weak spots, researchers have concluded.

title: Koch Weighs Column In The New York Post
description: Mayor Edward I. Koch, whose byline has appeared over a number of newspaper columns in his term at City Hall, may become a columnist for The New York Post after he leaves office in January.

title: Orion Pictures Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
The Israeli Occupation Must Come to an End
description: To the Editor:

title: Criticized on AIDS Drug, Maker Will Give It to Some
description: A pharmaceutical company accused of overcharging for a drug that prevents pneumonia in people infected with the AIDS virus says it will give the drug away to the uninsured but will not reduce the price for others.

title: Federal National Mortgage Assn reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company said all share earnings reflected the 3-for-1 common stock split approved in September 1989.

title: Corrections
description: A brief article by The Associated Press on Aug. 18 about the denial of parole for Elmer (Geronimo) Pratt, a former Black Panther Party leader, referred incorrectly to his use of heroin. In a California parole hearing, remarks about his drug use dealt with the period before, not after, he was imprisoned for the murder of a woman in 1968.

title: Allegheny's Proposals
description: The beleaguered consumer products company Allegheny International Inc. today proposed two alternate reorganization plans, its seventh and eighth since filing for bankruptcy protection in February 1988. Allegheny is best known for its Sunbeam and Oster lines of appliances. As with Allegheny's earlier plans, the current ones have opposition. The company has already said that one creditor group, the Official Committee of Unsecured Creditors, has voted not to support either.

title: Kinark Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
7 Governors Apparently Balk At Sununu Atom-Waste Plea
description: Despite the personal intervention of the White House chief of staff, seven states today apparently resisted an effort by the Bush Administration to have them store radioactive waste from a nuclear weapons plant in Colorado.

title: Anthem Electronics Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an extraordinary credit of $583,000, or 5 cents a share, for both the quarter and 9 months.

title: The End of Forever
description: The greatest musical evocation of nature, for me, is Haydn's oratorio ''The Creation.'' As God creates the earth and its creatures, one hears them in instruments and voices: fields and mountains, eagles and whales and worms.

title: A's See Clark As Human
description: In the spring, when the emotions of two cities were far from the World Series that will draw them together this week, Dave Stewart pitched to Will Clark and struck him out. Twice.

title: Boddie-Noell Restaurant Properties Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
WD 40 Co reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
description: b-Included gain of $570,000 reimbursement on loss from California Insurance Guarantee Association.

title: A-PLANT NOMINEE FACES QUESTIONS
description: A Pennsylvania lawmaker charged today that the man nominated by President Bush to run the nation's troubled nuclear weapons complex has made contradictory statements to Congress about his conduct in a highly unusual investigation at the Nuclear Regulatory Commission.

title: USX Stock Drops
description: The USX Corporation's stock price slipped after the steel company adopted a shareholder rights plan that would make a hostile takeover more difficult. USX's shares were down 37.5 cents, to $37.75, on the New York Stock Exchange. Last week, the financier Carl C. Icahn said he had a 13.06 percent stake in USX.

title: Rare Thrill for Tass: Joshing Over Its U.F.O. Report
description: The report by the Soviet press agency Tass that lanky, three-eyed creatures took a stroll through a Soviet park last month has caused such reverberations in the United States that they have bounced back to Tass itself.

title: Ex-Military President Goes Free in Argentina
description: Leopoldo Galtieri, a former military President sentenced to 12 years in prison for leading Argentina into the disastrous war with Britain for control of the Falkland Islands, was freed today by presidential pardon.

title: Schiller Named Again To U.S. Committee Post
description: Harvey Schiller, the commissioner of the Southeastern Conference, was named yesterday as the new executive director of the United States Olympic Committee.

title: Buffalo Mayor Is Unopposed
description: A court ruling today barring Wilbur Trammell from the ballot means Mayor James Griffin of Buffalo has no active opposition in his bid for a fourth term. The New York Court of Appeals upheld a lower court ruling throwing out Mr. Trammell's independent line on the ballot for the Nov. 7 election. Mr. Trammell, a former City Court judge, did not get a spot on the Neighborhood First Party line because he failed to notarize a letter accepting the party candidacy.

title: The New Soviet Mafia
description: If you were a racketeer seeking huge monetary reward with little potential of getting caught, what racket would you choose and where would you go?

title: CVN Cos reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
description: b-After a loss from discontinued operations of $2,412,000 and a loss on disposal of discontinued operations of $6,900,000. c-Net loss d-Included losses from discontinued operations of $1,493,000 for the quarter and $1,751,000 for the year.

title: Summations Are Begun In Garcia Case
description: The prosecution's bribery case against Representative Robert Garcia and his wife, Jane Lee, is based entirely on the testimony of a ''liar, a perjurer and a thief,'' Mrs. Garcia's lawyer asserted yesterday in his summation to the jury.

title: Magma Power reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
U.S. Protests TV Limits
description: The United States formally challenged today a rule set by the European Community that puts informal limits on the amount of non-European-made programs that member nations may broadcast on their television stations.

title: Unisys Introduces Imaging Products
description: The Unisys Corporation introduced two systems that store images of checks and blueprints electronically. The company's Image Item Processing System will be available in the first quarter of 1990 for $1.5 million to $3 million. Combined with the software Image Check Processing System, it will allow high-speed image processing of checks for the banking industry.

title: Syrian Pilot of MIG-23 Is Said to Defect to Israel
description: A Syrian Air Force major flying a Soviet-made fighter-bomber landed in Israel today, stunning Israeli officials who said the pilot had asked for political asylum.

title: Thatched Roofs Come To the American Home
description: LEAD: THE brothers Cahill are hearing a lot more of the Irish poet Seamus Heaney's contemporary poem ''Thatcher'' here than they ever did in County Galway.

title: New Incentive
description: Female golfers, following the lead of the PGA and Senior Tours, will play a Skins game next year. The Ladies Professional Golf Association announced yesterday that Nancy Lopez, JoAnne Carner, Jan Stephenson and a golfer yet to be selected will play for $360,000 in prize money at the Stonebriar Country Club in Frisco, Tex., on May 26-27..(AP)

title: Books of The Times; Trying to Peer Into the Animal Mind
description: Lily Pond Four Years With a Family of Beavers By Hope Ryden Illustrated. 256 pages. William A. Morrow & Company. $17.95. A Cat Is Watching A Look at the Way Cats See Us By Roger A. Caras Illustrated. 238 pages. Simon & Schuster. $17.95.

title: 2 Killed in Plane Crash In Connecticut Woods
description: Two men were killed when their single-engine plane crashed tonight in a heavily wooded area near Route 3, the police said.

title: Service Merchandise reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income The company said that latest third- quarter expenses related to its recent recapitalization, including interest, totaled $22.5 million and reduced net earnings by 27 cents per share. Total recapitalization expenses reduce 9-month results by $14.4 million, or 28 cents a share. Year-ago per-share figures reflected a 3-for-2 stock split effective March 2.

title: Phone System Dumping Cited
description: Some small-business telephone systems and subassemblies from Japan and Taiwan are being dumped in the United States at less than fair value, the Commerce Department said today.

title: S.E.C. Chief Is Sworn In
description: At a private White House ceremony attended only by family and close friends, Richard C. Breeden was sworn in today as the 24th chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Avoiding Fish Eyes When Varnishing
description: LEAD: Today's varnishes, polyurethane included, are more efficient than their counterparts of not too long ago. Although faster drying, modern varnishes flow well enough to even out brush strokes. They also provide extremely durable protection for furniture surfaces, safeguarding them against the common hazards of day-to-day use.

title: Bandag Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Kidder Selling 8 Retail Offices
description: Kidder, Peabody & Company announced the sale Tuesday of eight Florida and Puerto Rico retail offices to Merrill Lynch & Company for undisclosed terms.

title: No Mitchell As Giants Rest and Regroup
description: The unauthorized absence of Kevin Mitchell upstaged routine activity this afternoon as the San Francisco Giants went through a workout at Candlestick Park, their first since winning the National League pennant in dramatic fashion here Monday.

title: Core Industries Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
description: The company said figures included operating results of Flexstar Inc. from Oct. 1, 1987, its effective date of acquisition. The company said earnings for both the fourth quarter and full year 1989 were severely impacted by weakness in the computer markets served by the electronic groups.

title: Catholic Draft Urges Palestinian 'Sovereignty'
description: Three Roman Catholic archbishops, including John Cardinal O'Connor of New York, have drafted a policy statement for the American church hierarchy calling for Palestinian ''territorial and political sovereignty.''

title: Vitro S.A. Offering
description: Vitro S.A. of Monterrey, Mexico, said today that it had received from Security Pacific National Bank a commitment to finance Vitro's entire $20-a-share tender offer for the Anchor Glass Corporation. Security Pacific committed $139 million to buy Anchor Glass shares, pay fees and expenses and pay interest due on margin facility notes.

title: Blacks for Giuliani: Outnumbered, but Pressing On
description: Rudolph W. Giuliani ended a hard day of campaigning one night last week in a long, narrow room in a Harlem restaurant. About 30 people were there for a reception sponsored by the New York State Black Republicans Council.

title: HOUSE, IN BIG SHIFT, VOTES TO RESTOR AID FOR ABORTIONS
description: In a significant policy reversal long sought by abortion rights advocates, the House of Representatives voted today to allow the Federal Government to pay for abortions for poor women whose pregnancies result from rape or incest.

title: Money Is Motive as Dinkins Takes Campaign Out of Town
description: He is running for mayor of New York City, but David N. Dinkins spent today in Washington, the fourth day out of the last six that he has campaigned in a place where there are no votes.

title: Computer Data Systems reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The latest share earnings included a gain of 12 cents a share from the sale of Warehouse land.

title: Corrections
description: A picture caption on Tuesday about the indictment of a sheriff and a police officer accused of a kidnapping plot in a town called Marietta misidentified the state. It is Oklahoma, not Georgia.

title: All New Yorkers Benefit From State Health Plan
description: To the Editor:

title: INSIDE
description: Squabbling on Tax Cuts Congressional negotiations continued on a budget deal that would provide a separate vote on the capital gains tax, but the talks were marked by partisan finger-pointing. Page D1. Nobel Prize in Economics An obscure Norwegian professor, Trygve Haavelmo, was honored for his work on methods for testing economic theories. Page D1. Syrian MIG Lands in Israel A Syrian Air Force pilot landed his MIG-23 in Israel, and officials there said he had defected. Syria said it was an emergency landing for mechanical reasons. Page A10. Life With Fewer Limits Down's syndrome children are leaving the shelter of special education for the real world of public schools and often harassment. Page C1.

title: Widow of Panama Coup Leader Says Fellow Plotter Betrayed Him
description: The widow of a Panamanian major who led an abortive military uprising against Gen. Manuel Antonio Noriega last week said today that the coup attempt had failed largely because of the treachery of another major, who changed sides at the last minute and led his troops to General Noriega's rescue.

title:
Have the Democrats Lost Their Soul?;
No: Consider The Tax War
description: LEAD: Democratic leaders are being roundly criticized for its strategy in the fight over cutting the capital gains tax. Some claim that, by attacking the measure as a give-away for the rich, the Democrats alienated the middle-class voters they need to attract. But the critics miss an important point: Most middle-class Americans agree with the

title: Structural Dynamics reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Surrounded By 'Nice Memories'
description: JULIAN TOMCHIN went for the 50's look; Russell Selman for the 30's. Mr. Tomchin, the vice president for creative development at Fieldcrest Cannon Inc. in New York, and Mr. Selman, a partner in the Chicago law firm of Bell, Boyd & Lloyd, separately chose to decorate their new offices with ''nice memories,'' as Mr. Tomchin put it.

title: Metropolitan Circuits Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 25
description: b-After a loss of $14,000 for the quarter and a gain of $5,652,000, or $2.25 a share, for the 6 months, both from discontinued operations. c-After losses from discontinued operations of $91,000 for the quarter and $699,000 for the 6 months. d-Net loss Metropolitan Circuits was formerly Nuclear Data Inc.

title: Reviews/Music; Dylan Dusts Off His Wit and Rage
description: Bob Dylan looked and sounded closer to his volatile mid-1960's self than he has in years on Tuesday evening at the Beacon Theater, where he played the first concert of a four-night engagement. By turns grimly triumphant, sarcastic and comically self-parodying, the singer, who is now 48 years old, conveyed much the same mixture of compressed fury and secret knowledge that defined his mystique more than 20 years ago.

title: A Kobacker Moves Up In Family Shoe Concern
description: The Kobacker Company, which operates a national shoe store chain, has another Kobacker in top management. Arthur J. Kobacker, chairman, yesterday announced the appointment of his son, Alfred J. Kobacker 2d, as president and chief operating officer.

title: CPC International reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Investors Acquire 7.3% of A.P. Green
description: A New York investment group led by two former executives of the Catalyst Energy Corporation has acquired a 7.3 percent stake in A. P. Green Industries. In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, East Rock Partners said that it might seek control of the maker of heat-resistant metals, which is based in Mexico, Mo.

title: Shelby Williams Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Profits of Gannett Rose By 11% in Third Quarter
description: The Gannett Company said yesterday that lower newsprint costs and cost controls at its USA Today newspaper helped profits rise 11 percent in the third quarter.

title: 2 Knicks Sit Out
description: Preparing for their preseason opener against the Denver Nuggets tomorrow night at Madison Square Garden, the Knicks had an intra-squad scrimmage last night at their State University training site in Purchase, N. Y. Mark Jackson and Kiki Vandeweghe did not participate. Jackson has been sidelined for the past three days with muscle soreness in both legs, while Vandeweghe, who arrived in training camp last Friday with back spasms, still has not worked out with the team. In the game, Ernie Grunfeld's Blue team defeated Paul Silas's White team, 87-86, on a free throw by Greg Butler with one second to play. Trent Tucker of the White team had 26 points. Rod Strickland led Blue with 24.

title: Bond Offering Failure Hurts Ramada Deal
description: Ramada Inc. said today that it had failed to raise $230 million in ''junk bond'' financing for a restructuring, threatening the company's deal to sell its hotel business.

title: Gannett Co reports earnings for 13wk to Sept 24
Deals
description: Baseball

title: Opening the World to a Generation
description: THEY talk on the telephone for hours with the same friends they saw that day at school. They want to hang out at the mall, to wear the latest style in jeans and sneakers. They want pierced ears. Their stereos could be a bit softer and their rooms a bit neater. Yet their parents could not be happier to see them behaving much as other teen-agers do.

title: CBS Profits Off 11.5% As Video Venture Lags
description: CBS Inc. said yesterday that its net income for the third quarter fell 11.5 percent, largely reflecting lower income from its videocassette joint venture.

title: Argonaut Group reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Minister Found Slain in Brooklyn Church
description: A 52-year-old Baptist minister was found slain in his church in the Bedford-Stuyvesant section of Brooklyn yesterday, the apparent victim of an attempted robbery, the police said.

title: Market Place; Shipping Outlook Divides Experts
description: SHIPPING executives are turning to stock markets to finance the creation of new shipping companies as the industry shows signs of recovery from an eight-year slump. The infusion of cash from Wall Street has contributed to nearly a tripling of second-hand ship prices over the last several years, but industry experts are divided on the long-term outlook for speculation in oceangoing vessels.

title: Early Surge and a Late Burst Carry Islanders Past Kings
description: The Islanders took a 5-1 lead over Los Angeles tonight, then survived a furious Kings comeback to emerge with a 7-4 victory.

title: United Telecom Links Units
description: United Telecommunications Inc. said yesterday that it would combine its local telephone and long-distance businesses, including the U S Sprint Communications Company.

title: Teledyne Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Talking Deals; How T.V.A. Got Big Refinancing
description: AFTER a 15-year absence from the public debt markets, the Tennessee Valley Authority will announce today that it plans to offer about $3 billion in bonds next week as the initial phase of a $6.7 billion refinancing, T.V.A. executives said yesterday.

title: Alvin Ailey Is Accused Of Neglecting Professorship
description: Some officials and students at the Borough of Manhattan Community College have accused Alvin Ailey of not appearing at many of the classes he was hired to teach. Mr. Ailey, the founder and director of the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater, resigned from his $80,000-a-year post as a distinguished professor at the college on Aug. 31.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; Accounts
description: * Roto-Rooter Services Co., to Ketchum Yellow Pages, a subsidiary of Ketchum Communications, with a budget of $4 million.

title: Calder's Witty Way With Castoffs
description: ''THE Intimate World of Alexander Calder,'' an exhibit that opens at the Cooper-Hewitt Museum in Manhattan on Oct. 17, takes the design-as-functional-object enthusiast further afield than ever before.

title: U.S. Tells of Its Concern About Olivetti
description: President Bush told the President of Italy today that the United States was concerned that an Italian company might have sold technology for a supersonic jetfighter to the Soviet Union, officials said.

title: COMPANY BRIEFS
description: * Cathay Pacific Airways, Hong Kong, ordered two Boeing 747-400 cargo planes and secured options on two more. Terms were not disclosed.

title: Ex-Navajo Chairman Charged With Crimes
description: Peter MacDonald, the suspended Navajo Tribal Chairman, was accused today of 111 criminal charges, including bribery, fraud, conspiracy and elections violations while he led the nation's largest Indian tribe.

title: Edgar Smith, 69, Dies; Retired Time Executive
description: Edgar P. Smith, a magazine and broadcast executive with Time Inc. who originated the ''Fortune 500'' list of the country's largest businesses, died of cancer Tuesday at Morristown (N.J.) Memorial Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived in Mendham Township, N.J.

title: Reviews/Music; 'Holy Blood,' Opera Written by a Rock Drummer
description: The ballyhoo was extreme for the world premiere Tuesday night of Stewart Copeland's opera, ''Holy Blood and Crescent Moon.'' And at the end, this first operatic effort by Stewart Copeland, the drummer of the former rock band the Police, received a standing ovation, with especially fervent cheers from the younger, hipper members of the audience.

title: Wrangling On Gains Tax Continues
description: Congressional negotiations on a budget deal that would provide a separate vote on cutting the capital gains tax continued today, marked by a round of partisan finger-pointing.

title: Companies
description: May Department Stores agreed to sell Caldor and to spin off its Venture Stores unit, ending 19 years of business in discount retailing. Caldor will be sold to an investor group that includes members of management for $500 million in cash and the assumption of $52 million in debt and lease obligations. [ Page D1. ]

title: Percival Goodman, 85, Synagogue Designer, Dies
description: Percival Goodman, an architect, planner and artist who was one of the nation's leading designers of synagogues, died of lung cancer yesterday at Beth Israel Hospice in New York. He was 85 years old and lived on the Upper West Side of Manhattan and in a house of his own design in East Hampton, L.I.

title: On Field or Off, Eckersley Battles
description: When the Toronto Blue Jays' manager, Cito Gaston, interrupted the final inning of the American League Championship Series last week to have umpires check Dennis Eckersley's glove for a foreign substance, the Athletics' top reliever grew stormy. He had never had his glove checked before, he told reporters later. His anger, according to those who saw it, seemed to have been too genuine to be faked.

description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: New Federal Phone System
description: The first phase of the Government's new telephone system officially went into service yesterday, providing Federal employees at 29 locations nationwide with faster, clearer communications services. The new system, known as

title: Dow Off 11.97 in Reaction to Weaker Bonds
description: Stocks ended lower yesterday as a weaker bond market and the selling of blue-chip issues pushed equities down for the second day.

title: Small Airline Merger Offer
description: StatesWest Airlines Inc., a small regional carrier based in Phoenix, said today that it had sent a letter to Mesa Airlines Inc. of Farmington, N.M., proposing that the two airlines meet within 10 days to discuss a merger.

description: Archbishop Desmond M. Tutu and two other clergymen met today with President F. W. de Klerk in the President's first in-depth meeting with leaders of the anti-apartheid movement since he took office last month.

description: William Barclay Allen has been seeking to resign as chairman of the United States Civil Rights commission, but the White House has yet to accept the resignation, which was first offered five weeks ago, Government officials said today.
