President Soft-Pedals Flag Measure
description: After advancing a constitutional amendment as the only certain way to protect the American flag from desecration, President Bush has held back from an all-out effort to save the proposal in the Senate, Congressional and Administration officials said today.

title: U.S. Seeks to Stop Brazil's Missile-Technology Deal
description: The Bush Administration has begun a campaign to dissuade France from selling Brazil rocket-motor technology that American officials say could be used to make ballistic missiles.

title: Currents; It Isn't Lace at All, It's Painted Furniture
description: PENWORK is an intricate decorating technique that involves painting patterns in white gesso on dark varnishes or black paint. It reached its peak in England and Scotland in the mid-1820's. Some of the finest examples of the genre have been assembled in a charming exhibition, ''Penwork, the Triumph of Line,'' which runs through Nov. 10 at Hyde Park Antiques, 836 Broadway (13th Street) in Manhattan.

title: Washington Bancorp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
China Weighs New Restrictions on Study Abroad
description: China is circulating confidential documents that would impose tough new restrictions on young people planning to study abroad, including a requirement that they first work for up to seven years after graduation from college, officials say.

title: James M. Fulton, 75, Ex-Executive at Merck
description: James M. Fulton, a former executive at Merck & Company in Rahway, N.J., died of a heart attack on Monday at his home in Martha's Vineyard, Mass. He was 75 years old.

title: To Readers
description: Because of the earthquake in California, trading of options at the Pacific Stock Exchange in San Francisco was suspended yesterday.

title: Shamir Faulted on Mideast Remarks
description: The Bush Administration, increasingly frustrated by what it calls obstructionist moves by Prime Minister Yitzhak Shamir of Israel, publicly criticized him today for making remarks that were disappointing and ''unhelpful'' to the Middle East peace process.

title: Corrections
description: An article in The Home Section on Oct. 5 about tours, exhibitions and lectures on New York City's history and future characterized the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge incorrectly. Its suspension span, 4,260 feet, was the world's longest when the bridge opened in 1964, but it was surpassed in 1981 by the Humber Bridge, near Hull, England, with a central span of 4,626 feet.

title: Debt Limit Increase Is Sought
description: The Treasury Department has formally notified Congress that it would like to have an increase in the national debt ceiling in place by Oct. 24 to permit planning for Treasury bond auctions and avoid a default on Government obligations when the current ceiling expires on Oct. 31.

title: Hexcel Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
3 Crushed by Skidding Truck That Hits Jeep in New Jersey
description: Three New York residents were killed today when their vehicle was crushed by a tractor trailer carrying compressed garbage, the state police said.

title: Home Improvement
description: FALL is an ideal time to clean and protect outdoor metal items. Ridding them of rust and corrosion before storage prevents deterioration in the winter.

title: Southtrust Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30

How Agencies Fared in Quake
description: Advertising people in San Francisco responded to the earthquake that occurred Tuesday with a characteristic mixture of ingenuity and good humor. A dozen employees of Hal

title: Cabaret Convention Ponders a Disturbing Future
description: Is there a place for cabaret in today's age of mass entertainment? That is the question being pondered this week on the stage of Town Hall, where a Cabaret Convention is holding a series of discussions and gala concerts that will continue through Sunday.

title: Nine Mile Pt. 2 Nuclear Plant Is Shut by Utility After Leak
description: The Nine Mile Point 2 nuclear power plant was shut at 4:22 A.M. today, when the owner, the Niagara Mohawk Power Corporation, learned of a higher-than-normal leak rate in a drywell in the containment structure, the utility said in a release.

title: Fetisov's First N.H.L. Goal Helps Devils Defeat Flyers
description: With Vyacheslav Fetisov, the heralded Soviet defenseman, shining brightly for the second consecutive game, and Sean Burke making timely saves, the Devils tonight posted their second straight triumph.

title: National Banc of Commerce Co. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
China's Grain Harvest
description: Despite higher prices and investment, China's grain harvest will fail to match the 1984 record for the fifth straight year, according to an official report issued today. The Economic Information newspaper said the 1989 harvest would be more than last year's 394 million tons, but would fall short of the record of 407.3 million in 1984 because of natural disasters in the northeast and Inner Mongolia.

title: Corrections
description: The Sports of The Times column on Tuesday misidentified the 1955 World Series game in which Roger Craig was the winning pitcher for the Brooklyn Dodgers against the Yankees. It was the fifth game, not the third.

title: Milk Paint, for an Authentic Old Look
description: LEAD: Many a priceless original milk-paint finish has been lost. Perhaps this was because of the misguided notion that an ''Early American look'' consisted of wood with a clear finish. Perhaps it was simply that, compared with modern paints available in every imaginable color, old milk paint must have seemed insipid to many.

title: Bell Units' Nets Vary In Quarter
description: Two Bell holding companies, BellSouth and Ameritech, today reported third-quarter earnings in line with Wall Street's expectations, despite significant one-time charges.

title: Jail for Ex-Inspector In a Bribery Case
description: A former state Department of Environmental Conservation inspector was sentenced yesterday to six months in prison for tax evasion related to bribes she took from reputed organized crime figures.

title: Review/Theater; Fighting Trash With Trash In a Nihilistic Puppet Show
description: Almost as soon as the Smiths, a family of six from the Bronx, have been shown a cozy new suburban home in Garden City, L.I., their allergies begin to act up. First they begin to sneeze. Soon their quarrelsome twin sons have developed itchy rashes, and before long Grandma is suffering from schizophrenic seizures. Ultimately, the family cannot survive the trial live-in period they have been given by the real-estate agent, for the chemicals in the rugs, furniture and air freshener have turned the place into a death trap.

title: Crown Cork & Seal reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Mozart Opera To Open Season In Brooklyn
description: The Brooklyn Academy of Music's second opera season will open at the academy's Majestic Theater on March 15 with a production of Mozart's ''Finta Giardiniera'' from the Theatre de la Monnaie in Brussels. The company is to announce the season today.

title: Why No Debates - or Debate?
description: Would that David Dinkins, who has handled New York's racial tensions with such skill and sensitivity, showed as much skill in agreeing to campaign debates. There's been no encounter between him and Rudolph Giuliani, and at this rate it looks as if there may never be one - largely because Mr. Dinkins continues to duck.

title: American Home Products reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company said the latest quarter and 9-month results benefited from a lower effective tax rate, which reflects a reduction of foreign tax rates and benefits obtained from additional operations in Puerto Rico and from a gain on the sale of all of the company's equity interests in South Africa.

title: Renault in Dutch Vehicle Venture
description: Renault S.A., the French auto maker, said it had signed a letter of intent to create a joint venture with the Dutch company DAF to make light commercial vehicles. Renault's vice chairman, Philippe Gras, said the two groups would share research and development costs of around one billion francs.

title: Q&A
description: Low Water Pressure Q. Is there a safe, economical way to improve the water pressure in my 75-year-old house? A. First, make sure that the water pressure coming into the house is up to par. You can ask your local water company to check this, or a plumber can put a pressure gauge on the incoming line to make sure the pressure is adequate.

title: Morrison Knudsen Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss and after losses from discontinued operations of $1,864,000 for the quarter and $57,469,000 for the 9 months.

title: Animal Rights Activists Endanger Medical Research; Vigilant Protocol
description: To the Editor:

title: Planners Approve a Lab Atop F.D.R. Drive
description: A proposal by Rockefeller University to build a 12-story biomedical laboratory building over the Franklin D. Roosevelt Drive was approved unanimously yesterday by the New York City Planning Commission.

title: Champion International Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Modine Mfg reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 26
N.C.A.A. Council Seeks Reforms <
description: In a series of moves that supported calls for reform in intercollegiate sports, the National Collegiate Athletic Association's Council today called for year-round, random drug-testing and endorsed mandatory disclosure of graduation rates for student-athletes.

title: Manville Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After income from discontinued operations of $24,089,000, or 20 cents a share, representing gain on disposal of discontinued operations. c-After income from discontinued operations of $2,862,000, or 2 cents a share, for the quarter and $5,347,000, or 4 cents a share, for the 9 months; the 9 months also included an accounting adjustment loss of $106,937,000 from the cumulative effect of a change in accounting for income taxes.

title: L.I. Saboteur Tried to Spread Asbestos, Police Say
description: A saboteur ripped insulation laced with asbestos from pipes in two Nassau County government buildings and placed it in front of air-circulation fans, the police said today.

title: Creditors Question Eastern
description: The unsecured creditors of Eastern Airlines voted unanimously at their meeting Tuesday to have their own financial advisers examine alternative approaches to the airline's plans for its emergence from bankruptcy. That could lead to the creditors' considering presenting their own plan to the court, people who were told of the results of the meeting said yesterday.

title: INSIDE
description: Stock Market Stabilizes; Pressure on 'Junk Bonds'

title: United Technologies reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago third-quarter results included a pretax gain of $33.3 million in its year-ago third quarter from the sale of leasing units. Year-ago 9-month results included a pretax gain of $156 million from the sale of its Essex unit and the leasing business of UT Credit Corp.. a pretax gain of $41.4 million from the sale of its share of a German semiconductor joint venture, and charges from restructuring aggregating $148.8 million.

title: 2 on S.I. Run a Neck-and-Neck Race
description: Two of Staten Island's most prominent politicians - Ralph J. Lamberti and Representative Guy V. Molinari -are waging a vigorous battle for the office of borough president.

title: Cycare Systems Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company said that its pension plan was dissolved during the latest third quarter, resulting in a one-time increase in revenues of $520,000 and an increase in earnings of 5 cents a share.

title: American Precision Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Critic's Notebook; Louisville Delves Deeply Into Russian Theater
description: Several hundred stage directors, teachers and scholars specializing in Russian studies, including visitors from the Soviet Union, took part this weekend in a marathon of plays, lectures and panels at the Actors Theater of Louisville. The events were a climax to a citywide ''Classics in Context'' celebration of the arts in Russia, initiated by Jon Jory, artistic director of the Louisville theater.

title: Brand Cos.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Animal Rights Activists Endanger Medical Research
description: To the Editor:

title: Columbus Energy Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
Corrections
description: An article in Weekend on Friday about foliage and farm stands gave an incorrect telephone number for the Kohlmaier Farm in Hopewell Junction, N.Y. Its number is (914) 226-5028.

title: First Home Savings Bank reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
F&M National Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Fisher Transportation ServFices reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
description: b-Net income

title: Maryland Under Scrutiny
description: The Maryland men's basketball program, which has spent three years in the shadow of the cocaine-related death of Len Bias, now has to respond to accusations of at least 19 violations by a National Collegiate Athletic Association investigation.

title: Wang Loses $62.1 Million
description: Wang Laboratories Inc. today reported a $62.1 million loss for the first quarter, ended Sept. 30, and predicted losses would continue for much of the next year as it restructured in an attempt to bring about a turnaround.

title: G.E. to Eliminate 450 Appliance Jobs
description: The General Electric Company said it would eliminate about 450 jobs in the next three years in the home laundry manufacturing operations at its major appliance plant here. G.E. said it would shift some manufacturing work to subcontractors to cut costs. The affected jobs will be eliminated through attrition.

title: Continental Bank Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain of $55 million from sale of a building, partially offset by a $10 million charge for certain reserve requirements, and a $9 million loss from disposition of a unit. c-Included a $29 million gain from sale of certain operations and a $6 million gain from release of earlier restructuring reserves.

title: Straining Phone System Survives 20 Million Calls
description: The nation's telecommunications network was flooded Tuesday night by an estimated 20 million attempted telephone calls from people concerned about friends and family after the earthquake in the Bay area.

title: Dayton Hudson Offer
description: The Dayton Hudson Corporation, the big retail chain based here, said today that it had accepted for purchase seven million of its common shares, at $62.875 apiece, in response to its Dutch auction self-tender offer, which expired on Tuesday. The company said it had received about 7,141,000 shares tendered at that price or below. The final terms will be determined soon, it said, and payment for shares is expected to be made next Thursday.

title: The Reagans' Host: A Japan Media Giant
description: When Ronald and Nancy Reagan arrive here on Friday for an eight-day stay in Japan, the Government will naturally roll out the carpet, but their main host will be a communications empire that permeates daily life in Japan although it is scarcely known abroad.

title: Unocal Thailand
description: Unocal Thailand said today that it plans to spend $2 billion in the next 10 years to develop offshore natural gas fields in the Gulf of Thailand. A spokesman for the company, a unit of the Unocal Corporation of the United States, said about $1.4 billion would be capital investment and the rest operating costs. Around $930 million of the total would be spent in the next five years. Earlier, Unocal said it had reached an agreement with state-owned Petroleum Authority of Thailand to develop gas fields in the gulf. Unocal Thailand is Thailand's largest natural gas supplier.

title: Move Seen on Oil Stockpile
description: The Bush Administration will stop buying Mexican oil for the United States emergency stockpile early next year, ending an eight-year supply link aimed in part at aiding the debt-ridden Mexican economy, people close to the situation said today.

title: Close to Home
description: ''THIS street is getting very lively,'' I said, impressed by the snappy dressers and snappier restaurants I'd seen on what had once been a desolate stretch of the Upper West Side. ''Too lively,'' my hostess replied. ''I just had my wallet stolen.''

title: Federal Signal Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Watkins-Johnson reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain of $2,858,000, or 34 cents a share, resulting from the Iran- U.S. claims tribunal judgment in favor of the company reported Aug. 7.

title: Boatmen's Bancshares Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Buckeye Partners LP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Share earnings represent unit earnings.

title: Yellow Freight System reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Wings Stop Stars
description: Steve Yzerman had two goals and an assist as the Detroit Red Wings beat Minnesota, 4-3, tonight and handed the North Stars their first loss of the season.

title: Great Western Financial reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The latest quarter reflected a reduction in one-time gains on the sale of various assets and an increase in the company's provision for loan losses. Share earnings are fully diluted.

title: ETHICS COMMITTEE SCOLDS LAWMAKER
description: The House ethics committee scolded a California Congressman today for sexually harassing women on his staff.

title: Insurers Tallying, But Policies on Houses Are Few
description: As damage estimates from the California earthquake exceeded a billion dollars, hundreds of insurance claims adjusters moved into the area yesterd day to assess the devastation and pay claims.

title: SUNY Buffalo Fails Tuition Audit Again
description: The State University of New York in Buffalo fails to make sure all students have paid tuition by the first day of classes, Comptroller Edward Regan said in an audit today.

title: Near Normal Life Resumes for Many in San Francisco After Flurry of Work
description: The trolleys were running again today.

title: Campaign Matters; For Messinger, Making Friends With Old Foes
description: Ruth W. Messinger was running for higher office well before she decided on the particular office - the Manhattan borough presidency, as it turned out - but she does not seem to be waiting for the election to begin her new line of work.

title: Green Says He's Been Offered Reds' Job
description: Dallas Green, who was dismissed in August before completing his first season as manager of the Yankees, said yesterday he had been offered the Cincinnati Reds' managing job by Marge Schott, the owner. But Bob Quinn, newly named the Reds' general manager after holding that job with the Yanks, said the post had not been offered to anyone.

title: Bernstein and Copland
description: Leonard Bernstein is to conduct the New York Philharmonic this month in four performances of an all-Copland program. The concerts, at Avery Fisher Hall, will take place today and Saturday at 8 P.M., Friday at 2 P.M. and Oct. 24 at 7:30 P.M. The works to be played are ''Music for the Theater,'' ''Connotations,'' the Clarinet Concerto and ''El Salon Mexico.'' Tickets are $40 to $10. Information: 874-2424.

title: DFSoutheastern reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: DFSoutheastern completed its conversion to a stock thrift from a mutual thrift institution in September 1988; accordingly, 1988 per share earnings is not available. The 1988 earnings included a gain from the sale of Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp. preferred stock of $885,000.

title: Newhall Land & Farming reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Corrections
description: An article on Friday about nominations for the 1989 National Book Awards misidentified the publisher of ''Barbarian Sentiments: How the American Century Ends,'' by William Pfaff. It is Hill & Wang, a division of Farrar, Straus & Giroux.

title: Man Convicted Again For a Murder in 1983
description: A man whose life was twice spared by the State Supreme Court after two separate murder convictions has again been convicted of the 1983 sexual assault and murder of an Asbury Park woman. The conviction could be used against the man, Marko Bey, 24 years old, when he is resentenced for killing another woman in 1983.

title: Stone & Webster reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included net of $2,774,000, or 18 cents a share, from the sale of investment securities. c-Included net of $2,823,000, or 19 cents a share, and $8,577,000, or 57 cents a share, from the sale of investment securities for the quarter and 9 months, respectively.

title: Partners in UAL Buyout Offer Continue to Maneuver
description: Efforts continued yesterday to reassemble a takeover bid for the UAL Corporation, the parent of United Airlines, and one partner in the bid, British Airways, said it hoped a new proposal would be forthcoming from its other partners, United's pilots and management.

title: Poetry, Not Chintz, in New York's First French Show House
description: Forget Fine French Furniture, Art Deco and Provencale. Le Style Francais - the French style - has just landed in town, and it is anything and everything but what you might expect. The occasion is the French Designer Showhouse, the first to be held in the United States.

title: Goodbye to Glasnost
description: On the night of Oct. 1, in the kitchen of the Hotel Leningrad, cooks and waiters and other workers assembled around a television set and watched, transfixed, as the American Jim Lehrer interviewed Boris Yeltsin for 23 minutes in English, with Russian dubbed in.

title: Adaptec Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 29
Viacom Posts Loss in Quarter
description: Viacom International Inc., the cable and entertainment company that owns Showtime Networks Inc. and MTV Networks, reported yesterday that despite sharply higher revenues and operating earnings it had a net loss in the third quarter.

title: When Businesses and Schools Join Hands, Everybody Benefits
description: To the Editor:

title: Small University Gains Control Of the Barnes Foundation
description: With the recent election of two new trustees, control of the Barnes Foundation, which owns one of the world's most important collections of late-19th- and early-20th-century art, has passed to Lincoln University, a small, predominantly black liberal-arts college in Oxford, Pa.

title: Monsanto Co. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Newmil Bancorp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Ball Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 1
description: b-Included a gain of $17.8 million, or 77 cents a share, from cumulative effect of accounting change and a gain of $3.6 million, or 16 cents a share, from disposition of investment.

title: National Convenience Stores reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included $3,613,000 after-tax gain from sale of 37 stores in September 1989.

title: AMR Tells Trump It's Not for Sale
description: In its first public comment on takeover overtures from Donald J. Trump, the board of the AMR Corporation said today that the company ''has not been, and is not, for sale.''

title: Judge Says Hospital Can Take Queens Baby Off Respirator
description: A baby who has been declared brain dead can be removed from life-support equipment despite his parents' opposition, a judge ruled yesterday.

title: Nacco Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Nacco said 1989 results included Hyster Co., acquired in May. The company said 1988 results included non-recurring income equaled to 48 cents a share in the quarter and $1.42 a share for the 9 months from adjustment in estimated income tax liabilities.

title: THE CALIFORNIA QUAKE: The Highway Collapse; The Desperate Struggle for Lives Along I-880
description: Disbelieving rescue workers and loved ones converged around crumpled Interstate Highway 880 today, filled with the desperate hope that a few more lives could be saved. But they could do little. What they found only confirmed their most horrible first impressions of the unreal sight of one roadway lying upon another.

title: An Arab-American Group Says Dinkins Shuns Its Help
description: A group of Arab-Americans in New York City say David N. Dinkins's mayoral campaign has spurned their offers of help because of exaggerated fears of alienating Jewish voters.

title: Suspect in Car Theft Is Killed By an Officer in Larchmont
description: A police officer shot and killed a suspected car thief who had fired a shot that struck the officer's gunbelt but did not injure him, the police said today.

title: Number of Nation's Poor Remains at 32 Million for a Second Year
description: The number of Americans living below the official poverty level remained at nearly 32 million people for a second straight year in 1988 even though average individual income reached an all-time high of $13,120, figures released today by the Federal Census Bureau showed.

title: Chemical Financial reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Seacoast Banking Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Seoul Leader Offers Assurances To Congress Over Import Markets
description: President Roh Tae Woo of South Korea sought to assure Congress today that his nation would open its developing markets to foreign imports quickly and that anti-Americanism in his country was limited to a handful of radicals.

title: Network Equipment Technoloies Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 1
First Fedl Savings Bank of Tenn.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included $95,140 after-tax gains on the sale of a portion of its Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp. preferred stock.

title: Pioneer-Standard reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Sumitomo Bank Calif.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Maxxam Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a gain of $6.1 million on disposition of Maxxam's oil, gas and geothermal operations in the third quarter of 1988.

title: Article 664789 -- No Title
description: The New York State Court of Claims yesterday awarded a record $1.93 million to a Brooklyn man who spent six years in state prisons for a murder and robberies he did not commit.

title: Soviets, Vividly Recalling Earthquake Tragedy in Armenia, Offer Aid to U.S.
description: The Soviet Union offered its condolences and assistance to the United States today because of the California earthquake.

title: KEY RATES
National City Bancorp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Review/Dance; The Merger Of Nikolais And Louis
description: Alwin Nikolais and Murray Louis have fused their two separate dance troupes into a new company called Nikolais and Louis Dance, which made its New York debut on Tuesday night.

title: BellSouth Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary loss on early debt retirement, net tax, of $22,300,000 for both the quarter and 9 months, and 9 months also included a gain of $68,400,000. or 14 cents a share, from cumulative effect of an accounting change, net of tax.

title: Dow Chemcial reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary loss of $12,000,000 due to early extinguishment of debt.

title: Moscow Journal; Wanted by the Opposition: A Full Campaign Chest
description: In July, when a minority faction of the Congress of People's Deputies opened the first political fund in the nation, they invited supporters to dig into their wallets and pull out contributions.

title: Pacific Board Option Move
description: Trading in all options on individual stocks listed on the Pacific Stock Exchange will be moved temporarily to other exchanges because of the earthquake Tuesday in San Francisco.

title: Apple Bancorp Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After extraordinary tax loss carryforwards of $1,250,000, or 26 cents a share, for the quarter and $3,941,000, or 85 cents a share, for the 9 months.

title: Campaign Trail; Dinkins Says His Staff Was Wrong To Vote on Broadcasting Company
description: Claiming a busy schedule, David N. Dinkins decided to forgo scheduled trips to Chicago and Detroit yesterday and instead sent surrogates to fund raisers in his honor in both cities.

title: An Integrated Independence for Baltics?
description: To the Editor:

title: SPORTS PEOPLE: TRACK and FIELD; Nebiolo Named Again
description: Primo Nebiolo, who was ousted as president of the Italian track and field federation amid a business scandal, was re-elected president of the Association of Summer Olympic Federations yesterday.

title: Resolution Funding in $4.5 Billion Bond Sale
description: The Resolution Funding Corporation, established by Congress last summer to finance the bailout of the nation's savings and loan industry, announced yesterday that it would auction $4.5 billion worth of 30-year bonds to the public next Wednesday.

title: Status of Travel And Phones
description: The status of national transportation and communication services in the San Francisco area:

title: East Germany: What Hasn't Changed
description: Erich Honecker, the builder of the Berlin Wall, was ousted as East Germany's boss after it became obvious he symbolized an intolerable status quo in a country clamoring for change. But the wall still stands; so does the suffocating political and economic system it is meant to protect.

title: Santa Cruz Grieves and Tries to Cope With Loss of Much of Business Area
description: Fifteen miles south of the epicenter of the California earthquake, the scene today in the streets of Santa Cruz was a surrealistic mixture of festivity and grief.

title: New Measure Finds Growing Hardship for Youth
description: The well-being of children in America has declined dramatically since 1970, according to an index that measures aspects of ''social health'' like infant mortality and drug abuse.

title: Currents; New Wrinkle in Porcelain
description: ''A FRIEND who is an artist always came to dinner wearing a wrinkled shirt,'' Angela Cummings said, ''so I decided to make some tableware that looked wrinkled, just to tease him.''

title: Keystone Financial reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Georgia Gulf reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Bigger One Is Believed Still Ahead
description: Despite the devastating effects of the earthquake Tuesday, it was not nearly as strong as either the great quake that struck San Francisco in 1906 or the great quake that most seismologists believe will strike the Bay area sooner or later.

title: Who's Egon Krenz? He's No Gorbachev
description: Who is Egon Krenz? As of yesterday, the 52-year-old is the new No. 1 in East Germany, after General Secretary Erich Honecker resigned for ''health reasons.'' Is Mr. Krenz another Mikhail Gorbachev? Or is he a German version of Konstantin Chernenko, the tired old apparatchik who took over in Moscow after the deaths of Leonid Brezhnev and Yuri Andropov?

title: 3 Drug Makers Post Mixed Results
description: Three large drug companies yesterday reported mixed results in third-quarter earnings, but analysts said the results at each company were in line with expectations.

title: Sam Moore, 85, Writer Of Comedy for Radio
description: Sam Moore, a writer for radio in the 1930's and 1940's on such comedy programs as ''The Great Gildersleeve,'' died of a heart attack on Friday while he was on vacation in France. He was 85 years old and lived in Blairstown, N.J.

title: MAN IN THE NEWS: Egon Krenz; East German With New Job
description: On his first visit to West Germany in June, Egon Krenz and the members of his delegation spoke knowledgeably of choice foods, fine wines and the privileges of power, three topics most of their compatriots can only dream about.

title: Upsala Calls Time To Fetch Quarterback
description: The established reasons to call a time out in a football game include halting the clock, making a substitution or a strategic decision, even rattling an opponent's field-goal kicker.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: * American Express Travel Related Services Co. named Louis M. Laguardia senior vice president of human resources and Margaret M. Gagliardi senior vice president of compensation, benefits and staffing.

title: A.P. Green Says It Is Not for Sale
description: The management of A. P. Green Industries has rebuffed an investment partnership that said it was considering a bid for the Mexico, Mo., heat-resistant metals concern. In a Securities and Exchange Commission filing, the partnership, East Rock Partners, said H. M Stover, A. P. Green's chairman, told it last Friday that ''the company was not for sale.''

title: Quakes Expose the Gold
description: LEAD: Nobody here was surprised. Even as we cope with the grief, the clean-up and the aftershocks, we know that it is inevitable: Sure as there are hurricanes in the Caribbean and blizzards in Buffalo, we get earthquakes.

title: Review/Theater; Heat on Many Levels, in Sally Nemeth's 'Mill Fire'
description: Three widows stare ominously from behind black tulle veils while the audience files in to Sally Nemeth's play ''Mill Fire'' at the Apple Corps Theater. ''Mill Fire'' is, thankfully, not as grim as the visages of those three women: its young heroine, Marlene, another widow, refuses to grieve in the conventional, quiet mode thought proper in Birmingham, Ala., in 1978. But in Ms. Nemeth's image-laden, often heavy-handed language, the play is as relentlessly portentous as that opening image promises it will be.

title: FPA Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Included losses from discontinued operations of $376,000 and $1,005,000 for the quarter and year, respectively. c-Included losses from discontinued operations of $4,020,000 for the quarter and $5,526,000 for the year, and the year also included an extraordinary credit of $5,700,000, or $1.43 a share.

title: Seadrift Journal; In Texas, Shrimpers Lament: 'It's Over'
description: Kathy Yarborough was sitting on a broken chair in the little office at Froggies fish house, smoking cigarettes, chatting with friends and happily letting the afternoon pass. Then her 2-year-old son, Donny Paul, intruded by announcing his ambition.

title: Cuba Is Elected to the U.N. Security Council
description: Cuba, Rumania and Southern Yemen were elected to the Security Council today for two-year terms. Many Western diplomats said they feared that the move would make it harder for the Council to agree on a common line toward future threats to international peace.

title: British Unit Challenges Deloitte's Merger Plan
description: Deloitte Haskins & Sells's British affiliate, which had previously rejected the accounting firm's proposed merger with Touche Ross, said yesterday that it would sue ''to prevent the unauthorized use'' of the Deloitte name worldwide.

title: Valmont Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Some Roughhousing Is Bad for Children
description: To the Editor:

title: Queens Recalls Student With Future in Space
description: At Bayside High School in Queens, ''We teach our students to reach for the stars,'' said Dorothy Laird, a longtime assistant principal there. But she readily conceded that she and her colleagues had never conceived that a student of theirs two decades ago would follow that lesson literally.

title: The Shock of 6.9
description: The millions of Americans who tuned in to the World Series Tuesday witnessed instead the horror of an intense earthquake. The San Francisco Bay Area became the scene of terrifying images. The Bay Bridge with a piece of its top deck down. A one-mile stretch of the Nimitz Freeway collapsed deck to deck, crushing the cars in between. A blockwide inferno raging throughout the night in the stunned, lightless city.

title: Forschner Group Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Schering-Plough Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Carriage Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 1
Philip Morris Cos. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an accounting adjustment gain of $273,000,000. Share data has been adjusted to reflect the company's 4-for-1 stock split distributed in October. Results included the operating results of Kraft Inc. since its acquisition by Philip Morris on Dec. 7, 1988.

title: Great Lakes Chemical reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Airline Takeover Bill Gains
description: A House committee today voted to give the Transportation Department new authority to forestall big airline takeovers, but the Bush Administration threatened to veto the bill.

title: Ex-Official Admits He Stole Money From New York City
description: A former New York City official in the Department of General Services pleaded guilty yesterday in State Supreme Court to charges of using his position to steal more than $1 million in city money.

title: Hungary Purges Stalinism From Its Constitution
description: Parliament purged Hungary's Constitution of its Stalinist elements today to create a Western-style basic law for a return to multi-party democracy.

title: Bank of New England reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Barbara Bush Given Award By Religious Freedom Group
description: The Appeal of Conscience Foundation presented its annual awards last night to Barbara Bush, Roger Smith, chairman of General Motors, and Chingiz Aitmatov, a Soviet author.

title: Avant-Gardist For Lanvin
description: Leon Bressler, chairman and chief executive of the House of Lanvin, announced today that Claude Montana, the ready-to wear designer, would design its couture collection and oversee its ready-to-wear line.

title: The Fight Over Changing the Borough Presidents' Role
description: Of all the changes in New York City's government proposed by the Charter Revision Commission, none are quite so dramatic as those proposed for the borough presidents.

title: Republic New York Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included addition of $200 million to allowance for loan losses. c-Net income

title: Gorbachev's Assault On Paper Stirs Fears
description: In the fifth year of glasnost, the Soviet press is getting a rough reminder this week of how much this country's tenuous liberties still depend on the tempers of one man, Mikhail S. Gorbachev.

title: Fabric of Liberty
description: America's flag will still fly proudly over the Capitol if the Senate votes today against a constitutional amendment that purports to protect Old Glory from desecration. It will wave for those who see the flag as a symbol of all freedoms - including the freedom to insult it. And it will salute the bravery of senators who resist this tampering with the Bill of Rights.

title: Kroger Co. reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 7
description: b-Represented after-tax losses of $1,277,627 for the quarter and $5,217,945 for the 9 months from the early repayment of $66 million and $211 million, respectively, of debt related to restructuring. c-Net income The latest periods' income before extraordinary losses included pre-tax gain of $28,405,482 from the sale of divested unit's assets.

title: MNC Financial Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Ahmanson (H.F.) & Co.  (N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The latest quarter and 9 months net earnings included after-tax gains on sales of loans and mortgage-backed securities of $5.37 million, or 5 cents a share, and $3.9 million, or 4 cents a share, respectively. The year-earlier quarter and 9 months net earnings included after- tax gains on sales of loans and mortgage-backed securities of $5.31 million, or 5 cents a share, and $18.5 million, or 19 cents a share, respectively.

title: Meredith Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Freed Rebels Talk of Decades in Pretoria's Prisons
description: Walter Sisulu and two of his freed colleagues from the outlawed African National Congress talked today about their 26 years in prison and how their captors had tried at first to break them with hard labor, midnight searches, informers and humiliation.

title: The New York Times Co. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After gains from discontinued operations of $194,353,000, or $2.47 a share, for the quarter and $198,448,000, or $2.52 a share, for the 9 months; the discontinued operations in both periods included a gain of $193.3 million, or $2.46 a share, on sale of the company's cable television system. c-After gains from discontinued operations of $1,488,000, or 2 cents a share, for the quarter and $4,755,000, or 6 cents a share, for the 9 months. The latest periods also included equity in earnings of forest products group of $2,593,000 for the quarter and $9,212,000 for the 9 months, compared with $6,302,000 and $20,817,000 for the year-ago periods, respectively.

title: Giants' Rookie Rejoins Practice
description: After six weeks of doing everything except play football, Bob Kratch did today what he wanted to do most. He played football, or at least took part in a Giants practice.

title: Currents; Old Friends, New Shops
description: FOR years Christian Jussel, Garrick Stephenson and Janet Mavec discussed putting their respective East Side antiques shops under one roof. Starting today they are finally together, on the second floor of the Revlon International Building, 625 Madison Avenue (58th Street).

title: In London, Subway Style Above Ground
description: British fashion seems to be going down the tube - the subway, that is. At the designer shows and in the offbeat London shops, styles first seen on New York City streets and subways carried the day: hooded shirts and jackets with large graphics, sweat pants, belt packs, knapsacks and chunky leather basketball shoes.

title: Brownstones to Tour And Apartments to See
description: Seven for Luck, New Yorker League for Cerebral Palsy, 105 Madison Avenue; 212-683-6700.

title: Precision Castparts reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Princess Gina, Consort in Liechtenstein, 67
description: Princess Gina of Liechtenstein, wife of the head of state, died today, the Government announced. She was 67 years old.

title: Folklorists See Art In Window Dressing
description: Windows decorated with ceramic vases, swans and Madonnas - a common sight in row-house neighborhoods like South Philadelphia - are being studied by folklorists who consider them to be an urban folk art tradition.

title: Milton Friedman, 75, a Labor Arbitrator
description: Milton Friedman, a labor-management arbitrator and mediator, died of pneumonia yesterday at University Hospital at the New York University Medical Center. He was 75 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: A.T.&T. Dance Grants
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company has awarded $105,000 in grants to three dance troupes - the David Gordon/Pick Up Company, the Hubbard Street Dance Company and the Trisha Brown Company - to participate in its 1989-90 Dance Tour program. The grants will enable the companies to perform in 39 American cities.

title: Concept Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
description: Share earnings and shares outstanding have been restated to reflect a 5-for-4 stock split in fiscal 1989.

title: Fleet/Norstar Financial reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Media General Selling Unit
description: Media General Inc. has put up for sale 31 weekly newspapers in Orange County and the San Gabriel Valley area, saying the California papers are too far from its base in Virginia.

title: A Cotton Plant Grows in an Unlikely
description: THE Fillin' Station, a restaurant at a busy highway intersection here, looks like, and is, a good place to have a no-nonsense breakfast of bacon and scrambled eggs and grits.

title: Times Co. Profit Bolstered By Special Gain in Quarter
description: The New York Times Company yesterday reported third-quarter earnings of $210.8 million, or $2.68 a share, compared with $26.7 million, or 33 cents a share, in the comparable period last year. Revenues came to $415.3 million, up 6.4 percent from $390.5 million a year ago.

title: Adlai S. Hardin Dies; Wood Sculptor Was 88
description: Adlai S. Hardin, a sculptor and former advertising executive, died of complications from a stroke on Monday at the Saybrook Convalescent Hospital in Old Saybrook, Conn. He was 88 years old.

title: Alaska Air Group reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Currents; Prince's Architectural Vision on View
description: SINCE 1984, when he delivered a speech to the Royal Institute of British Architects in which he described the new wing for London's National Gallery as ''a monstrous carbuncle on the face of a much loved and elegant friend,'' the Prince of Wales has become perhaps the most visible architecture critic around.

title: Corrections
description: An article in Science Times on Tuesday about occupational illness among artists and musicians misidentified a neurologist at the Performing Arts Clinic at the University of Texas Medical School. He is Dr. Alan H. Lockwood. The article also misidentified the founder of Doctors for Artists, an organization of physicians who treat artists. He was Dr. Warren S. Neidich; Dr. Bruce Roseman is a family practitioner with many artists among his patients.

title: Europe Court Backs Raids
description: The European Court of Justice Tuesday upheld the European Commission's right to raid companies suspected of price fixing and rejected complaints by chemicals companies that their privacy had been violated.

title: Mark Twain Bancshares reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Computer Products reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included extraordinary credits of $141,000, or 1 cent a share, and $820,000, or 4 cents a share, for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. c-Net loss

title: Hanna (M.A.) (N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included tax credits of $5.1 million for the quarter and $17.6 million for the 9 months. c-Included tax credits of $5.9 million and $19.4 million for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. The company said the latest 9 months included $15 million in gains from the sale of bankruptcy claims while the year-ago 9 months included $25.5 million in net gains from asset sales and tax refunds and adjustments.

title: Rudolph J. Boyko, 93, Former Steel Executive
description: Rudolph J. Boyko, a New Jersey steel executive who was one of the founders of Ben-Gurion University of the Negev in Israel in 1969, died of complications from surgery Tuesday at Newton (N.J.) General Hospital. He was 93 years old and lived in Blairstown, N.J., and Manhattan.

title: 4 Other Members of the Crew
description: For the flight of the space shuttle Atlantis, the space agency has selected crew members with extensive flying or scientific experience. Three have been on previous shuttle flights. One member of the crew is Dr. Ellen Shulman Baker, the daughter of the Queens Borough President. Here are sketches of the other four astronauts: Donald E. Williams Flight Commander

title: Relief Groups Taking Aid
description: Funds to help earthquake victims in California have been set up by the following organizations: American Red Cross Disaster Relief Fund, P.O. Box 4691, Grand Central Station, New York, N.Y. 10163. Telephone: 800-453-9000. Episcopal Church/The Presiding Bishop's Fund for World Relief, The Episcopal Church Center, 815 Second Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10017. Telephone: 800-334-7626 or in New York City 867-8400. World Relief, P.O. Box WRC, Wheaton, Ill. 60189. Telephone: 312-665-0235. Direct Relief International, 2801-B De La Vina Street, Santa Barbara, Calif. 93105. (805-687-3694) Operation California/USA, 7615 1/2 Melrose Ave., Los Angeles. 90046. Telephone: 213-658-8876. World Vision, 919 West Huntington Drive, Monrovia, Calif. 91016. Telephone: 818-357-7979.

title: Ameritrust Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Ameritrust said its 1988 results included after-tax gains of $10 million, or 25 cents a share, for the sale and leaseback of buildings; $7.6 million, or 19 cents a share, for the settlement of certain pension obligations, and $1 million, or 2 cents a share, for the sale of the payment service division. The company said its 1988 results included an after-tax loss of $4.5 million in connection with an agreement to sell its investment in Central Bancorporation Inc.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''I thought I had a flat tire.

title: NEW MARS FINDINGS FROM SOVIET CRAFT
description: Observations by a Soviet spacecraft reveal that magnetic forces surrounding Mars are controlled by ''winds'' of electrified gases from the Sun, not from magnetism generated by the planet. The finding could explain why Mars has lost most of its atmosphere over the last billion years.

title: Knicks Lose To Suns by 9
description: Eddie Johnson scored 18 of his 38 points in the first half to lead the Phoenix Suns to a 115-106 exhibition victory over the Knicks tonight at the University of Dayton Arena.

title: Clorox Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a loss of $874,000 from discontinued operations.

title: ABC Expects No Loss From Series Suspension
description: ABC does not expect any financial loss from the suspension of the World Series as a result of the earthquake in the San Francisco Bay area Tuesday, network spokesmen said yesterday.

title: 9.1% Stake Held In Enzo Biochem
description: An investment group led by J. Morton Davis, the chairman and sole shareholder of the New York brokerage firm D. H. Blair & Company, said it holds a 9.1 percent stake in Enzo Biochem Inc. In a Securities and Exchange Commission filing, Mr. Davis said the group might seek to gain control of Enzo Biochem but that it had no immediate plans to do so.

title: Jet 'Prevent-Offense' Isn't a Laughing Matter to Walton
description: Joe Walton, his job secure and in control of a 1-5 Jets team whose defense outscores the offense, tried cracking jokes today.

title: Tapestries Depict Life In Chile
description: ISLA NEGRA, a village on the central Chilean coast, is known on two counts: as the home of the poet and Nobel laureate Pablo Neruda and for the striking tapestries made by its women. The work of the Bordadoras de Isla Negra (Embroiderers of Isla Negra), executed in brilliantly colored wool yarns on sackcloth, has achieved international recognition.

title: Trinity Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company said the effect on revenues of adopting SFAS No. 94 for the 6 months and second quarter ended Sept. 30, 1988 is $23.2 million and $10.3 million, respectively, and such amounts have been restated in the 1988 results.

title: Diamond Shamrock R&M Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary loss from a debt reduction payment of $800,000 for both the quarter and 9 months.

title: Valley National Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income The latest third quarter results included a $110 million provision for credit losses and a provision of $11 million for other real estate owned .

title: Ex-Official Admits He Stole Million From New York City
description: A former New York City official in the Department of General Services pleaded guilty yesterday in State Supreme Court to charges of using his position to steal more than $1 million in city money.

title: WCRS Sets Big Shift to Media Buying
description: THE British advertising company whose holdings include the American agency Della Femina, McNamee WCRS, yesterday substantially withdrew from the advertising business while at the same time acquiring complete control of the largest media-buying company in Europe.

title: Fears Expressed for 40 East Timor Protesters
description: Amnesty International expressed concern today for the safety of about 40 people in East Timor said to have been arrested for taking part in a pro-independence protest in front of Pope John Paul II last week when he visited the disputed Indonesian province.

title: Union Camp Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Currents; Designers Under 30 In a Show at Steelcase
description: IN 1966 the Architectural League of New York held a huge exhibition, ''40 Under 40,'' showing the work of 40 architects under age 40. Many of those whose designs were on view have become the most influential architects practicing today. Remembering that show, Steelcase Design Parnership, in collaboration with Interiors magazine, has mounted a similar exhibition, ''30 under 30,'' highlighting the work of 30 designers from around the world, all under the age of 30.

title: Meridian Bancorp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Emerson String Quartet
description: The Emerson String Quartet, in its only New York appearances this season, will play the late string quartets of Beethoven and Schubert in four concerts at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. The quartet - Eugene Drucker, Philip Setzer, Lawrence Dutton and David Finckel - will play at 8 P.M. today and on Dec. 7, Jan. 18 and Feb. 15. Single tickets, $16; series subscription, $55. Information: 570-3949.

title: Trinova Will Lay Off 1,500 in Revamping
description: The Trinova Corporation announced today that it would lay off 1,500 employees in its second restructuring in two years.

title: Brown May Seek Federal Help After Attacks
description: The president of Brown University is considering asking for Federal help in the aftermath of a number of attacks on white students by blacks.

title: BTU International Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 1
Energy Conversion Devices Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss The company said the latest fiscal year results included the operations of Ovonic Imaging Systems Inc. only through March 31, 1989 due to the terms of financing in April.

title: THE CALIFORNIA QUAKE: The Next Day; QUAKE DEAD PUT AT 270, DAMAGE AT A BILLION AS CALIFORNIANS STRIVE TO RESTORE ORDER
description: On the day after the most terrifying night of their lives, Northern Californians today catalogued disasters great and small, counted the dead and comforted the living and began restoring order and civility to their devastated cities and towns.

title: Export Fine Set By Japan Court
description: A Japanese court has fined an air-conditioner maker 2 million yen ($14,000) after finding it guilty of illegally exporting strategic chemicals to the Soviet Union, a court official said today.

title: A Lesson in Playfulness: School Annexes That Please the Eye
description: THESE days, it is architects who are playing in schoolyards. Four startling new buildings have sprung up alongside public schools in the Bronx and Brooklyn. Covered with classical ornament and painted bright colors, they seem to be on loan from Disney World. Actually, they contain classrooms.

title: Oshkosh B'Gosh Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Centex Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Nashua Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Viacom International reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss Preferred dividend payments were none, compared with $16,957,000 in the third quarter and $17,491,000 versus $48,255,000 in the 9 months.

title: A Life of Study of the Venerable Bead
description: How many beads does the world's leading bead expert have in the collection he keeps in a tool chest by his bed in the basement of his home here? ''I don't know,'' said the authority, Peter Francis Jr., a puckish 44-year-old. ''Well, maybe half a million. Certainly not a million.''

title: It's Not Over, But It Should Be
description: More than 250 people are dead. Hundreds of others are broken and bandaged. Long strips of yellow ''caution'' tape cordons off downtown buildings where piles of shattered window glass have been swept into the gutters.

title: Talking Deals; McCaw Strategy In Seeking Lin
description: IN the battle for Lin Broadcasting, McCaw Cellular Communications has introduced a rare tactic intended to sweeten its bid without having to pay anyone more money right away.

title: A 'Time of Drift' Now for a Quieter Koch
description: Inside City Hall these days there is an unnatural if not unexpected quiet. Mayor Edward I. Koch still arrives early, but his public schedules are usually short. And as his weeks in office dwindle and his commissioners announce their departures, the question has become, ''How's he doing?''

title: Two 'Junk' Offerings Postponed
description: Investment bankers at two Wall Street firms said yesterday that they were postponing two ''junk bond'' offerings totaling more than $1.2 billion because of volatile conditions in the high-risk, high-yield market.

title: Criminal Case in Singapore
description: A wealthy Singapore businessman who is head of several flourishing companies was charged today with corruption.

title: General Dynamics reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Truck Jams in Overpass, Halting Van Wyck
description: A tractor-trailer struck a pedestrian walkway that crosses over Jewel Avenue and the Van Wyck Expressway in Flushing, Queens, yesterday afternoon, forcing a halt to traffic in the northbound lanes of the expressway, the police said. There were no reports of injuries.

title: Net Off 25.3% At Northrop
description: The Northrop Corporation reported today that its third-quarter earnings declined 25.3 percent, to $21.5 million, or 46 cents a share, from $28.8 million, or 61 cents a share, a year earlier.

title: G.M.'s Chief Sees Market Share Rise
description: Roger B. Smith, the chairman of the General Motors Corporation, said he expects G.M.'s share of the United States market to rise to more than 40 percent by the turn of the century, up from the current 35.5 percent.

title: Ameritech reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The 9-month comparison reflects a gain of $42.1 million in last year's second quarter from the sale of Ameritech's interest in Cantel, a Canadian cellular company, and the third quarter 1988 sale of Applied Data Research, Inc., a systems software subsidiary. Year-ago share earnings and shares outstanding are adjusted for a 2-for-1 stock split on Dec. 30, 1988.

title: An Integrated Independence for Baltics?
description: To the Editor:

title: Bonn Asks Californian's War Crimes Extradition
description: The Justice Department announced today that the West German Government had requested extradition of a Los Angeles resident accused of war crimes committed while a guard at a Nazi concentration camp. It is believed to be only the second extradition request ever made by West Germany in a war crimes case here.

title: Dr. Oscar Falnes, 91, Professor of History
description: Dr. Oscar J. Falnes, an educator and specialist in Scandinavian intellectual and cultural history, died on Friday at his home in Manhattan. He was 91 years old.

title: Faberge Shifts a Line
description: Another Faberge account defected from Bozell yesterday, as Faberge's parent company shifted a line of hair care products to J. Walter Thompson/New York. Chesebrough-Pond's, the unit of Unilever N.V. that acquired Faberge last August, switched its men's toiletries products from Bozell to Lintas New York last week. A spokeswoman for J. Walter Thompson said the account for hair care products was worth between $7 million and $8 million.

title: Bush Acts Quickly to Get Federal Aid to California
description: The Bush Administration, declaring a major disaster in Northern California, mobilized Government resources today to aid the victims of the California earthquake.

title: Multibank Financial Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an addition of $7 million to the reserve for possible credit losses.

title: Article 657489 -- No Title
description: Matisse's ''Woman With a Red Umbrella Seated in Profile,'' completed sometime from 1919 to 1921, was sold last night for $12.4 million, a record for a work by the artist. The painting was the highest price in Sotheby's auction of Impressionist and modern art from the collection of John T. Dorrance Jr., an heir to the Campbell Soup Company fortune.

title: Review/Chamber Music; 2 Sounds' Common Ground
description: Marin Alsop and her Concordia chamber orchestra usually include classical works inspired by jazz on their programs. Fred Hersch, a jazz pianist and composer, likes to dabble in the classics. Mr. Hersch and his band, and Ms. Alsop and hers, got together for a Town Hall concert on Sunday afternoon, and found a good deal of common ground, although perhaps not as much as they had hoped.

title: Record Textile Imports
description: United States imports of textiles and apparel totaled more than 1.42 billion square yards in August, a record for any month, the American Textile Manufacturers Institute said Tuesday. It said the figure was up by 19 percent over August 1988. In the first eight months of this year, imports were 9.82 billion square yards, a 13 percent rise over last year.

title: Puritan-Bennett reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Parent & child
description: RECENT national surveys estimate that 2 million to 6 million children under the age of 13 regularly care for themselves without adult supervision after school or on weekends. For almost all parents of such latchkey children - ''children in self-care,'' as some researchers call them - the decision to leave them alone is unwanted but unavoidable.

title: Hunter Sets Sale Of a Subsidiary
description: Hunter Environmental Services Inc. reached a preliminary agreement to sell its environmental consulting and services business for $40 million plus the assumption of debt. The deal is subject to completion of a definitive agreement, approval by Hunter's stockholders and receipt of all necessary consents. Hunter Environmental did not name the prospective buyer.

title: California Microwave Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
U.S. Drug Strategy Is Attacked at House Hearing
description: Administration officials defended their anti-drug strategy for Latin America today before Congressional critics who complained that it was ill conceived and too heavily weighted toward military over economic aid for cocaine-producing countries.

title: 6 Face Welfare Fraud Charges in Jersey City
description: Six people have been charged with official misconduct and welfare fraud in a Jersey City case, the Attorney General's office said yesterday.

title: The Earthquake So 'Great' a Later One Seems Puny
description: Fires raged out of control for more than three days. Communications with the outside world were severely restricted. Coordination between government agencies was at times so poor that Federal troops clashed with roving groups of citizens who had been ordered by the Mayor to guard against looting.

title: Bush And the Zealots
description: George Bush does not come across as a hard-edged character. In manner he usually seems what his political origins would indicate, a man of moderation.

title: Independence Bancorp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss

title: Cameron Iron Works Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
First Home Federal S&L Assn reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
COMPANY BRIEFS
description: * Blue Arrow P.L.C., London, an employment agency, said it would adopt the name of its main operation, Manpower Inc., based in Milwaukee, as part of a move to strengthen its position in the U.S. market.

title: People
description: * William Morrissey has joined McCann Direct, a subsidiary of McCann-Erickson, as executive vice president and worldwide director.

title: Cryer's Career Revived by 'Teddy Z'
description: Jon Cryer has to wait for a table at the Columbia Bar and Grill, which is exactly the kind of chic, overpriced restaurant where Teddy Zakalokis - the rising young agent he portrays on the new CBS situation comedy, ''The Famous Teddy Z'' - might do lunch.

title: Pfizer Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 1
description: For the periods ended Oct. 1, 1989, and Oct. 2, 1988. Subsidiaries operating outside the United States generally are included on the basis of interim periods ended August 27, 1989, and August 28, 1988. The results of operations for the interim periods ended October 1, 1989, are not necessarily indicative of the results which ultimately might be achieved for the current year.

title: Huntington Bancshares reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The per share amounts have been adjusted for 15 percent stock dividend distributed July 31.

title: Hugo's Victims Send Supplies to Bay Area
description: A month after being devastated by Hurricane Hugo, this city began sending relief supplies and assistance today to the residents of the San Franciso area.

title: Wang Laboratories Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income Latest-quarter results included a $12.9 million pretax restructuring charge; year-ago quarter results included a $3.1 million loss from discontinued operations.

title: Commodities Firm Fined
description: A commodities trading firm agreed to pay a $500,000 fine and withdraw from membership in the Chicago Mercantile Exchange to settle charges of improper record-keeping and violating margin requirements, exchange officials said today.

title: Consolidated Rail Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Fund Yields Are Lower
description: Yields of money market mutual funds surveyed by IBC/Donoghue's Money Fund Report were down for the week ended yesterday.

title: From Queens Streets, City Hall Seems Very Distant
description: The voters of Kew Gardens, Queens, have not forgotten the blizzard of 1969. Manhattan's streets were plowed first, they say. But in Kew Gardens, a man had to be an Under Secretary General of the United Nations and a Nobel Prize winner to get his street cleared.

title: Notes Offered By Lockheed
description: The Lockheed Corporation is offering $300 million in notes due 1999 through underwriters led by Goldman, Sachs & Company.

title: United Fedl Bancorp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago per share earnings and shares outstanding were not available; the company converted to a stock form of ownership on Feb. 15, 1989.

title: Shuttle Launched After Delay And Galileo Is Sent to Jupiter
description: The space shuttle Atlantis rocketed into orbit today to send the Galileo spacecraft on its planned six-year, 2.5-billion-mile journey to Jupiter.

title: National Westminster Banorp Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an $155 million addition to reserve against loans to certain countries with severe debt servicing problems. c-Net income National Westminster Bancorp Inc. is a wholly owned subsidiary of British-based National Westminster Bank Plc.

title: Treasuries Steady; Trading Slow
description: Prices of Treasury securities were little changed yesterday in slow trading, despite a report that showed housing starts were at their lowest level in more than five years.

title: Talbot Rantoul, 77, Designer and Educator
description: Talbot Rantoul, a carpet designer and former president of the Rhode Island School of Design, died Monday at a nursing home in Providence, R.I. He was 77 years old and lived in Chilmark, Mass., and Ojai, Calif.

title: Leafs Seek Inquiry
description: The Toronto Maple Leafs, stung by Tom Kurvers's refusal to play for the team, yesterday asked the National Hockey League to look into the trade that they thought gave them the Devils' defenseman in return for a first-round draft pick in 1991.

title: SHL Systemhouse reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
description: b-Net loss Figures are in Canadian funds. If results for Computerland Canada had been included for all of fiscal 1988, rather than from the July 1, 1988 date of acquisition, revenue for that fiscal year would have been $509.4 million.

description: b-Net income

title: Philip Morris Had 21% Gain In Its Third-Quarter Profit
description: The Philip Morris Companies, the world's largest consumer-products concern, reported a strong third-quarter performance, especially in its international tobacco operations and its recently acquired Kraft foods business, with its net income rising nearly 21 percent.

title: Vitalink Communications reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included tax credits of $1,198,000, or 8 cents a share, and $4,121,000, or 32 cents a share, for the quarter and 9 months, respectively; the 9 months also included income from discontinued operations of $1,997,000, representing the sale of discontinued operations. c-Included tax credits of $748,000, or 7 cents a share, and $2,690,000, or 26 cents a share, for the quarter and 9 months, respectively.

description: Il Cantinori

description: To the Editor:

title: American Brands reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a loss of $800,000 for the quarter and income of $40,100,000, or 41 cents a share for the 9 months, both from discontinued operations. The company said during the year- ago 9-month, it sold Sunshine Biscuits, Pinkerton's and Andrew Jergens. Proceeds from the sale of these companies approximated $605 million and resulted in a gain of about $66 million. This gain, partly offset by losses from operations of discontinued units and a charge for the disposition of W.R. Case & Sons Cutlery Co., resulted in a net gain of $40.1 million in the year-ago 9 months. The company said the 2 percent decline in revenues in the latest third quarter was due to the absence of the Southland Life operation, which was sold in March, and the impact of the stronger U.S. dollar on the translation of overseas results. Year-ago third quarter and 9 months are restated to reflect an accounting change in fourth quarter of 1988.

title: Social Security Payments To Increase 4.7% Next Year
description: The nation's 38.9 million recipients of Social Security payments will receive a 4.7 percent increase in January, the largest annual cost-of-living adjustment in seven and a half years.

title: Athletics Still Numb in Aftermath
description: When their meeting was over this afternoon, the Oakland Athletics walked slowly from the clubhouse into the bright sunshine to work out. But their faces seemed void of emotion as they passed through the runway, almost as if the impact of Tuesday's earthquake still had not settled.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''From April to October, the length of a baseball season, may be enough to establish a winner of the World Series. It's not enough to win the war on drugs in this city or any other city.'' - William J. Bennett, the national drug policy director, in Washington. [ A1:3. ]

title: American Medical
description: The IMA Acquisition Corporation, which has offered to purchase American Medical International Inc. for an investor group, said it had sufficient commitments to finance the senior bank portion, or $1.58 billion, of its bid. The commitments were completed when the Chemical Bank syndicated $509 million to 23 other institutions. The First Boston Corporation remains committed to providing about $578 million in subordinated debt, IMA said. American Medical is a hospital management company based in Beverly Hills, Calif.

title: Los Angeles Residents Face Their Peril, Briefly
description: Psychic tremors from the San Francisco earthquake are rattling in Los Angeles, where people are engaged in a flurry of preparations for ''the big one'' they usually prefer not to think about.

title: Hubert Carr, Executive And Lawyer, Dies at 68
description: Hubert F. Carr, a lawyer and steamship company executive, died of heart disease Wednesday at River View Medical Center in Red Bank, N.J. He was 68 years old and lived in Colts Neck, N.J.

title: B.A.T. Moves Approved by Shareholders
description: Shareholders of B.A.T. Industries P.L.C. today overwhelmingly approved the company's plan to sell some $6 billion worth of operations, including its Saks and Marshall Field department store chains, and to buy back as much as 10 percent of its stock.

title: Review/Film; Wisdom and Innocence on the Eve of War
description: In the Scilly Isles, off the southwest coast of England, there lives a silent hermit who loves birds. He's known, not surprisingly, as the Birdman. Here, on the tiny Isle of Bryher on the eve of World War I, the Birdman is the only inhabitant who remembers living on the neighboring Isle of Samson. The Birdman left Samson when he was a small boy. Samson is now deserted and regarded by the natives of Bryher as cursed, though only the Birdman (Paul Scofield) knows why.

title: Micron Products reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Ultimatum Goes Out To Giuliani On Tactics
description: Under attack for more than a week over the way he has kept account of his personal and campaign finances, David N. Dinkins, the Democratic candidate for mayor of New York, yesterday issued an ultimatum to his Republican rival, Rudolph W. Giuliani: Stop the ''gutter politics'' within 24 hours, or face some of the same.

description: b-Net loss

title: Parking Rules
description: Because of the Jewish holiday of Shemini Atzereth, which concludes the harvest festival of Succoth, alternate-side parking rules will be suspended in New York City tomorrow. Other regulations remain in effect.

description: The year-ago figures have been restated. Results are in Canadian funds.

Union Pacific Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company said that despite a significant softening in the ecopnomy early in the quarter, the corporation earned $137 million, slightly below last year's net income of $140 million from continuing operations. The year- over-year increase in earnings per share from continuing operations reflected the shareholder benefits of the stock repurchase program and the Dutch Auction completed in May 1989. Including the discontinued refinery operations sold at the end of last year, third quarter 1988 net income was $165 million, or $1.44 a share. Revenue represents operating revenue.

title: Uncovered Short Sales Fall 4.3% on the Big Board
description: The New York Stock Exchange reported yesterday that short interest had dropped 4.3 percent in the four-week period that ended Oct. 13. Short interest is the number of shares sold short by investors and not yet covered.

title: Owens-Corning Fiberglas Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Latest quarter and 9-month results included an after-tax charge of $4 million, or 10 cents a share, to adjust the equity income attributable to Fiberglas Canada prior to the purchase date. Year-ago quarter results included an extraordinary after-tax charge of $6 million, or 15 cents a share, from the repurchase of debt. Nine-month 1988 results included $8 million, or 20 cents a share, from the repurchase of debt.

description: In a passage describing his literary method, Camilo Jose Cela, the Spanish writer who was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature yesterday, had this to say about writing:

description: The latest quarter's share earnings are reduced slightly by sale of 4.1 million shares of treasury stock to newly formed employee stock ownership plan, increasing shares outstanding.

description: They are unable to go long, unable to go short and unable to run. So what are the Jets going to do on Sunday when they face the Bills at Orchard Park, N.Y.?

title: KEY RATES
Review/Theater; Sexual Politics and Tango in 'Dangerous Games'
description: If theater people want to make a spectacle of themselves on a Broadway stage, that is their inalienable right, but whatever happened to the poor audience's right to enjoy a few laughs in the face of such disaster? ''Dangerous Games,'' a new musical misfire at the Nederlander, extinguishes all opportunities for fun by shrouding its inanities in stern sermonettes on sexual politics, dour images from Greek mythology and real-life South American state terrorism. Mel Brooks notwithstanding, it's hard to have a hoot when the advancing chorus line consists of goose-stepping Black Shirts.

title: Niners, Patriots Meet at Stanford
description: The game between the San Francisco 49ers and the New England Patriots on Sunday will be played at Stanford Stadium in nearby Palo Alto while preparations continue to ready Candlestick Park for the resumption of the World Series next week.

title: President Appointed Inter-Regional Chief
description: Inter-Regional Financial Group Inc., a Minneapolis-based company that operates two brokerage units, has named its president, Irving Weiser, to the additional post of chief executive, beginning Jan. 1.

description: b-Included a charge of $9.5 million for arbitration settlement and early redemption of debt. c-Included a charge of $29.7 million for arbitration settlement and early redemption of debt. The company said that as a result of the previously disclosed Federal Trade Commission preliminary injunction relative to Avdel, its results of operations for the 9 months of 1989 do not include the earnings of Avdel, but do include interest expense of $16.4 million on the borrowings related to the purchase of Avdel.

title: American Express Profit Rose 25.7% in 3d Quarter
description: The American Express Company, the nation's largest financial services company, yesterday reported increases of more than 20 percent in its third-quarter revenue and operating profit, with strong growth in its core business of charge cards. But it also noted an additional reserve for bad loans at its American Express Bank subsidiary and one-time gains and sluggish growth at its Shearson Lehman Hutton brokerage house.

title: MCA Net Down 6.6%
description: MCA Inc. reported today that its third-quarter earnings declined 6.6 percent, to $50.8 million, or 69 cents a share, from $54.3 million, or 74 cents a share, a year earlier. The company's revenues increased 12.2 percent, to $918.4 million, from $806.7 million in the period last year. Despite record revenues, generated partly from box office hits like ''Parenthood'' and ''Uncle Buck,'' earnings dipped because of increased interest expenses caused by higher interest rates and higher average borrowings compared with 1988.

description: b-Included a gain of $5,400,000, or 24 cents a share, from an accounting adjustment.

title: Dow Rises By 39.55 in Wide Gain
description: Stock prices moved up sharply yesterday as traders reacted to encouraging inflation news and to indications that the Federal Reserve might be willing to allow interest rates to fall further.

title: Bowater Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Rowers Aim to Rekindle an Olympic Spirit
description: On a drive down to Philadelphia a couple of weekends ago, Bill Stowe was uneasy. Stowe, a 49-year-old retired crew coach who is somewhat overweight and out of shape, was about to join other members of the 1964 Olympic eight-oared crew for a venture that he regarded as absurd. ''Crazy,'' he said. The crew was the last American men's eight to win an Olympic gold medal, something they did in Tokyo a quarter of a century ago.
