title: Rome Journal; Conservative Catholic Group Casts Off Its Cloak
description: For a religious organization with a legendary penchant for secrecy, it seems appropriate that only a street number, 73, should identify the imposing building on Viale Bruno Buozzi, three miles from the Vatican, as the headquarters of Opus Dei.

title: Edward W. Barrett, 79, Ex-Journalism Dean, Dies
description: Edward W. Barrett, a journalist, government official and public-relations executive who was dean of the Columbia Graduate School of Journalism from 1956 to 1968, died of a ruptured aneurysm Monday at Greenwich (Conn.) Hospital. He was 79 years old and lived in Greenwich.

title: In Midwood, the Big Issue Is Still Jackson
description: Many Jewish voters in Midwood, an increasingly Orthodox section of Brooklyn where Mayor Edward I. Koch won 8 of every 10 votes in the Sept. 12 Democratic primary, have harbored a single, almost obsessive concern about David N. Dinkins - the Rev. Jesse Jackson.

title: Maazel Cancels All Berlin Philharmonic Dates
description: Lorin Maazel has announced a four-year extension of his contract as music director of the Pittsburgh Symphony, and says that he is relinquishing all his contracted dates to conduct the Berlin Philharmonic for concerts and recordings.

title: World Series Receives Mayor's Go-Ahead
description: Mayor Art Agnos of San Francisco, satisfied with the condition of Candlestick Park and Bay Area traffic, gave his final blessing today to the resumption of the World Series on Friday night.

title: Too Much Fight In The Irish
description: Take your average, high-powered college football institution. Feature it in three angry confrontations in the moments before nationally televised games within a period of just over 13 months. Recall an ugly blemish at the end of what had seemed a perfect season - again, with a coast-to-coast audience - when the coach, in the final two minutes of a bowl-game victory for a national championship, feels compelled to go on the field and into the huddle to determine the reason for the unsportsmanlike conduct penalties against his team. After the game, he says the episode had taken some of the joy out of the victory.

title: Seoul Agrees to Buy 120 U.S. Fighters
description: In a long and painstaking negotiation, South Korea has agreed to buy 120 jet fighter planes from the United States but under terms that are a setback for Secretary of Defense Dick Cheney and that are likely to cause some criticism in Congress.

title: Transactions
description: BASEBALL METS (NL) - Announced they will not offer new contracts to Bill Robinson, hitting coach and first-base coach, and Sam Perlozzo, third-base coach. SAN DIEGO (NL) - Signed Garry Templeton, shortstop, to a two-year contract. Signed Pat Dobson, pitching coach, to a two-year contract. Signed Sandy Alomar Sr., third-base coach; Amos Otis, hitting coach; Greg Riddoch, first-base coach, and Denny Sommers, bullpen coach, to one-year contracts. FOOTBALL INDIANAPOLIS (AFC) - Signed Don Strock, quarterback. Waived Wayne Johnson, quarterback. MIAMI (AFC) - Placed Troy Stradford, running back, on injured reseve. Waived Fuad Reveiz, place-kicker, and Chris Conlin, guard-center. JETS (AFC) - Activated Wesley Walker, wide receiver, from injured reserve. Re-signed K.D. Dunn, tight end. Waived Greg Werner, tight end, and Tim Cofield, linebacker. PHOENIX (NFC) - Waived Michael Adams, cornerback. Signed Bob Buckzowski, defensive tackle. HOCKEY CALGARY (NHL) - Recalled Steve Guenette, goalie, from Salt Lake City of the International Hockey League. PITTSBURGH (NHL) - Traded Rod Buskas, defenseman, to the Vancouver Canucks for a sixth-round choice in the 1990 entry draft. TORONTO (NHL) - Recalled Sean McKenna and John McIntyre, forwards, from Newmarket of the American Hockey League. WASHINGTON (NHL) - Returned Olaf Kolzig, goalie, to Tri-Cities of the Western Hockey League. SOCCER SAN DIEGO (MISL) - Acquired Damir Haramina, forward, from the Kansas City Comets for an undisclosed future draft choice.

title: Washington Post Co. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago 9-month results included a non-recurring gain of $115.7 million from the sale of certain cellular telephone interests.

title: William Joseph McKeon, Professor, 80
description: William Joseph McKeon, a former marketing professor at New York University's School of Business, died yesterday at his home in New Milford, N.J., after a long illness. He was 80 years old.

title: No Way to Meet the Garbage Crisis
description: New Yorkers had every reason to believe that the planned Brooklyn Navy Yard incinerator would proceed on schedule. But David Dinkins, running for mayor, now asserts that if elected, he would defer building the plant for three years pending study. The incinerator needs no further study. To delay its construction would only aggravate the impending garbage crisis.

title: Trust May Sell Manville Or Shift It to Private Control
description: The trust that owns the majority of the Manville Corporation's stock and was intended to help the company resolve its asbestos liability is exploring the sale of the company or putting it into private hands, trust officials said yesterday.

title: Harley-Davidson Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 24
description: b-After income from discontinued operations of $414,000, or 5 cents a share for the quarter and $1,191,000, or 14 cents a share for the 9 months, and extraordinary charges of $1,078,000 and $2,680,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. c-After income from discontinued operations of $401,000, or 5 cents a share and $1,159,000, or 15 cents a share for the quarter and 9 months, respectively, and extraordinary charges of $1,262,000 for the quarter and $2,002,000 for the 9 months. The company said the extraordinary items included the cost of debt repurchase and additional settlement costs.

title: I.B.M. and Digital Expand Product Lines
description: In a move to increase its presence in the factory automation market, the International Business Machines Corporation yesterday introduced an array of machines and software packages to promote computer-integrated manufacturing. More than 50 separate items are involved, the company said.

title: U.S. Concern Rises Over North Korea Atom Plant
description: Bush Administration officials said today that they were increasingly worried that North Korea may be trying to develop nuclear weapons.

title: Earthquake Cuts Ratings Of Networks
description: The three major television networks held just 64 percent of the prime-time audience last week, in part because of the earthquake. ABC was hardest hit, with the postponement of the World Series and the loss of its Tuesday night comedy lineup (although reruns of two hit programs - ''Roseanne'' and ''The Wonder Years'' - were shown before earthquake coverage began). All three networks broadcast earthquake specials on Wednesday night, further disrupting schedules.

title: Amoco Production
description: The Amoco Production Company, a unit of the Amoco Corporation, said it plans to install two platforms and drill as many as 22 wells to develop significant oil reserves it has discovered in the Atlantic Ocean about 25 miles off the coast of Congo. It said production is expected to be about 40,000 barrels of oil a day.

title: AMCA International reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included income from discontinued operations of $26,410,000, or 20 cents a share for the quarter and $27,799,000, or 28 cents a share for the 9 months. c-Included income from discontinued operations of $1,978,000, or 2 cents a share and $3,398,000, or 5 cents a share for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. The company said the 1989 income from discontinued operations included a $25 million gain related to the sale of the industrial automation segment.

title: Genuine Parts Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
New Orleans Journal; In the Birthplace of Jazz, Fans Fight Its Decline
description: Jazz, live, hot and syncopated, once splashed through streets here nonstop, through open doorways and at honky-tonks, dime-a-dance halls and society balls. But in the age of rap music and MTV, jazz has fallen on hard times.

title: Tough Classic Field Keeps Entries Low
description: The 7 Breeders' Cup races at Gulfstream Park in Hallandale, Fla., on Nov. 4 have attracted 101 horses, but only 8 of them will run in the afternoon's last and richest race, the $3 million Classic.

title: Bridge
description: Bridge players are generous contributors to worthwhile causes. In 1988, events around North America raised $425,000 for the Charity Foundation of the American Contract Bridge League, which makes grants to a number of major charities. And the charity games for specific causes probably raise more than that total.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: JUDY TWERSKY is leaving her office at Broadway and 50th Street, heading for home. There is a larger-than-usual crowd on the sidewalk; Ms. Twersky sees that a section of the street is roped off, Hollywood-type lights are on, cameras are rolling. Action involves a snappily dressed couple and a taxi.

title: Beazer Plc reports earnings for Year to June 30
description: b-After an extraordinary charge of $8,800,000. c-Included an extraordinary gain of $26,400,000. Share earnings are fully diluted excluding exceptional items. Share earnings represent American Depositary Receipts (ADR); each ADR consists of 4 common shares. Results are in U.S. dollars.

title: Making a 'Dumb' Movie Into a Hit
description: A surprise hit rarely surprises Hollywood. ''Look Who's Talking,'' which has sold more than $30 million worth of tickets in 10 days, is an exception.

title: Review/Film; Two Bears Who Are Just Plain Folks
description: The nervous young actor warily edges up to his older, more seasoned co-star. They stare at each other for a long moment. Then, very tentatively, they move closer. They embrace. They begin to nuzzle. They kiss. It's a big, wet, messy one.

title: Howard Savings Bank reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
New Strawberries Chief To Expand Music Chain
description: Melvin A. Wilmore, a former president of the Zale Corporation's jewelry store division, has been named chief executive and president of Live Entertainment Inc.'s retail group, a chain of 85 Strawberries record stores in New England, upstate New York and the Philadelphia area.

title: Asarco Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago figures have been restated. The company said included in the latest third quarter are four items - a charge the sale of a stake in an asbestos mining business, a charge on the sale or closing of the Rapatee coal mine, a reduction in income tax from a Canadian court ruling and a recording of previously deferred equity earnings from certain Mexican operations - which had net effect of reducing net by $6.4 million, 15 cents a share.

title: LITTLE HOPE HELD BY TEXAS RESCUERS
description: Rescue workers today held out little hope of finding any survivors in the smoldering wreckage of a petrochemical complex devastated by an explosion and fire on Monday, acknowledging that as many as 24 people may have died.

title: Times Mirror Co. reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 1
description: b-Included a gain on sales of assets of $23,056,000, or 11 cents a share. c-Included a gain on sales of assets of $26,483,000, 14 cents a share from the sale of Timberlands in the quarter; the 9 months included a gain on sales of assets of $56,905,000, or 30 cents a share. Excluding the gains, 9-month share earnings were $1.62 compared with $1.52 for the prior 9-month share earnings. Earnings per share are based upon the weighted average number of shares of common stock and common stock equivalents, stock options, outstanding. Average shares were 129,445,000 in 1989 and 128,856,000 in 1988.

title: The California Quake; Power of the Quake Raised by New Measure
description: The United States Geological Survey today raised its estimate of the magnitude of the California earthquake on Tuesday to 7.1 on the Richter scale from 6.9.

title: Universal Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an accounting adjustment of $7,984,000, or 47 cents a share, from the adoption of FAS 96. Revenue represents gross revenues.

title: Belo (A.H.) Corp.(N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Ingersoll-Rand reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary credit due to tax loss carryforwards of $8.5 million, or 17 cents a share.

title: AFTER SETBCKS, A BUSH OFFENSIVE
description: Scrambling to recover from legislative setbacks that one aide said had left the White House ''reeling,'' the Bush Administration today sought to focus attention on the Federal budget and away from emotional issues like abortion.

title: 2 Expulsions in Hazing Death
description: Morehouse College announced Monday that two students have been expelled because of a fraternity hazing that led to a potential member's death last week. Eight other students were suspended for one year. The college said all were members of Alpha Phi Alpha fraternity, the nation's oldest black Greek-letter fraternity. Joel Allen Harris, 18, of New York City, died Wednesday after he was purportedly shoved when he did not answer questions correctly.

title: Citgo Petroleum Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company said a non-cash lower- of-cost-or-market adjustment to book inventory values increased latest third quarter net income by $6.6 million while it reduced 1988 third quarter net by $16.1 million. Citgo Petroleum Corp., is a unit of Southland Corp.

title: The California Quake; No Quake Pictures for the Japanese
description: Japanese tourists visiting this city since the earthquake have been cautioned to keep their lens caps on.

title: Engelhard Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included $21.5 million, or 48 cents a share, from sale of a portion of its Japanese joint venture for both the quarter and 9 months. c-Included $3.7 million, or 8 cents a share, from petroleum refining contract settlement for both the quarter and 9 months. The company said the decline in sales was the result primarily of lower prices for precious metal raw materials.

title: Sterling Electronics Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income

title: Chevron Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company said latest quarter results included a $37 million gain from its exercise of stock appreciation rights received from the sale of its investment in Amax Inc. last year. This figure was mostly offset by a loss provision of $30 million for the disposition of certain producing properties. The company also said year-to-date earnings included net charges of $4 million related to special items, compared with net gains of $343 million from such items in the year-ago 9-month period.

title: Microamerica Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Reverberations for Industries But Not for U.S. Households
description: Severe damage from the lethal explosions and fire Monday at Phillips Petroleum's sprawling petrochemical plant near Houston will cause occasional shortages of some commonly used plastic containers in the coming months, but American consumers will see little impact, analysts said today.

title: Goodyear Tire & Rubber Co. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a charge of $95 million reflecting sales of unused pipe held by All American Pipeline unit and sale of South African subsidiary.

title: Edmonton Pride Brings In Tyson
description: The quick endings of Mike Tyson's bouts against Michael Spinks (93 seconds) and Carl (the Truth) Williams (91 seconds) have soured the casinos in Atlantic City and Las Vegas on Tyson as a spectacle for their high rollers. When the champion's promoter, Don King, sought a $2 million site fee for Tyson's defense against Donovan (Razor) Ruddock, a Jamaican who grew up in Toronto, the casinos passed.

title: Lessons
description: Ever since tuitions at private colleges began soaring in the early 1980's, college officials have been bracing for a revolt.

title: Bestar Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: New Plan Realty Trust reports earnings for Qtr to July 31
Forget Romeo and Juliet; Meet the Brands
description: NOTICE to all those who consider themselves the Ideal American Couple: forget it, you're not. Vicki and Keith Brand of Baton Rouge, La., are.

title: Ponce Federal Bank F.S.B.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income

title: People
description: * David Reich has joined Madeline de Vries Ltd. as a senior vice president.

title: The California Quake; Tangle of Paperwork Snarls Path to Aid For Farm Workers and Shop Owners
description: Homeless farm workers and owners of boarded-up businesses in this community devastated by the earthquake are encountering a hastily erected bureaucracy that is supposed to help them prop up their lives.

title: Judge Views Confession Tape in Jogger Rape
description: A videotaped statement in which a defendant in the Central Park rape case described his part in the attack on a jogger was played yesterday in State Supreme Court in Manhattan.

title: Investors Financial Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Interpublic Group of Compaies Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included net losses from exchange and translation of foreign currencies of $2,083,000 for the quarter and $3,401,000 for the 9 months. c-Included net losses from exchange and translation of foreign currencies of $1,735,000 for the quarter and $4,712,000 for the 9 months. The share earnings for 1988 have been restated to reflect the 3-for-2 stock split earlier this year. Revenue represented total gross income.

title: R. N. Rose Dies at 87; Oil Company Engineer
description: R. Nelson Rose, an engineer whose knowledge of rust inhibitors helped preserve equipment salvaged from the French liner Normandie after she sank in New York Harbor Feb. 9, 1942, died of a pulmonary embolism Sunday at Stamford (Conn.) Hospital. He was 87 years old and lived in Darien, Conn.

title: Cominco Ltd.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an extraordinary credit of $1,700,000, or 2 cents a share. Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: * Atlas Copco Roctec, Pine Brook, N.J., a mining and engineering company, named Alan Weiner president.

title: Mbongeni Ngema In Lincoln Center Series
description: Mbongeni Ngema, the director and co-composer of ''Sarafina!,'' will be the guest tomorrow in the Lincoln Center Off Stage series at the Bruno Walter Auditorium of the New York Public Library at Lincoln Center (Amsterdam Avenue at 65th Street.

title: Commercial Bancorp of Colo.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a gain of $491,000, or 32 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.

title: U.S. Decides to Scale Back Military Exercise in Europe
description: The United States has decided to scale back its major military exercise in Europe, American officials said today.

title: Safeway Stores Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 9
description: b-Included losses on company's equity investment in Vons Cos. of $11.8 million. c-Included gains of $23.5 million and $50.6 million from asset divestiture for the quarter and 9 months, respectively.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST
description: COMPANIES UAL's stock rebounded after plunging $33 early in the day and closed down $8.375, at $170. The recovery was spurred in part by rumors of stock purchases by two large investors. [ Page D1. ] The proposed takeover of United Airlines is a certain nominee for Wall Street's worst deal of the year. [ A1. ] Officials of the Transportation and Treasury Departments told a House subcommittee that proposed legislation to restrict airline takeovers would not be good for the industry or the economy. [ D8. ] The trust that owns the majority of Manville's stock is exploring whether to put the company up for sale. [ D1. ] A.T.& T. and Sun Microsystems are on the verge of winning the race to establish a new software standard. [ D1. ] I.B.M. introduced an array of products for computerized manufacturing. [ D4. ] Sears, Roebuck's profits fell 15.6 percent in the third quarter, relecting a sharp drop in retailing income and a rash of hurricane claims against Allstate Insurance. [ D1. ] Shell, Mobil and Chevron reported that profits were down slightly; Texaco reported higher total profits but a decline on a per-share basis. [ D7. ] A $2.25 billion offer for Public Service of New Hampshire is expected from shareholders and Northeast Utilities. [ D4. ] Salomon's earnings more than doubled in the third quarter, to $177 million, or $1.28 a share. [ D7. ] Times Mirror's earnings fell 13.4 percent; Knight-Ridder's net jumped 18.2 percent, while The Washington Post Company's profits were up 17.7 percent. [ D22. ] Mercedes-Benz introduced a high-performance roadster embodying new safety technology. [ D5. ] TECHNOLOGY The marketing of ''degradable'' plastic products is raising concerns that consumers worried about the environment are being lulled into an unwarranted sense of security. [ Page A1. ] Are plastic or paper bags a better choice for shoppers concerned about the environment? [ D9. ] MARKETS The stock market gyrated wildly on heavy volume. The Dow Jones industrial average plunged 85 points in the first hour of trading but recovered to close 3.69 points lower, at 2,659.22. [ D1. ] Stock index futures prices also fluctuated wildly. [ D18. ] The S.E.C.'s chairman, Richard C. Breeden, sent reassuring signals to the markets in a wide-ranging interview. [ D1. ] Prices of Treasury securities continued to climb and yields declined. [ D17. ] Yields were mixed on C.D.'s and money market accounts for the week ended yesterday. [ D17. ] The dollar finished lower against most leading currencies, depressed by the volatility of stock prices. [ D18. ] Shares sold short and not yet covered rose 6 percent in over-the-counter trading in the four weeks ended Oct. 13. [ D28. ] INTERNATIONAL The Bush Administration put forward a plan for knocking down trade barriers in services. [ D5. ] THE ECONOMY Sales of U.S.-built cars plunged 19 percent in mid-October and sales of domestic light trucks dropped 22.8 percent. [ D5. ] Orders for durable goods edged down 0.1 percent in September despite the second-biggest increase in military orders. [ D2. ] TODAY'S COLUMNS

title: Rookies Lead Spurs Over Knicks
description: David Robinson has every physical skill to become an outstanding pro center.

title: ITT Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included ''fresh start'' tax benefits at the Hartford Insurance Group of $8 million, or 6 cents a share, for the quarter and $25 million, or 17 cents a share, for the 9 months. c-Included ''fresh start'' tax benefits at the Hartford of $12 million, or 8 cents a share, and $35 million, or 24 cents a share, for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. The primary earnings per share in 1989 reflected the benefit from the repurchase of common stock with proceeds from the issuance of convertible preferred stock earlier this year in connection with the company's Employee Stock Ownership Plan.

title: Interstate Power Co. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The latest quarter and year included net of $1,541,000 and $1,856,000, respectively, from partial recovery of bad debt from a customer.

title: P.&G. Profit Rises by 38%
description: The Procter & Gamble Company, the huge consumer products concern based in Cincinnati, announced yesterday that its first-quarter profit jumped by 38 percent, to $551 million, from $400 million a year earlier.

title: Revamping Set For Allied Group
description: Allied Group Inc. said its directors and its parent company, the Allied Mutual Insurance Company, had approved a series of transactions to enhance its core business of property casualty insurance and to give employees a long-term stake in the organization. First, Allied Mutual will buy Allied Group's life insurance subsidiary for 2.7 million shares of Allied Group common stock, valued at $36.5 million. Second, it will establish a leveraged employee stock ownership plan for all employees of Allied Group and Allied Mutual, to replace the existing plan, it said. Through the sale of the life subsidiary and the ESOP's stock repurchase, employees will become owners of at least 30 percent of Allied Group, and Allied Mutual's ownership will be cut to 40 percent.

title: Doubts Are Voiced on 'Degradable' Plastic Waste
description: An innovative and widely promoted effort to sell plastic products that are ''degradable'' could be causing more environmental problems than it is solving.

title: Euro Disney Shares Climb
description: Shares in Europe's Disney theme park soared 18 percent today when London's Stock Exchange allowed gray market trading to begin.

title: Magna Group Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Genentech Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Olajuwon in Doubt
description: Coach Don Chaney of the Houston Rockets said on Monday that Akeem Olajuwon, his 7-foot center from Nigeria, may not be ready to play at full speed when the Rockets open their National Basketball Association season on Nov. 3 against the Clippers in Los Angeles. Since preseason practices began, Olajuwon has been restricted to conditioning drills while continuing rehabilitation from a blood clot in his leg. He cannot participate in contact drills until he stops taking blood thinners.(AP)

title: National Pizza reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 26
Scott Paper Ltd. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Figures are in Canadian funds.

title: Medical Care International reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After extraordinary credits of $584,000 for the quarter and $1,957,000 for the 9 months, from utilization of net operating loss carryforwards. c-After extraordinary credits of $1,283,000 for the quarter and $3,549,000 for the 9 months, from utilization of net operating loss carryforwards.

title: 60-Minute Gourmet
description: THE integration of Oriental cooking techniques and Western cuisine is well established by now. Many concepts that are now part of seafood cooking vernacular are a result of travel by French and American chefs, particularly in Japan.

title: International Microelectronic Products Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 24
description: b-Net income

title: An Ohio Fair Where Big (and Orange) Is Beautiful
description: AS the time approached to set his entry on the scales for the city's 83d Pumpkin Show weigh-in, David Mangione, an agricultural extension agent in nearby Chillicothe, shook his head.

title: Fireman's Fund Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included ''fresh start'' benefits of $7.1 million and $24.7 million for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. c-Included ''fresh start'' benefits of $10.1 million for the quarter and $35.2 million for the 9 months, the 9 months also included an extraordinary charge of $11,659,000 from debt extinguishment cost. The company said year-ago share earnings and shares outstanding for the quarter and 9 months are restated to reflect common stock equivalents. Latest quarter share earnings was a loss of 5 cents a share after preferred stock dividends. Pre-tax realized capital gains totaled $54 million and $86 million in the latest quarter and 9 months, respectively, compared to losses of $875,000 in the year-ago quarter and capital gains of $12 million in the 9 months. The company also said hurricane Hugo accounted for about $36 million in pretax third quarter losses, net of reinsurance recoveries. Financial results do not include any losses related to the Oct. 17 California earthquake.

title: Intelligence Official Plans to Leave F.B.I. For Private Industry
description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation's top counterintelligence official is leaving the agency to take a job in private industry, a spokesman for the bureau said today.

title: Mayor Offers Trims in Social Services
description: The blueprint offered yesterday by Mayor Edward I. Koch for balancing the city budget would reduce spending for day care, foster care, education, fire investigation, street cleaning and library services, among other things.

title: Market Place Added Volatility Expected in 'Junk'
description: AFTER going their separate ways most of this year, the ''junk bond'' and stock markets now seem to share anxieties. When the Dow Jones industrial average plunged almost 86 points yesterday morning, prices of some high-risk, high-yield bonds fell sharply as well. Then when stock prices later recovered, junk bonds rose slightly.

title: Review/Recital; A Prize-Winning Pianist
description: One of Norman Krieger's rewards for winning the Palm Beach Invitational International Piano Competition was his solo piano recital at Alice Tully Hall on Sunday night. Mr. Krieger is from Los Angeles, studied at the Juilliard School and has been on the performing circuit since the 1970's.

title: Santa Fe Realty Spinoff Is Planned
description: The Santa Fe Pacific Corporation, which is negotiating to sell 20 percent of its real estate subsidiary to the California Public Employees Retirement System, intends to spin off the remaining 80 percent to shareholders by Jan. 1, 1992, the company said. Santa Fe, the Chicago-based railroad company, said it was still negotiating with the pension plan to sell a stake in the Santa Fe Realty Corporation.

title: Centel Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After income from discontinued operations of $204,446,000 and $211,874,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively, which both included a $200.8 million gain from the sale of three Cable Television units, and extraordinary credits of $1,426,000 for both the quarter and 9 months. c-Included income from discontinued operations of $4,923,000 and $11,981,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively.

title: As Edmonton's Center, Carson Was an Outsider
description: Last year's Wayne Gretzky trade is still jolting the Edmonton Oilers, sometimes in unexpected ways.

title: Harris Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 29
description: b-After a loss from discontinued operations of $2,443,000.

title: Economic Scene; Unleashing Ma Bell
description: COULD A.T.&T.'s rivals in long-distance phone service survive no-holds-barred competition? Since the breakup of the telephone monopoly in 1984, the Federal Communications Commission has kept A.T.&T. on a short leash to prevent the giant company from chewing up the ''small fry.''

title: Quaker Oats Co. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Decaffeinated Coffee: A New Brew
description: AT a benefit party tomorrow evening for the Fresh Air Fund at Roseland in Manhattan, only decaffeinated coffee will be served. Two weeks ago at a dinner for the New York Public Library, the waiters poured decaffeinated coffee exclusively for the 400 or so guests, who included Barbara Bush.

title: Soviet Legislature Votes to Abolish Official Seats
description: The Soviet legislature voted today to eliminate special seats for the Communist Party and other official organizations in national and local elections, responding to sharp popular criticism that such reserved slots were undemocratic.

title: On the Road With Art: A Mission for 80 Years
description: Eighty years ago, when art in America was the all-but-exclusive domain of the Eastern elite, Theodore Roosevelt's Secretary of State, Elihu Root, urged that an organization be created to bring ''exhibitions of original works of art on tour to the hinterlands of the United States.''

title: Atlantique Video reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 9
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: German Return For Rothschilds
description: The Rothschild banking family ended an 88-year absence from Germany this week by opening an office in Frankfurt, the family's historic hometown. The Rothschilds, who had lived in Frankfurt since the Middle Ages, closed their last German firm in 1901. By that time, financial activity had shifted elsewhere, and family interests in Paris and London had eclipsed those in Frankfurt.

title: American National Insurance reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Federal Mogul Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a $5.3 million, or 23 cents a share, after-tax net gain from reorganization activities. c-Included 14 cents a share in earnings related to businesses sold. d-Included 2 cents a share net gain on dispositions.

title: Knight-Ridder Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a loss of $316,000 for the quarter and income of $728,000, or 1 cent a share, for the 9 months, both from discontinued operations, and gains on disposal of discontinued operations of $4,165,000, or 8 cents a share, and $59,687,000, or $1.14 a share, for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. c-After income from discontinued operations of $2,199,000, or 4 cents a share, for the quarter and $5,990,000, or 11 cents a share, for the 9 months. The latest 9 months' income from continuing operations included a pre- tax gain of $49,076,000 on the sale of Pasadena newspaper.

title: Komag Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 1
description: b-After extraordinary credits of $5,000 for the quarter and $1,137,000, or 9 cents a share, for the 9 months, both from tax loss carryforwards. c-Net income The latest quarter and 9 months included minority interests in the net loss of a subsidiary of $321,000 and $526,000, respectively.

title: Texaco Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included the first-quarter net restructuring gain of $1,190 million, or $4.87 a share, primarily relating to the gain from the sale of Texaco Canada Inc. c-Included a second-quarter restructuring gain of $225 million, or 92 cents a share, from the sale of Deutsche Texaco. Results for 1989 excluded operations of Texaco Canada, Deutsche Texaco and 50 percent of Star Enterprises joint venture, which were sold in the company's restructuring program.

title: Autodie Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
description: b-Included an extraordinary credit of $758,187, or 15 cents a share.

title: Leontine Sharaga, Dentist, 95
description: Leontine Sharaga, one of the first female dentists in New York City, died of colon cancer Saturday at Montefiore Hospital. She was 95 years old and lived in the Bronx.

title: Standard Pacific L.P. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Latest 9-month results included a gain of about 6 cents a unit from the sale of an industrial building located in Orange County, Calif.

title: First Federal S&L (Fla.) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company attributed the decline in earnings to decreased net interest income, increased operating expenses, and to a lesser extent, the implementation of SFAS 91, which requires the deferral of loan origination fees.

title: Ranking of 'Best Colleges' Rankles Many Educators
description: Two years ago two dozen presidents of top American colleges and universities paid a visit to U.S. News & World Report to complain about the magazine's ''America's Best Colleges'' rankings. They said the methodology was flawed and the survey was a disservice to thousands of high school students seeking direction in choosing a college.

title: Homefed Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
As Tension Subsides, A's Feel a Bit Readier
description: The aftershocks have not yet subsided, nor has the memory of the earthquake that shook the Bay Area last week, but there was finally a sense today that things were back to normal with the Oakland Athletics.

title: Half-Price Tuition Plan
description: Students attending parochial and public high schools in Hartford are being offered a 50 percent discount in tuition and fees at the University of Hartford, the school announced today.

title: SJW Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
The Cold War Becomes Bad Politics
description: A single day's news brings three striking signs of change toward a less threatening world order: Hungary's Parliament proclaims its nation a republic, dropping the adjectives ''Socialist People's'' and dramatically distancing the country from the Soviet empire. Foreign Minister Eduard Shevardnadze of the Soviet Union says the nations of Eastern Europe have ''absolute freedom of choice.'' Then, in an extraordinary confession, he acknowledges that Moscow violated international norms by invading Afghanistan, and violated the Antiballistic Missile Treaty by building a radar station in Siberia. Secretary of State James Baker, in a speech on arms control, declares that Mikhail Gorbachev's reforms provide the ''clearest opportunity to reduce the risk of war since the dawn of the nuclear age.''

title: Saudis Ask Beirut Legislators to Meet
description: Saudi Arabia proposed today that Lebanon's Parliament meet in Beirut in two weeks to elect a new President and start putting into effect political changes intended to end 14 years of civil war.

title: AST Research reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 29
Templeton Re-signs
description: Garry Templeton, the 33-year-old shortstop for the San Diego Padres, has signed a two-year contract, according to his agent, Richie Bry. Templeton will reportedly receive $1.2 million over the life of the contract, which includes playing incentives and award bonuses. In 142 games last season, Templeton batted .255, with 6 home runs and 40 runs batted in.(AP)

title: The Right Place for Baseball
description: Seven weeks after he succeeded the late A. Bartlett Giamatti as Commissioner of Baseball, Fay Vincent confronted a delicate decision. Should he cancel the World Series? Some people argued that it would be unnatural to continue play after the earthquake that plunged the two cities whose teams are represented - Oakland and San Francisco -into shock and grief.

title: Inter-Regional Financial Gr reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After extraordinary credits of $241,000, or 3 cents a share, for the quarter and $608,000, or 8 cents a share, for the 9 months, both representing gains from debt repurchase and tax loss carryforwards. c-Net loss and after extraordinary credits of $16,000 for the quarter and $769,000, or 10 cents a share, for the 9 months, both representing gains from debt repurchase and tax loss carryforwards.

title: ABOUT EDUCATION
description: Exposing the ignorance of the young is perennially popular with their elders. The latest example is ''50 Hours: A Core Curriculum for College Students'' by Lynne V. Cheney, chairwoman of the National Endowment for the Humanities.

title: BRIEFS
description: * Birtcher Corp., El Monte, Calif., a maker of electromedical and electrosurgical instruments, said it would acquire the Bard/EMS electrosurgery division of C. R. Bard Inc., Murray Hill, N.J., for $11 million.

title: Fruit of the Loom reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Corrections
description: A list of California earthquake victims published yesterday rendered a first name incorrectly. The victim was Marc A. Zambetti of San Francisco.

title: Words Fly on Marx-Engels-Platz: 'We Want Democracy'
description: ''Some heads must roll here,'' said the young philosophy graduate, looking straight into the eyes of a senior official of the Communist Party Central Committee. ''I mean Egon Krenz, whom you've just elected. I have no confidence in the man.''

title: Earnings More Than Double At Salomon in 3d Quarter
description: Reflecting increased business in the securities and energy businesses, Salomon Inc.'s earnings more than doubled in the third quarter to $177 million, or $1.28 a share, from $65 million, or 38 cents a share, for last year's third quarter.

title: Astral Bellevue Pathe reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
description: b-Included extraordinary credits of $1,075,000, or 13 cents a share for the quarter and $2,110,000, or 28 cents a share for the 6 months. c-Included extraordinary credits of $703,000, or 10 cents a share and $1,466,000, or 22 cents a share for the quarter and 6 months, respectively. The company said the special gain was from tax credits which it said should continue for several years. Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Fleming Cos.  reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 7
description: b-Included $6 million increased in bad debt reserves and $8.3 million pre-tax gain from sale of preferred stock of a former subsidiary for both the quarter and 9 months. c-Costs related to a lengthy strike reduced net income by $5.6 million in the third quarter.

title: Bakker Sentenced to 45 Years For Fraud in His TV Ministry
description: The evangelist Jim Bakker's long, slow fall from grace clattered to a crushing finale here today when Federal District Judge Robert Potter sentenced him to 45 years in prison and fined him $500,000.

title: Singapore Chief Fears for Cambodia
description: Prime Minister Lee Kuan Yew of Singapore is in an awkward position, and once again the intricacies of Cambodian politics have put him there.

title: Johnson & Johnson reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The per share figures reflected a recent 2-for-1 stock split.

title: Blackstone Financial Plans To Establish Mutual Fund
description: Blackstone Financial Management, a New York investment bank, will establish by the end of the year a new international mutual fund for the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation's mortgage-backed securities.

title: Sun Co. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss and included special charges of $297,000,000, aftertax, that were for the write-down of assets intended for sale and for the cost of anticipated employee terminations, office closings and other matters.

title: How C.I.A. Concocts Soviet Defense Numbers; Exchanges Work
description: To the Editor:

title: Loewy and de Harak Join Hall of Fame
description: The Art Directors Club bestowed a measure of immortality on two famous designers last week, inducting Rudolph de Harak and Raymond Loewy into its Hall of Fame.

title: The Mainstreaming of Marxism in U.S. Colleges
description: As Karl Marx's ideological heirs in Communist nations struggle to transform his political legacy, his intellectual heirs on American campuses have virtually completed their own transformation from brash, beleaguered outsiders to assimilated academic insiders.

title: Boulevard Bancorp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Boeing Jet Order
description: Canadian Airlines International Ltd., a unit of the PWA Corporation, said it would buy 16 more Boeing jets by 1994 and phase out its Airbus Industrie and McDonnell Douglas jets. In a statement, the company said it would buy six of Boeing's 747-400 aircraft and 10 of its 767-300er jets by 1994. Canadian Airlines said it would phase out its Airbus A310-300 jets between now and early 1992 and that it plans to sell at least four A310's in 1990. The company will keep its McDonnell Douglas DC10-30's until 1992, when it will begin selling the jets. It also said it would sell its three Boeing 747-100 jets by early 1990.

title: Grow Group reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss The company said net earnings included $10 million gain on sale of U.S. Paint and $330,000 cost of special proxy in 1989, and $1,170,000 in unusual items in 1988. The company also said the year-ago quarter's unusual charge of $1,170,000 was associated with the termination of a porposed merger with PPG Industries, a chemical fire at a Grow facility in Commerce, Calif., and a reduction of headquarters personnel.

title: York Financial Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The per share earnings were adjusted for the 10 percent stock dividend announced Friday, Oct. 20.

title: David Jacobson, Executive, 72
description: David J. Jacobson, a marketing executive, died of a heart attack Monday at his home in Mamaroneck, N.Y. He was 72 years old.

title: Grossman's Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary charge premium on prepayment and repurchase of long-term debt of $1,900,000 for both the quarter and 9 months.

title: Northern Telecom Ltd. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago figures have been restated to reflect the full consolidation of its finance subsidiaries.

title: FMC Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary charge from restructuring of long-term debt of $3,700,000 and $12,400,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively.

title: The California Quake; Where to Send Donations
description: Interaction, a voluntary relief assistance group supported by the Federal Government, has issued the following list of agencies to which money may be sent to assist earthquake victims: American Red Cross Disaster Relief Fund, P.O. Box 4691, Grand Central Station, New York, N.Y. 10163. Telephone: 800-453-9000. Americares Foundation, 161 Cherry St., New Canaan, Conn. 06840. Telephone: 203-966-5195. American Jewish World Service, 1290 Avenue of the Americas -11th floor, New York, N.Y. 10104. Telephone: 212-468-7380. Church World Service, P.O. Box 968, Elkhart, Ind. 46515. Telephone: 212-870-3151. Direct Relief International, 2801-B De La Vina Street, Santa Barbara, Calif. 93105. Telephone: 805-687-3694. Episcopal Church/The Presiding Bishop's Fund for World Relief, The Episcopal Church Center, 815 Second Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10017. Telephone: 800-334-7626, or in New York City 867-8400. Operation California/USA, 7615 1/2 Melrose Ave., Los Angeles. 90046. Telephone: 213-658-8876. The Salvation Army, San Francisco Earthquake Relief, 132 West 14th Street, New York, N.Y. 10011. Telephone: 212-807-4273. World Relief, P.O. Box WRC, Wheaton, Ill. 60189. Telephone: 312-665-0235. World Vision, 919 West Huntington Drive, Monrovia, Calif. 91016. Telephone: 818-357-7979. Donations are also being collected by these groups: B'nai B'rith Bay Area Disaster Relief, B'nai B'rith, CVS. 1640 Rhode Island Avenue NW, Washington, D.C. 20036. Telephone: 202-857-6580. Feed the Children, P.O. Box 36, Oklahoma City. 73101-0036.

title: From London, 90's Mod, and From Belgium, Urban-Savage
description: Fashion interlopers of every stripe have invaded Paris in the last decade or so. Japanese like Issey Miyake and Yohji Yamamoto, Italians like Valentino and Romeo Gigli, even an American, Patrick Kelly, have essayed the risky French fashion runway, and emerged trailing clouds of glory.

title: China Says Hong Kong Apologized in Dispute
description: Chinese officials bitterly insisted today that the Hong Kong government had made concessions and apologies to persuade Beijing to resume accepting the return of Chinese illegal immigrants from the colony.

title: First City Bancorp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
East German Chief Elected, Not Unanimously
description: Egon Krenz, who became East Germany's Communist leader last week, was formally elected President today, although there were some votes against him in Parliament, which is usually a rubber stamp for the party.

title: Shevardnadze Is in Poland for Talks
description: The Soviet Foreign Minister, Eduard A. Shevardnadze, arrived in Warsaw today for talks with Polish officials on Moscow's relations with the new Government and with Warsaw Pact foreign ministers on the future of the Soviet-led alliance.

title: Rivals Adjust Their TV Ads In Mayor Race
description: David N. Dinkins and Rudolph W. Giuliani are turning to new television advertisements as they adjust their strategies to what they see as a tightening of the New York City mayoral race.

title: About New York; 35 Years Showing Warm Welcome At Carnegie Hall
description: Beginning with Andrew Carnegie, philanthropists have supported one of the world's most renowned concert halls. Boxes, rehearsal studios and recital halls bear the names.

title: GNW Financial reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a credit of $86,000, or 4 cents a share. c-After an extraordinary charge of $53,000. There were no per share earnings for the year-ago periods because the company converted to stock ownership from a mutual in December 1989.

title: Blockbuster Entertainment Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago results are restated for the January 1989 acquisition of Major Video Corp. and the August 1989 acquisition of Video Superstore Master L.P.; these acquisitions were accounted for as poolings of interests.

title: Motel 6 reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 27
The California Quake; RED CROSS MOUNTS 2-COAST OPERATION
description: The American Red Cross, which mounted the largest relief operation in its recent history last month in the aftermath of Hurricane Hugo, is now fighting a two-coast battle as it stretches its resources to assist the victims of the San Francisco area earthquake.

title: Higher Offer For Utility Due Today
description: Heating up the bidding for the bankrupt Public Service Company of New Hampshire, Northeast Utilities and the Public Service shareholders' committee will file a $2.25 billion purchase plan with the bankruptcy court today, Northeast said last night.

title: Review/Dance; Christine Dakin in Graham's 'Rite'
description: Christine Dakin has danced with extraordinary passion and artistry during the season of the Martha Graham Dance Company that just ended at City Center. Her performance on Saturday afternoon in Miss Graham's version of ''The Rite of Spring'' was no exception.

title: Goodyear Net Advances 11%
description: The Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company reported today that its third-quarter profit rose 11 percent over a year ago because of improved tire sales.

title: Woman Shot in a Robbery Gives Birth and Then Dies
description: A woman who had been robbed and shot along with her husband gave birth by Caesarian section early today and then died of a head wound that she received in the assault.

title: On Jersey Shore, a Crucial State Race
description: The 10th Assembly District in Ocean County has been one of the country's fastest-growing areas over the last two decades as retirees and former summer visitors have taken up permanent residence.

title: Move to Dismiss a Tenured Professor Is a First at Kansas
description: For the first time since the University of Kansas opened in 1866, administrators are trying to dismiss a tenured professor, a rare action in any American college.

title: Freeport-McMoran Resource Partners L.P.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Share earnings represent units.

title: Turning Stars Into Environmentalists
description: There was Morgan Fairchild, her golden mane unusually prim and preppy, lecturing the self-deprecatingly pompous anchor Murphy Brown, also known as Candice Bergen, about the environment. A funny flip-flop of stereotypes, of sorts; a sitcom turned morality tale.

title: Reviews/Music; Schubert, Hindemith and Prokofiev, by Dutoit
description: Many successful conductors carve out special spaces for themselves in the repertory, areas in which they are temperamentally and technically comfortable with general types of music or specific historical styles. As a consequence, they may steer away from large blocks of the orchestral literature in which they feel less than entirely at home. During his New York Philharmonic regime, Zubin Mehta has left Baroque music to guest conductors. Toscanini conducted almost no Tchaikovsky, Fritz Reiner hardly any Stravinsky or Mahler. The all-purpose virtuoso maestro has always been an exception.

title: Mercedes Two-Seater
description: Mercedes-Benz of North America, fighting a competitive onslaught of new Japanese luxury cars, took the wraps off its latest weapon today: a high-performance roadster embodying new safety technology.

title: Legg Mason Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Lewis Starts Suit Over Drug Accusations
description: Carl Lewis, the American sprinter, has initiated legal proceedings in Canada against a West German magazine and a Canadian cable network for having said that he used performance-enhancing drugs.

title: Reporter's Notebook; Hungary Hits Ruts on Road To Pluralism
description: heady wine of freedom, Hungarians are learning, is like the deep red wine they call Bull's Blood: the headaches can be as strong as the high.

title: Florida School Bond Offering
description: The Broward County School District in Florida priced a public bond offering of $185 million in general obligation school bonds yesterday with a maximum yield of 7.25 percent for an issue due in 2008 through underwriters led by the First Boston Corporation.

title: Pressed on the Homeless, Subways Impose Rules
description: With riders expressing unease about the increasing presence of panhandlers and homeless people in the subway, the New York City Transit Authority is to begin enforcing rules of conduct today that prohibit behavior considered disruptive, including begging and lying down on train seats.

title: Intertan Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary loss of $220,000. c-After an extraordinary credit of $206,000, or 2 cents a share.

title: Lam Research Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 1
From Poverty to Literary Success to Poverty
description: Nelson Algren A Life on the Wild Side By Bettina Drew 416 pages. G. P. Putnam's Sons. $27.95.

title: Restricting Airline Deals Is Criticized
description: Officials of the Transportation and Treasury departments told a House subcommittee today that proposed legislation to restrict airline takeovers would not be good for the industry or the economy.

title: Combustion Engineering reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included extraordinary credits of $5,321,000, or 13 cents a share for the quarter and $16,741,000, or 43 cents a share for the 9 months. c-Net loss Included in the latest third quarter is a pretax gain of $22.4 million from the sale of its minority interest in Stein Industrie. Included in the latest 9 months earnings is a pretax gain of $40.4 million from the sale of assets. Included in the year-ago 9 months is a $165 million pretax provision for certain charges and a pretax gain of $28.2 million on the sale of assets. The extraordinary gains in the latest quarter and 9 months represent tax credits.

title: Times Mirror Earnings Drop 13.4%
description: The Times Mirror Company reported today that its third-quarter earnings dropped 13.4 percent, reflecting a special gain in the 1988 quarter, while two other newspaper companies reported advances for the 1989 quarter.

title: Sears, Roebuck & Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included income from discontinued operations of $5,000,000, or 1 cent a share, and $62,700,000, or 17 cents a share, for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. c-Included a loss from discontinued operations of $15,000,000 and $56,100,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively; the 9 months also included a gain from an accounting adjustment of $544,200,000, or $1.44 a share. The company said net income in the latest period was reduced by $80 million, or 23 cents a share, by Hurricane Hugo-related damage claims at its Allstate insurance unit.

title: Third World Debt Plea
description: Third world countries asked the European Community Monday to forgive $200 billion of African debt under a new trade agreement that will go into effect next year.

title: Melville Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Share earnings were after effect of 2-for-1 stock split effective Feb. 23. Melville said share earnings for the quarter and 9-month periods have been adversely affected by the dividends on preferred stock issued to the employee stock ownership plan reported on June 13, and the timing of its stock repurchase program.

title: Consolidated Edison reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago share earnings results are restated to reflect a 2-for-1 stock split effective in June.

title: Inner City: Estimating The Worth
description: In 1983, David N. Dinkins valued his stock in a privately held communications company at more than $1 million. In 1986, when he sold the shares to his son, he placed the value at $58,000.

title: PROFITS SCOREBOARD
description: See accompanying notes for special items.(Loss) *Loss in year-earlier period.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''Those of us who do have a religion are sick of being saps for money-grubbing preachers and priests.'' - Judge Robert Potter, in sentencing Jim Bakker to prison. [ A1:4. ]

title: Control Data Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an overall pre-tax gain of $8.5 million from restructuring, derived from gain of $33.7 million on asset sales, including recently completed sale of the disk-drive subsidiary whose results are included in the latest period, which is partially offset by charges of $25.2 million, and the 9 months included a total of $448.6 million in pre-tax charges related to restructuring. c-Net loss and included a $4.6 million pretax gain from restructuring, and a $3.8 million income-tax credit. d-Net income

title: BRIEFS
description: Debt

title: Crystal Brands reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company said sales for the 1989 quarter and 9 months included the results of operations of Palm Beach and Trifari; in the 1988 periods, the results of Trifari, which was acquired on April 30, 1988, were included only for the months of May through September, and the results of Palm Beach, acquired on Dec. 15, 1988 were not included.

title: Robinson Is Let Go As Mets Coach
description: Nearly three weeks after they decided to keep Dave Johnson as their manager, the Mets today dismissed two of his five coaches, Bill Robinson and Sam Perlozzo.

title: Walker Returns to Jets
description: Wesley Walker officially rejoined the Jets today and Mark Malone became the backup quarterback to Ken O'Brien.

title: Urban Jobless Joined to Suburban Jobs
description: Tenants of a Chicago public housing project last week joined the nation's growing ranks of low-income, long-distance commuters, riding a new bus service designed to connect inner city people unable to find jobs with suburban employers who cannot find enough workers.

title: Massachusetts Bond Yields Set
description: A $220 million Massachusetts general obligation bond issue was priced yesterday through competitive bidding and won by a group of underwriters led by Goldman, Sachs & Company.

title: Debating Face to Face - to Face
description: In 13 days New Yorkers go to the polls to choose their next mayor, yet no televised debate has been scheduled between David Dinkins and Rudolph Giuliani. The voters, who for the first time are contributing tax dollars to help finance a mayoral campaign, have every right to feel cheated. New Yorkers are entitled to see the candidates together on the same platform and, at long last, to hear them ventilate their views of the central problems facing the next mayor.

title: First Financial Bancorp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Johnson Net Rises 10.4%
description: Johnson & Johnson, the diversified health-care products company, said yesterday that net income rose 10.4 percent in the third quarter.

title: Review/Television; Washington, a Useful Peg for Plot Concepts
description: How do you perceive Washington? Impressions of the city may range from, at one extreme, intellectual think tanks pondering the essays of Francis Fukuyama to, at the other, enormous drug problems and soaring crime rates. In between, of course, there is the steady flow of scandals, political and personal. It happens that three new hourlong television series are supposedly set in Washington: ''Top of the Hill,'' CBS, Thursdays at 9; ''Snoops,'' CBS, Friday at 8; and ''Mancuso, F.B.I.,'' NBC, Fridays at 10. Singly or in bulk, they reveal less about Washington than about the mechanics of prime-time entertainment.

title: Comdial Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income

title: Alexander's In the Bronx
description: Alexander's Inc., the New York-based chain of 11 department stores, will open a new 147,000-square-foot department store in the East Bronx, which will be its first new store in nine years.

title: Tapes Show Pair Sought Control Of Queens School District Hiring
description: While a new batch of secretly recorded tapes deepened a picture of school boards run as patronage factories, Chancellor Bernard Mecklowitz yesterday suspended a nine-member board in Queens, saying some board members made appointments in their district that were based on ''political agendas.''

title: Xerox Profit Rises by 6.2%
description: The Xerox Corporation today reported third-quarter net income of $155 million, up 6.2 percent from $146 million in the comparable quarter last year.

title: Real Estate; 2 Hotels Build For Business Travelers
description: BUSINESS travelers have long been the bread and butter of the hotel industry in Manhattan, but competition for this segment of the traveling public is heating up as the city's overall hotel occupancy rate drops and more hotels go up.

title: Comfed Bancorp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income

title: Koch Outlines 'Painful' Plan To Close Deficit
description: Declaring that ''bad news can't wait,'' Mayor Edward I. Koch yesterday presented a program of spending cuts, fee increases and other measures to close a $530 million budget deficit this year and reduce an even larger one that had been expected next year.

title: Borden Chemicals & Plastics L.P.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 29
description: Share earnings represent units.

title: More Jobs Are Cut At G.E. Division
description: The General Electric Company said it would eliminate the jobs of 1,100 salaried employees in its major appliance group in seven states because of weakening sales. The company said it hoped to cut most of the affected jobs by offering early retirement and transfers, but a spokesman said some layoffs may might required.

title: Berry Joining WPP Group
description: Norman C. Berry, who resigned as creative director of Ogilvy & Mather/New York in June, will take a senior position with Ogilvy's British parent, the WPP Group. Mr. Berry, who was also

title: POINDEXTER WINS ACCESS TO PAPERS KEPT BY REAGAN
description: A Federal district judge ruled today that John M. Poindexter is entitled to the personal papers and diaries of former President Ronald Reagan to demonstrate that his former boss authorized many of his actions in the Iran-contra affair.

title: 'College Age' Means Almost Any Age
description: On college campuses around the country, more and more people in their mid-20's to their 90's are joining their younger counterparts in pursuit of knowledge for their careers or their fulfillment.

title: Aceto Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Graf Gives Up Just 15 Points
description: Top-ranked Steffi Graf gave up ust a point in the first five games and went on to beat Laura Garrone, 6-0, 6-0, in the first round of a tennis tournament here today.

title: INSIDE
description: Hope Fades in Blast Rescue Rescue workers at a Texas chemical plant said up to 24 people may have died in the explosion there. Page A18. The Reverse Commuter In increasing numbers, low-income inner-city residents are taking daily trips to jobs in the suburbs. Page A16. North Korea and the Bomb Washington is increasingly worried that North Korea may be trying to develop nuclear weapons. Page A9. Flavor, but No Caffeine Decaffeinated coffees have come far since the days of little orange packets. The Living Section, page C1.

title: Customs Eases Rule On Seizing Vessels That Contain Drugs
description: The Federal guidelines instituted to hit hard at illegal drug users by seizing their cars and boats have been altered, allowing some people to pay fines and go on their way, a Customs Service official said today.

title: Income Climbs at Tenneco
description: Helped by the turnaround this year in its farm equipment business, a restructured Tenneco Inc. today reported net income of $90 million, or 68 cents a share, for the quarter ended Sept. 30. Last year, the company earned $7 million, or 2 cents a share, for the corresponding period.

title: Israel Accepts U.S. Plan on Talks, With a Catch
description: Israel has informed Secretary of State James A. Baker 3d that it accepts ''in principle'' Mr. Baker's five-point proposal for an Israeli-Palestinian dialogue, but has ''reservations'' about two important points, the Israeli Embassy said today.

title: Corrections
description: An obituary on Saturday about Samuel C. Pulitzer, a manufacturer of neckware, omitted a survivor. She is a daughter, Melanie Pulitzer Feldman of New Orleans.

title: Stake in Sealed Air
description: A group led by the Fort Hill Investors Management Corporation, a Boston investment firm, has lowered its stake in the Sealed Air Corporation to 1.7 percent from 7.23 percent. In a Securities and Exchange Commission filing, the investment group gave no reason for the sale. Sealed Air is a packaging materials concern based in East Saddle Brook, N.J. Shares of the company fell $1, to $20, on the New York Stock Exchange today, giving the company a market value of $164.2 million.

title: PGA Policy Board Upholds Limit for Foreign Players
description: The PGA Tour Policy Board on Monday rejected a proposal to cut from 15 to 12 the number of American tour events a foreign player must enter in order to retain membership in the PGA Tour and have freedom to play pro tournaments anywhere he wishes at any time.

title: Exxon Sues Alaska, Charging Cleanup Delay
description: The Exxon Corporation has sued the State of Alaska, charging that the cleanup of the nation's worst oil spill was hindered because the state opposed the use of oil-dispersing chemicals.

title: The Pop Life
description: David Byrne's Rhythms

title: Clashes in Southern Lebanon
description: Israeli troops shot and killed two guerrillas in the buffer zone in southern Lebanon today, military headquarters reported. The clash, north of Merj 'Uyun, came hours after the army said Israeli-backed Lebanese militiamen shot and killed two other guerrillas in the zone. Officials were unable to say if the victims were Palestinian or Lebanese guerrillas.

title: Open Positions on Short Sales Increase by 6% on Nasdaq
description: The National Association of Securities Dealers yesterday reported a 6 percent rise in short interest in actively traded over-the-counter securities in its national market system for the four weeks that ended on Oct. 13. In the previous reporting period from mid-August to mid-September, the increase was 1.1 percent.

title: Cray Research reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Ford Opening Office in Tokyo
description: The Ford Motor Company, seeking to gain a greater foothold for sales in Asia, said it was creating a headquarters in Tokyo for its Asia-Pacific business and assigning a corporate vice president to Japan.

title: How C.I.A. Concocts Soviet Defense Numbers
description: To the Editor:

title: Pinochet, to Avert a Walesa Visit, Frees 2
description: Just days before Lech Walesa of Poland was to come to Chile in sympathy with two labor leaders banished to internal exile, President Augusto Pinochet has pardoned the men.

title: Informix Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary credit of $615,000, or 5 cents a share, from a gain on repurchase and retirement of convertible subordinated debentures.

title: Eldec Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 24
description: b-Included an extraordinary credit of $652,000, 12 cents a share for both the quarter and 6 months. c-Included income from discontinued operations of $214,000, or cents a share and $516,000, or 10 cents a share for the quarter and 6 months, respectively.

title: Cobe Laboratories Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 29
Xerox Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Acquisition and financing interest and headquarters expenses were $39 million, compared with $18 million in year-ago quarter and $109 million versus $78 million in the 9 months.

description: Figures are in Canadian funds.

title: Numerica Financial reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income

title: Shell, Mobil and Chevron Profits Fall
description: Shell, Mobil and Chevron reported yesterday that third-quarter profits were down slightly from the year earlier, following a pattern set by Exxon on Monday. Texaco reported higher total profits but a decline on a per-share basis.

title: Mobil Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After income of $35 million, or 9 cents a share, from discontinued operations. The latest third quarter earnings included the previously reported $192 million gain from a Hong Kong property transaction in which the company received a lease on an alternate site and a cash payment in exchange for a lease on its existing terminal site. Mobil said its U.S. exploration and producing earnings were reduced $40 million by a restructuring provision. Mobil also said the 1988 third quarter benefited $157 million from foreign tax rate changes and were reduced $65 million by a property writeoff in international exploration and producing.

title: The Kremlin Apology: Excerpts From Speech
description: Following are excerpts from Foreign Minister Eduard A. Shevardnadze's speech on Monday to the Supreme Soviet, as translated by The Associated Press: Krasnoyarsk Radar

title: No Headline
description: The police were called last night to a raucous meeting of Community Board 3 on the Lower East Side, in which the board rejected a proposal to establish a curfew in Tompkins Square Park, the scene of clashes a year ago between the police and homeless people.

title: Kentucky Drops Plans for Football Lottery
description: In the face of opposition from the horse racing industry, Kentucky has abandoned a plan to have its lottery corporation take parimutuel bets on professional football.

title: Mayweather Adds an Extra Dimension
description: Mike Mayweather, the Army halfback programmed to run over Rutgers at West Point on Saturday, adds an extra dimension to the Black Knights' wishbone offense that Coach Jim Young has not previous enjoyed.

title: Psychological Preparation Is Giants' Primary Concern
description: Roger Craig, the San Francisco Giants' manager and resident psychologist, said today that his primary plan between now and the resumption of the World Series on Friday is to let his players have fun.

title: Durables Orders Down In September
description: Orders for ''big ticket'' durable goods edged down one-tenth of 1 percent in September, but the drop would have been more pronounced if not for the second-biggest increase in military orders on record.

title: Salomon Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company said the securities segment contributed $261 million to third quarter consolidated pretax earnings and were more than triple the $86 million earned in the comparable 1988 quarter. For the 9 months, the securities segment contributed $556 million to consolidated pretax earnings, compared to $418 million in the 1988 period.

title: Cadence Design Systems reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included pretax charge of $2.6 million in connection with the merger of SDA Systems Inc. and Ecad Inc. to form Cadence.

title: Foreign Ownership Worries American Film Makers
description: The film director Milos Forman and the head of the American Film Institute, George Stevens Jr., expressed concern today over foreign ownership of American movie companies.

title: Food Notes
description: Fruit With Sparkle

title: McGill Rejects $72-a-Share Bid
description: The McGill Manufacturing Company said its board had unanimously rejected an unsolicited tender offer of $72 a share from SKF A.B. of Sweden as inadequate and not in the best interests of McGill. But SKF, whose United States operations are based in King of Prussia, Pa., said it would continue its tender offer, which is scheduled to expire Nov. 7.

title: Atomic Plant Bonuses Stir Second Thoughts
description: The Energy Department acknowledged today that it might have erred in rewarding the private operators of several of its nuclear weapons plants with millions of dollars in bonuses despite serious failings to protect the health and safety of workers and nearby residents.

title: Dr. Phyllis Greenacre, 95, a Psychoanalyst
description: Dr. Phyllis Greenacre, a psychoanalyst and author, died yesterday at a nursing home in Ossining, N.Y. She was 95 years old and lived in Garrison, N.Y.

title: 3 Distinct Cultures In a Spicy Pork Dish
description: GROWING up in Puerto Rico, my wife, Gloria, loved pork dishes, especially those with beans and rice or with plantain bananas or sweet potatoes. As a result, pork, in one form or another, is featured often at our house, especially when cool weather sets in.

title: Deficit Reduction: A Love Story; We Made A Commitment
description: Those who call the 1985 Gramm-Rudman-Hollings balanced budget law a bad law because deficit targets have been missed and accounting gimmicks have been used to avoid tough decisions would probably also suggest that religion is a failure because there are so few saints in the world.

title: End Sought to Trade Barriers in Some Services
description: The Bush Administration put forward a blueprint today for ending trade barriers in a large number of services that account for more than a quarter of the world's $2 trillion of annual trade.

title: Exxon Capital
description: The Exxon Capital Corporation is offering $200 million of notes due in 1999 through underwriters led by Salomon Brothers Inc. Underwriters gave the notes an 8 1/4 percent coupon and priced them at 99.60, to yield 8.31 percent, or about 45 basis points more than Treasury securities with a similar maturity. A basis point is one-hundredth of a percentage point. Noncallable through maturity, the notes are rated Aaa by Moody's Investors Service and AAA by the Standard & Poor's Corporation

title:
BUSINESS PEOPLE;
Capitol Records Head Is Focusing on Artists
description: LEAD: Hale Milgrim, an executive at Elektra Records since 1984, was named president of Capitol Records yesterday to replace David Berman, who resigned last month because of differences over management.

title: For More Youths, It's Always Halloween
description: FOR many American teen-agers, Halloween is the one night they can freely act out their fantasies. Dressed in ghoulish masks and grisly costumes, they can become ax murderers, blood-sucking vampires or demons in search of bodies to possess. But a growing number appear to be embracing the morbid, pagan rituals of Halloween year round, cloaking themselves in what Dr. Paul King, a child psychiatrist, describes as ''a character armor of evil.''

title: Sierra Pacific Resources reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
STRINGENT CURBS ON ABORTION GAIN IN PENNSYLVANIA
description: The Pennsylvania House of Representatives today overwhelmingly approved stringent new restrictions on abortions, the first such legislative move since the United States Supreme Court's July ruling giving states wider authority to limit abortion.

The latest quarter and 9 months results included an investment loss of $34,944 and an investment gain of $246,930, respectively. The year-ago quarter and 9 months results included investment losses of $252,047 and $236,189, respectively.

description: Wall Street's nominee for this year's worst deal is clearly the proposed takeover of United Airlines.

title: Governments' Illegal Killings Are Reported by Rights Unit
description: Tens of thousands of men, women and children were illegally slain by government agents in at least two dozen countries in 1988, and the wave of such killings has continued this year, according to a report issued today by Amnesty International.

title: A.T.&T.-Sun Alliance Nears Software Victory
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company and Sun Microsystems Inc., whose strategic alliance angered their competitors and divided the computer industry last year, are close to winning the race to establish a new software standard.

McDonnell to Buy Applied Solar
description: The Applied Solar Energy Corporation, a maker of photovoltaic devices, said it and its majority shareholder, the American Cyanamid Company, had agreed to sell Applied Solar to the McDonnell Douglas Corporation, for $10 a share at closing plus contingent payments of up to 80 cents a share.

Eating WEll
description: HEALTH-CONSCIOUS shoppers who find it difficult enough to choose the nutritionally correct oil, life-enhancing crackers or the perfect yogurt might justifiably look forward to a time when products will carry a seal of approval from a reputable health organization.

title: The California Quake; Toll of Quake On the Freeway Is Still Disputed
description: State and Oakland police said today that they believe they have recovered all the bodies from the Oakland freeway that collapsed in last week's earthquake and that the number of victims there has reached 39.

title: Clark Equipment Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included income from discontinued operations of $1,000 and $363,000, or 2 cents a share for the quarter and 9 months, respectively, and extraordinary credits of $539,000, or 3 cents a share for the quarter and $1,264,000, or 7 cents a share for the 9 months. c-Included income of $358,000, or 2 cents a share and a loss of $2,273,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively, both from discontinued operations and extraordinary credits of $49,000 for the quarter and $6,683,000, or 39 cents a share for the 9 months.

title: Soros Sues Shearson
description: The international money manager George Soros has sued Shearson Lehman Hutton Inc., contending that the investment firm cheated a mutual fund out of $60 million by manipulating futures prices after the 1987 stock market crash.

description: A former Mississippi state agency dedicated to preserving segregation supplied state lawmakers, officials and educators with a standard pro-segregation speech to deliver before Northern audiences in 1963.

Ford May Seek All of Jaguar
description: The Ford Motor Company might try to buy Jaguar P.L.C. outright when British Government restrictions on investors' shares in the luxury auto maker expire at the end of 1990, Ford said today.

title: Lack of Witnesses in Killing of Concertgoer Puzzles Officials
description: The killing of a college student who was attending a Grateful Dead concert at the Meadowlands Sports Complex has left investigators wrestling with a puzzling circumstance: No witnesses have been found among the thousands of concertgoers.
