title: Possibility of a Reunited Germany Is No Cause for Alarm, Bush Says
description: President Bush said today that he did not share the worries of some European leaders about the possibility of German reunification, and he predicted major changes in Germany's status in the next decade.

title: Sheraton Moscow
description: The Sheraton Moscow, the first luxurious American hotel in the Soviet capital, will be built one mile from Red Square, Soviet and United States officials said. Sheraton officials described the six-floor, 450-room hotel as unprecedented in the Soviet Union. It will cost $75 million to construct at 26 Gorky Street, one mile from Red Square in the heart of Moscow, and is expected to be complete by 1992. The hotel, which is expected to charge $140 a night for a room, is the first of two to be built in Moscow under the agreement.

title: Judge Sentences Gabor To Three Days in Jail
description: Saying Zsa Zsa Gabor was ''without a hint of remorse'' for slapping a Beverly Hills police officer who stopped her car last June, a judge today sentenced her to three days in jail.

description: b-Included an extraordinary credit of $572,000, or 11 cents a share for both the quarter and 9 months.

title: Citicorp's Weekly Sale
description: Interest rates were mixed at Citicorp's weekly auction of 91-day and 182-day commercial paper yesterday.

title: Rochester Gas & Electric reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company said per-share earnings in the latest quarter were increased by about 7 cents because of a change in accounting method. But Rochester said latest 9 months and 12 month earnings were decreased by about 26 cents because of the accounting change. Additionally, year-ago 12 months net was reduced because of the write- off of disallowed expenses related to the company's 14-percent ownership of the Nine Mile Two nuclear plant. The earnings decline in the latest quarter was primarily due to costs associated with Nine Mile Two and with the company's Ginna nuclear plant.

title: Ex-Agent in Spy Case Will be Freed on Bail
description: At the direction of an appeals court, a Federal district judge who had ordered a former Federal agent held without bail in an espionage case ordered Monday that he be freed on bond of $357,000.

description: Year-ago results are restated to reflect prior year's acquisition accounted for by the pooling-of-interests method.

description: b-Net loss and included losses from discontinued operations of $227,865,000 and $204,181,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively, and the 9 months also included a gain of $27,033,000, or 47 cents a share, from an accounting adjustment. The company said loss from continuing operations of $30,098,000 included a $29,200,000 after-tax charge.

title: How Off Broadway Maneuvers To Get Good Word of Mouth
description: ''Word of mouth is without a doubt the single most important factor in leading to a play's long-term success,'' said Jerry Sterner, the author of ''Other People's Money.'' ''Good reviews are necessary to allow you to reach that first rush of public that will go out and give you the word of mouth. But even if you do get the reviews, if you don't get the word of mouth you'll close, and you'll close quickly. So word of mouth is not the only thing - it's everything.''

title: Amoskeag Bank Shares reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income

title: Lawyer Studies Recipes, Suspects Fraud
description: IN the beginning, there were cooks. They were the people who stood over a fire turning flora and fauna into dinner. Then the world changed. History books are light on the details, but sometime after the invention of the wheel, someone decided to watch the cook and document the alchemy that turns trophies of the hunt into balms to the stomach and soul. After that, there were cooks and there were recipe followers.

title: Metropolitan Financial Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary loss of $348,000.

title: The California Quake; Museums Find Most Pieces Unscathed
description: Most of the pins, hooks, wires and clips that secure the artworks at San Francisco's fine arts museums held tight through an earthquake strong enough to shake down a freeway overpass.

title: Citizens-Lakeland Deal
description: Citizens First Bancorp Inc. said today that it had signed a letter of intent to buy Lakeland First Financial Group Inc.'s Lakeland Savings Bank for $50.6 million in cash and stock. The deal provides Lakeland shareholders with the right to receive cash or convertible preferred stock having a value of $18 for each share of Lakeland common. The deal is subject to regulatory and shareholder approval.

title: Get the Solution to Air Congestion Back on the Right Track
description: To the Editor:

title: Oilers Catch the Islanders for Tie
description: The Islanders still don't have a victory at home and the Edmonton Oilers still aren't out of their slump. But almost everyone, especially Dave Chyzowski, went home with something to be happy about after the teams tied, 3-3, in overtime tonight before 10,409 at Nassau Coliseum.

title: Penguins Trade Buskas
description: Rod Buskas, a defenseman who is one of only nine players in Pittsburgh Penguins' history to play in more than 400 career games, was traded yesterday to the Vancouver Canucks for a sixth-round draft choice.

title: Freeport-McMoran Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago quarter and 9 months results reflect gains totaling $70,690,000 from the sale of units in an affliate and property distributions to Freeport-McMoran Inc. shareholders.

title: Roland Winters, 84; Played Charlie Chan
description: Roland Winters, an actor whose film portrayals included Charlie Chan and Elvis Presley's father, died of a stroke on Sunday at the Actors' Fund Nursing Home in Englewood, N.J. He was 84 years old.

title: Italian Court Bans Ads in TV Films
description: ''Serafino,'' a pleasant comic romance by the late director Pietro Germi, caused no great stir when it was released 19 years ago; lately, however, it has been sending ripples throughout the Italian entertainment world.

title: U.S. Petroleum Data
description: In millions of barrels except refinery utilization

title: USLife Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an extraordinary charge of $6,526,000, or 38 cents a share, relating to a judgment upheld against a subsidiary of the company by the Eighth Circuit Court of Appeals last month. The judment stemmed from a class action lawsuit initiated in 1975 that related to an acquisition by a company that was subsequently acquired by USLife Corp. Year-ago figures have been restated in accordance with FASB Statement No. 97.

title: Control Data Posts Profit
description: The Control Data Corporation said today that an extensive reorganization earlier in the year had enabled it to post a third-quarter profit of $9.8 million. In the period last year, it recorded a loss of $2.4 million.

title: 3 in Bush Cabinet to Join Giuliani Effort
description: Signaling President Bush's unusually strong support for Rudolph W. Giuliani's mayoral campaign, three Cabinet secretaries and the President's chief of staff will be the main attractions at Giuliani fund-raisers in the next week.

title: The California Quake; U.S. Relief Agency Seeks Relief From Criticism
description: The Federal Emergency Management Agency, the White House office that provides relief for victims in disasters like the California earthquake last week and Hurricane Hugo last month, is at the center of a storm of its own.

title: Lin Broadcasting Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company said latest quarter net was reduced by 4 cents a share by special legal and financial advisory costs of about $3.4 million which were incurred relative to the tender offer for the company by a McCaw Cellular Communications Inc. unit, and to the agreement and plan of merger with BellSouth Corp. concerning the acquisition of its domestic cellular operations. Lin said latest 9 months included costs of $6.7 million related to the special legal and financial adivisory costs.

title: Choosing Paper or Plastic at the Store
description: If you are at a grocery-store checkout counter and are offered a choice of plastic or paper shopping bags, which is the best choice in terms of the impact on the environment? Although most people assume it is paper, that is not always the case, said Jan Beyea, a senior scientist at the National Audubon Society.

title: Staggered Truck Hours Create Worse Problems
description: To the Editor:

title: New S.E.C. Chief Defines Goals
description: In his first public discussion of the future policy of the Securities and Exchange Commission since he took office as chairman two weeks ago, Richard C. Breeden sent reassuring signals to the markets today, saying that his agency would not press Congress to grant the commission power to close the nation's securities markets in times of crisis.

title: Ryder System Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included for the quarter a previously-announced aftertax charge of $57 million relating to adjustments to workers' compensation claims reserves, reductions in vehicle fleets, staff and facilities, and write-downs of assets; the 9 months were reduced by $51 million as a result of two unusual charges relating to the restructuring of certain businesses and a downward revaluation of goodwill. c-Net income d-Included an extraordinary loss of $18,581,000 relating to the company's repurchase of $158 million of its unsecured notes and is reflected net of income taxes. The company said the previous year's third quarter included gains on the sale of aircraft by the company's aviation leasing & services division. Effective January 1, 1988, the company adopted Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No. 96. The cumulative effect reflects primarily the reduction of deferred income taxes as a result of lower tax rates enacted in 1986.

title: HOMOSEXUALS GAIN MORE ACCEPTANCE
description: Public tolerance of homosexual relations between consenting adults has increased, returning to a level that existed in 1982 before public concern over the spread of AIDS caused a backlash against homosexuals, according to the latest Gallup Poll.

description: LEAD: Why did President Bush and the First Lady send me birthday greetings?

description: b-Net loss and after a pre-tax charge of $1,850,000 relating to premium costs under the company's general liability insurance policy.

title: Ohio Casualty Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company said estimated losses from Hurricane Hugo reduced net income by 32 cents a share in the latest third quarter. Direct losses are about $7 million before income taxes while losses from required participation in wind storm pools are estimated at $3 million before income taxes. Losses from the Oct. 17 earthquake in California have not yet been determined. Such losses will be recorded in the fourth quarter.

title: Earnings Increase At Two Media Leaders
description: Two marketing-communications concerns yesterday announced robust earnings. Shandwick P.L.C., the British public relations conglomerate, said its net income jumped 67.2 percent, to $:9.84 million, or $15.8 million, from $:5.77 million, or $9.3 million, in the previous fiscal year.

description: The third quarter earnings reflected a decrease of $90,000 in net interest income and increases in total operating expenses, compared with the year- ago period.

description: b-Included a loss of $42,000,000 from discontinued operations for the quarter, and the 9 months included income from discontinued operations of $48,000,000, or 33 cents a share. Revenues for the third quarter and 9 months are from continuing operations.

title: Henry Burnett Jr., 59, Direct-Mail Specialist
description: Henry Bowen Burnett Jr., a specialist in direct-mail marketing, died Friday at his home in Santa Barbara, Calif., after a long illness. He was 59 years old.

title: The California Quake; House Approves Aid Package For Quake and Storm Victims
description: In a swift response to the California earthquake, the House of Representatives today overwhelmingly approved a $2.85 billion disaster aid package.

description: Shell Oil is a unit of Royal Dutch Petroleum.

title: Crying 'Sellout,' Beirut Christians Rally Against Lebanese Accord
description: Thousands of Christians marched, burned tires and shut down businesses in Christian areas of central Lebanon today in demonstrations of support for Gen. Michel Aoun, the Christian who commands the Lebanese Army and who has rejected an accord reached by the Lebanese Parliament to end 14 years of civil strife.

title: School Tapes: 'We Got a Dirty District Here'
description: Following are excerpts of conversations taped this year by Colman Genn, superintendent in Community School District 27 in Queens, as transcribed by the Joint Commission on Integrity in the Public Schools. The first was with Salvatore Stazzone, a member of the Community School Board; Richard Lipkowitz, a teacher in the district, and Mr. Genn. The second was with Mr. Lipkowitz and Mr. Genn. Oct. 10 GENN: The personnel committee would sit together and discuss those issues, O.K.? The board chose never to sit down and discuss those issues. They have preferred frankly to come in one at a time, O.K.? And Mr. X calls me and gives me a, you know, a list of paras, and Mr. Y calls me and Mrs. J and Mrs. Q and R and S, T . . . You know? Up and down the line, I get, I get calls. UNKNOWN: Mmm-hmm. GENN: How do you centralize it and how do you control it? So that you don't have the issue all the time. UNKNOWN: [ unintelligible ] a little bit. GENN: And . . . do you feel that we can work together, in the sense of, the people you want to work with to control those issues? STAZZONE: I'll tell you [ unintelligible. ] GENN: [ Unintelligible. ] STAZZONE: We got a dirty district here. GENN: O.K. STAZZONE: We're all dirty. GENN: In what sense? STAZZONE: We've all sold out a certain extent. All right? Out of necessity. I mean, I was gonna get put at the end of the table, right? GENN: Mmm-hmm. STAZZONE: And I was gonna get absolutely nothing, you know? There was no negotiating done by anybody when we started up, that didn't exclude Sal Stazzone. Sal Stazzone was gonna get a big zero. GENN: You were excluded from all meetings, even after elections. STAZZONE: Definitely. LIPKOWITZ: I've never heard the word ''children'' or ''education'' enter into our discussions in the last few years. GENN: With Jimmy? STAZZONE: With anybody. [ Laughs. ] GENN: With anybody. LIPKOWITZ: Pat [ unintelligible ] brought it up twice. I remarked upon it to her. GENN: Mmm-hmm. You thought she was in the wrong place? LIPKOWITZ: The last couple of years in any of these matters, but that's the nature of the beast. Following are excerpts from a call by Mr. Genn: Oct. 13 LIPKOWITZ: I mean, I will convince him he's enjoying it. But, let's, let's take the whole store for years, but let's do it slowly like gentelmen and quietly, so we can put that off. A lot of these things we can put off. GENN: Yeah. LIPKOWITZ: And Jimmy's nervous, but he'll go along and we'll operate like gentlemen. GENN: O.K., do you, do you at this point, because he's nervous do you meet as a group, I mean, or do you? LIPKOWITZ: Nope. GENN: Just stay in the middle and you keep the control? LIPKOWITZ: Me, Sal and Jimmy. GENN: You, just you, Sal and Jimmy? LIPKOWITZ: Is Jimmy is, like, tells Sam [ Granirer, vice president of the board ] on a need-to-know basis, like we tell [ Frank ] Gulluscio [ president of the board ] . Probably a little better relationship than we have with Gulluscio, but Jimmy, like I said, leaves, left Sam hanging. I called Sam and he didn't know what the hell I was talking about. GENN: Mmm-hmm. LIPKOWITZ: You know, when I was trying to confirm our business. GENN: O.K. LIPKOWITZ: And, what I will do with Sam is, say, ''Listen things have, there's a lot of turmoil, we don't wanna be waving flags, we can put off a lot of that stuff.'' GENN: Mmm-hmm.

title: USAir Group reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income The company attributed its latest quarter loss to higher fuel costs and flat traffic.

title: After the Dawn, a New Day
description: In two recent speeches, Secretary of State James Baker showed that the Bush Administration had at last grasped some sense of the vast, historic changes taking place in the Communist East.

title: Procter & Gamble Co. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included the $125 million consent judgment three cookie companies will pay it to settle a long-standing lawsuit on cookie patents. Share earnings reflect the 2-for-1 stock split which was effective earlier this month.

title: Sears Profit Falls 15.6% In Quarter
description: Sears, Roebuck and Company said today that its third-quarter profit fell 15.6 percent, reflecting a sharp drop in retailing income and a large number of claims filed against the Allstate Insurance Company by victims of Hurricane Hugo.

title: Excerpts From Interview With the President
description: Following are excerpts from an interview today with President Bush in the Oval Office: On the Crisis in Panama Q. From here, looking from Washington, what do you think the chances are of another rising in Panama? A. I think any time you have somebody that is demonstrably evil as Noriega and who is frustrating the will of the people, as he continues to do, there's bound to be upheaval. There is bound to be. Q. You don't think, in other words, that what happened, the failed coup, or failed attempted coup, has reduced the chance of upheaval? A. No. . . . I think, if anything, it has signaled the discontent with Noriega more, particularly in the military because of the way some of the people have been handled. . . .

title: Index-Contract Gyrations Buffet Underlying Stocks
description: Stock index futures prices gyrated wildly in hectic, heavy trading yesterday, contributing greatly to huge swings in stock prices on Wall Street.

title: Forest City Jobs
description: The Forest City Ratner Companies has assigned its marketing and communications business to Della Femina McNamee WCRS and two other WCRS companies. Forest City, a real estate developer, is building the Metrotech office complex, a 16-acre commercial and academic project in Brooklyn. Della Femina will handle the advertising component of the $5 million to $6 million account, while WCRS's Creamer Dickson Basford will handle public relations, and its Cohn & Wells will handle direct response.

title: Muted, Ungaro and Valentino Still Flatter
description: A calmer Emanuel Ungaro is ready for the next fashion decade. He has toned down his ebullient color schemes and eased up the sexy fit of his clothes, so everything looks a little more realistic than it has been, but not dreary.

title: First Union Real Estate Investments reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included capital gains of $9,886,000, or 56 cents a share, and an extraordinary credit of $11,728,000, or 66 cents a share, for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. c-Included capital gains of $852,000, or 4 cents a share for the quarter and an extraordinary credit of $4,390,000, or 24 cents a share for the 9 months.

title: Senate Votes 6 Pacts To Track Drug Money
description: Despite objections raised by some Republicans over the past two years, the Senate approved treaties today that are intended to help American investigators track money laundering and prosecute drug traffickers in six countries.

title: In New Jersey, Silence on Fiscal Squeeze
description: Unlike any other issue in New Jersey, the issue of raising taxes or cutting government programs brings out a certain reticence in the two candidates running for governor.

title: Dow Ends 3.69 Lower In Wild Day
description: The stock market fluctuated wildly yesterday on heavy volume. The Dow Jones industrial average plunged 85 points in the first hour of trading but recovered in the late afternoon to close only 3.69 points lower, at 2,659.22.

title: Kuhlman Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss and the 9 months is after a gain of $2.2 million, or 42 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.

title: Financial Corp. of Santa Barara reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included extraordinary charges of $44,000 for the quarter and $93,000 for the 9 months, and the 9 months also included income from discontinued operations of $450,000, or 8 cents a share. c-Net income and after losses from discontinued operations of $937,000 and $1,657,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. The latest third quarter included the sale of $123.5 million in mortgage- backed securities at a loss of $235,000 with concurrent reduction of wholesale liabilities through utilization of the proceeds to pay down repurchase agreements. The latest third quarter also reflected the early redemption of $35.5 million on collateralized debt and concurrent retirement of $3.25 million of interest rate swaps associated with this debt. These transactions resulted in losses of $44,000 and were designed to release the collateral securing the debt so that it could be used more efficiently for other borrowings.

title: Oh, Those Cacophonous Car Burglar Alarms!
description: To the Editor:

title: Fittipaldi and Marlboro Join Penske Team
description: In a development that had been rumored for months, it was announced in Manhattan yesterday that Marlboro would join the Penske Racing team as a sponsor on the Championship Auto Racing Teams Indy-car series next year and bring along this year's champion, Emerson Fittipaldi.

title: Capitol Bancorp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income

title: Wine Talk
description: AS descriptives go, ''sweet wine'' has some unfortunate connotations for many Americans. When it comes to food and drink, sweet means fat. It also means childlike and unsophisticated. Wine lovers in particular, like arrivistes trying to shed their embarrassing past, point their noses up and wrinkle them at the mention of sweet wine. That is what they drank as children, or as college students. Too bad. When it comes to wine, sweet can be something very special. The finest sweet wines are those made from grapes left on the vines long past the appropriate harvest time for traditional wines.

title: At Last, Shearson Makes Debut
description: AFTER almost a two-week delay, the new corporate advertising campaign of Shearson Lehman Hutton Inc. made its debut this week on ''ABC Monday Night Football.''

title: N.F.L. Owners Are Still Split
description: After 11 hours of meetings and 4 ballots, the National Football League owners were unable to elect a new commissioner here today, with Paul Tagliabue falling three votes short of election on the final ballot.

title: Elco Industries Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Partisan Battle Looms Over Deficit Bill
description: The most powerful committee barons in the House and Senate will face off again across the bargaining table on Wednesday to try to shave a modest sum from the Federal deficit for the 1990 fiscal year, without bringing the Government to a halt in the process.

title: USAir Reports Quarterly Loss
description: USAir Group Inc., the holding company for the nation's seventh-largest airline, today reported a net loss of $77.7 million in the third quarter, which it attributed to flat demand and higher operating expenses.

title: Ban on Chinese Mushrooms Is Announced by the F.D.A.
description: The Food and Drug Administration on Monday ordered all Chinese mushrooms detained at United States ports because of a bacteria contamination that can cause severe food poisoning.

title: Rumors Lift UAL After $33 Plunge
description: Rumors of stock purchases by two major investors and of a revival of the original buyout offer helped the stock of the UAL Corporation recover strongly yesterday after it plunged by $33 a share earlier in the day.

title: Effort to Move Officer's Trial Focuses on Fear of Race Riots
description: A local police officer's effort to have his manslaughter trial moved out of Miami is centering on what the defense, the prosecution and the judge all agree would be the likelihood of racial disturbances if he was ever acquitted here.

title: Events: A Harvest Festival
description: Bronx Harvest, New York Botanical Garden, 200th Street and Southern Boulevard, Bedford Park section of the Bronx; 212-220-8777.

title: A Proposal to Revamp And Buy Sharon Steel
description: Two investment concerns said yesterday that they would sponsor a reorganization plan to bring the Sharon Steel Corporation out of bankruptcy.

title: Home Resale Rise Is 4.3%
description: Sales of existing homes rose for the second consecutive month in September, climbing 4.3 percent to the highest level this year, a real estate trade group said today.

title: Crane Co reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included income from discontinued operations of $6,788,000, or 20 cents a share for the quarter and $13,297,000, or 39 cents a share for the 9 months. Year-ago income from discontinued operations represents the distibution of Medusa Corp. to shareholders in October 1988. The company said 1988 share data are restated for a 50 percent stock distribution in September 1989. Corrected from Tuesday.

title: Imperial Oil reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Results are in Canadian funds.

title: Mack Chairman Resigns
description: John B. Curcio resigned this week as chairman of Mack Trucks Inc., effective when a successor is named, the company said. Mr. Curcio, 56 years old, had relinquished the post of president to Ralph Reins in June, when expectations of a loss in the second quarter were announced. He surrendered the chief executive's job to Mr. Reins in September.

title: Celebrating a Builder Of the Big Band Sound
description: ''Mel Lewis has been an innovator who has redefined the role of jazz drums,'' said Loren Schoenberg, the manager of the American Jazz Orchestra. ''And he's done it by making a concerted effort to stay away from the obvious - which few drummers have done and even fewer within a big band context.''

title: Wang Agreement On Selling Assets
description: Wang Laboratories Inc. said it had agreed in principle to sell $200 million of nonstrategic assets as part of its continuing drive to reduce debt and return to profitability. Richard Miller, president of the Lowell-based computer maker, said the nonstrategic assets include the company's lease portfolio, money credit operations and a manufacturing plant in Scotland.

title: Jorgensen (Earle M.) Co(N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain of $4,562,000, or 72 cents a share, from the sale of excess land and buildings.

title: Esselte Business Systems reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an extraordinary credit of $905,000, or 4 cents a share.

title: Mesa Airlines Rebuffs StatesWest
description: Mesa Airlines Inc. rejected a proposal by StatesWest Airlines Inc. to combine the two companies. Mesa's board considered the proposal too vague and ill defined to merit further consideration, said Gary Risley, Mesa's vice president for corporate affairs.

title: Bid Procedures Set At Dunkin' Donuts
description: Dunkin' Donuts Inc. announced it had set up procedures to accept bids to buy the company from interested parties. The international chain of doughnut shops, which battled takeover attempts for months before deciding in September to accept bids on a friendly basis, set a Nov. 10 deadline for receiving bids.

title: Konrad Wolff, Pianist And Author, Dies at 82
description: Konrad Wolff, a pianist and the author of several books about the piano, died of heart failure Monday in Cologne, West Germany, where he was performing and lecturing. He was 82 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: Region and State at Odds Over Adirondack Park
description: Concerns about the environment and home rule run deep here in the heart of the Adirondack Park, a place that is both the year-round home of 130,000 people and the greatest surviving wilderness east of the Mississippi. On Tuesday its residents had a chance to speak their minds.

title: Gesture to French Muslims
description: Education Minister Lionel Jospin of France, seeking to resolve a national dispute, ruled today that Muslim girls could wear traditional head scarves but could not refuse to attend classes. The suspension early this month of three students who wore the head scarves had stirred debate over whether their mode of dress violated France's long tradition of secular public schools.

title: Review/Music; Helping George Crumb Celebrate His Birthday
description: No matter how insistently scholars and metaphysicians wave their dowsing wands, the sources of creative artistry remain largely undiscovered. Secret underground rivers of imagination can bubble up at unexpected times and places. If the geology of talent were a completely developed science, it might explain George Crumb to us.

title: H.U.D. Economist Says Bosses Pressed Him to Approve Grants
description: The economist for the Department of Housing and Urban Development in New York says two former regional administrators improperly pressured him and other subordinates several times to support favored grant applicants. Two examples that he cited as the worst involved projects with ties to Senator Alfonse M. D'Amato.

title: Preserving the Hues and Aromas of Summer's Array
description: FORGET plastic. The garden's bounty may fade quickly, but you can fool nature without resorting to artifice. The secret to continued pleasure from summer's sunny colors and the vibrant hues of fall lies in drying flowers, herbs, weeds, seed pods and branches. With moisture removed, many plants last for months or even years.

title: Extra Innings for Some Veterans
description: Fourteen years after his finest moment, pitching a shutout for the Boston Red Sox in the opening game of the 1975 World Series, Luis Tiant found himself working for the Massachusetts State Lottery, uncomfortable in a business suit and unhappy that his life seemed to be behind him.

title: Kemper Shuns 4 Brokers
description: Kemper Financial Services Inc., the Chicago-based investment management firm, will no longer do business with four Wall Street investment firms that do index arbitrage for their own accounts, officials at the company said.

title: Chief Rejoins Qintex
description: Qintex Entertainment Inc. said today that David Evans, who resigned last week as president and chief executive, had reconsidered and would resume both positions until the end of the year or until a successor was named. Qintex, which has filed for bankruptcy protection for itself and its Hal Roach Studios and Qintex Productions units, added that its chief financial officer, Jonathan Lloyd, had been named to the board of directors.

title: 13 Face Indictment In Vineland Protest Over Police Shooting
description: A Cumberland County grand jury has indicted 13 people on charges of looting and rioting in downtown Vineland last August during protests over the shooting death of a black man by a white police officer.

title: Soviet Grain Approved
description: The Soviet Union has been given the go-ahead to buy up to 16 million metric tons of United States grain in the year that began Oct. 1, the Agriculture Department said today. John B. Campbell, Acting Under Secretary for international affairs and commodity programs, said the clearance to buy more grain resulted from recent communication between the two countries.

title: In Capital, Jersey Rivals Behave Like Statesmen
description: During the months they have been vying for New Jersey's top office, James J. Florio and Jim Courter have appeared as likely adversaries if not natural enemies. But here in Washington, where both candidates for governor are members of the House of Representatives, they do not seem to be cut from very different cloths.

title: Gorbachev, in Finland, Disavows Any Right of Regional Intervention
description: President Mikhail S. Gorbachev declared today that the Soviet Union has no moral or political right to interfere in the affairs of its East European neighbors, and held up neutral Finland as a model of stability in stormy Europe.

title: Anheuser-Busch Cos reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company said sales for both the quarter and 9 months excluded excise taxes.

title: BRIEFS
description: * Alcan Aluminium Ltd., Montreal, a maker of aluminum and aluminum products, received approval from the Toronto and Montreal stock exchanges to buy back 15 million of its own common shares, or about 6.5 percent of the shares outstanding. Purchases will be made starting Friday.

title: Dry Is Fresh: Floral Design For Long Run
description: LEAD: DRIED-FLOWER arrangements are no longer just a humble alternative to fresh flowers. In the hands of floral stylists, they have become a fashionable first choice.

title: Interface Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 1
description: The share earnings reflected the September 1988 sale of $103,925,000 of 8 percent convertible subordinated debentures due 2013.

title: Philharmonic Chairman
description: Stephen Stamas, a former executive of the Exxon Corporation who has been president of the Philharmonic-Symphony Society of New York since 1984, has been named chairman, the New York Philharmonic has announced. The post, which has been vacant for some years, was most recently held by Carlos Moseley. Succeeding Mr. Stamas as president is H. Frederick Krimendahl 2d, a partner with Goldman, Sachs & Company.

title: Review/Art; The Master of the Macabre, Francis Bacon
description: Since he exhibited ''Three Studies for Figures at the Base of the Crucifixion'' at the Lefevre Gallery in London 44 years ago, Francis Bacon has remained master of the macabre. The writhing half-human, half-animal forms he painted in that triptych may have owed something to the German Expressionists and something to Picasso. But Mr. Bacon's nightmare was fundamentally his own.

title: Mary McCarthy, 77, Is Dead; Novelist, Memoirist and Critic
description: Mary McCarthy, one of America's pre-eminent women of letters, died of cancer yesterday at New York Hospital. She was 77 years old and lived in Castine, Me., and Paris.

title: Lincoln Telecom reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
KEY RATES
D'Amato Confirms Inquiries To Giuliani in Crime Cases
description: Senator Alfonse M. D'Amato said yesterday that he had spoken to Rudolph W. Giuliani, then the United States Attorney in Manhattan, three times about pending criminal cases in 1984 and 1985, but he denied any effort to pressure the prosecutor - an account that Mr. Giuliani backed up.

title: Big Gain Expected By Westinghouse
description: The chairman of the Westinghouse Electric Corporation told securities analysts the company expects to exceed a 10 percent operating margin by the end of 1990 and to have a return on equity in the range of 18 to 21 percent. John C. Marous also predicted ''double digit'' earnings growth in this year's fourth quarter.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST
description: International

title: NATO Ministers Call for Military Strength
description: NATO defense ministers said today that the alliance needs to maintain its military might, including a strong nuclear strategy, despite political changes in the Soviet Union and parts of Eastern Europe.

title: Review/Recital; The Organ Works Charles Ives Wrote or Played
description: Before Charles Ives attained fortune as an insurance executive and fame as a part-time composer, he was an organist at churches in Connecticut, New Jersey and New York. His last post, which he held from 1899 through 1902, was at the Central Presbyterian Church in Manhattan.

title: Du Pont (E.I.) de Nemours & Co (N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago sales for the quarter are restated.

title: At High Point, Fantasies Old (Mostly) and New
description: Armed with the High Point survival kit - flat shoes and a sense of humor - more than 50,000 decorators, retailers and manufacturers' representatives made their way through some 1,600 showrooms at the semiannual International Home Furnishings Market. The nine-day event, billed as ''the largest concentration of home furnishings in the world,'' introduces the furniture that consumers will see in retail stores next spring.

title: Edward Johnson, 69, Scientist and Inventor
description: Edward O. Johnson, a scientist and inventor with RCA for 34 years, died of cancer on Oct. 11 at his home in Princeton, N.J. He was 69 years old.

title: Medusa Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Bethlehem Steel Falls 53.7%; Armco's Profits Down 8.3%
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corporation and Armco Inc., reflecting a slackening of orders and a decline in steel prices, yesterday announced lower third-quarter earnings. Bethlehem said its net income was down 53.7 percent, while Armco said its earnings were down 8.3 percent. Bethlehem

title: Article 588489 -- No Title
description: After a $2 million renovation, a mansion designed by the great Catalan modernist architect Antonio Gaudi was reborn this summer as one of the most luxurious restaurants on the Spanish Atlantic seaboard.

title: Tax Break Is Coming For the Self-Employed
description: To the Editor:

title: Former Labor Secretary Is Named As U.S. Mediator in Coal Strike
description: Calling for a ''time of healing now,'' Labor Secretary Elizabeth Dole turned today to a predecessor, W. J. Usery Jr., to mediate a violent, six-month-old coal strike in Virginia, West Virginia and Kentucky.

title: CDI Corp N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Three G.M. Subsidiaries Report Mixed Results
description: The three major non-automotive subsidiaries of the General Motors Corporation posted mixed third-quarter financial results, reflecting weaker domestic automotive production, higher credit costs and a stronger data processing business.

title: Ferro Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; Move at Lintas Unit
description: In a move that reflects a realignment of its European and international agencies, Lintas Worldwide has moved the chief executive of its international division from London to New York. Ken Robbins, who is also deputy chairman of Lintas, will now manage the agency's international subsidiaries from the company's New York headquarters. The European companies, which had reported directly to Mr. Robbins, have been consolidated into a division called Lintas Europe, which is headed by Ingo Zuberier.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; Addenda
description: * Six months after changing its name from Grybauskas, Moss & Overall, Grybauskas/Overall has changed its name to Grybauskas & Partners and appointed Dan Hanover and Thomas Upshur co-creative directors.

title: Total Petroleum (N. America) (A) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Latest quarter and 9-month results reflected a pretax loss of $12 million relating to the planned disposal of the company's participation in the Peace River fertilizer plant. Year-ago quarter and 9-month results reflected a pretax gain of $10.9 million resulting from a gas contract litigation settlement. Year-ago 9-month results also included a pretax gain of $6.1 million from sales of U.S. and gas assets.

title: Ametek Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included income of $74,000 and a loss of $2,412,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively, both from discontinued operations and the 9 months also included a loss of $3,825,000 provision for cost of spin-off and a gain of $3,633,000 from an accounting adjustment.

title: Mapco Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Renewing A Dowager Of a Hotel
description: THE turn-of-the-century building at Madison Avenue and 92d Street, which began its life as the Hotel Chastaigneray, has been given a major face lift. The Hotel Wales is the newest of Manhattan's boutique hotels, an Edwardian-flavored companion to the Royalton and Morgan's.

title: Magma Copper reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Actor, Playing Nixon, Has His Star Role at Last
description: Not many actors can say that a former President of the United States tried to suppress their best performance, but Lane Smith has that distinction.

title: Stocks Mixed as Dow Slips 5.94, to 2,653.28
description: Stocks turned in a mixed performance in relatively calm trading yesterday on sharply lower turnover. Although the widely watched Dow Jones industrial average closed down 5.94 at 2,653.28, the 784 advances on the New York Stock Exchange managed to stay ahead of the 700 declines.

title: Machinists Shift Stance On UAL Deal
description: A leader of the machinists' union at United Airlines whose opposition contributed to the collapse of a proposed buyout two weeks ago said yesterday that his union might be willing to participate in a deal to help the company defend itself against a takeover.

title: Delta Air Lines reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Cooper Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Latest quarter and 9 months net included results of Champion Spark Plug Co., which Cooper acquired earlier this year, from about March 23. Latest quarter and 9 months also reflectss a 2-for-1 common stock split effective March 20. Year-ago 9 months included the results of RTE Corp. from June 8, 1988.

title: Zenith Electronics reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a loss from discontinued operations of $15,000,000 and $20,100,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. c-Included income from discontinued operations of $1,000,000, or 3 cents a share, and $9,800,000, or 37 cents a share, for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. d-Net income Nine-month results included a gain of $1.1 million from the sale of properties. Results for the year-ago quarter and 9 months included gain from sale of properties of $4.6 million and $7.3 million, respectively.

title: Chilean Barred for Life
description: Roberto Rojas, the Chilean national team's goalkeeper, was barred for life from international competition yesterday after accusations he faked an injury at a Brazil-Chile World Cup qualifying match on Sept. 3. The Federation Internationale de Football Association, soccer's governing body, also suspended Rojas for three months from all activity, including domestic games, and fined the Chilean team about $31,000.

title: Keystone International reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a loss of $558,000 from discontinued operations. c-After income from discontinued operations of $300,000, or 1 cent a share, for the quarter and $726,000, or 2 cents a share, for the 9 months. The results for both year-ago periods have been restated to reflect the results of two business units sold in May and accounted for as discontinued operations. The per share earnings reflected 25 percent stock dividend paid in May 1989.

title: Micropolis Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Youth Service Proposal Doesn't Offer Stipends
description: To the Editor:

title: Stone Container Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an after-tax gain on asset sales of $6 million, net of a writedown of an investment in Stone Forest Industries.

title: Foster-Home Arson Kills Counselor; Ex-Resident Arrested
description: A 27-year-old counselor died early yesterday in a fire in Brooklyn at a city-run foster-care home. And the police arrested a 19-year-old former resident, saying they believed he had set the fire because he was expelled from the home two weeks ago.

title: HOME IMPROVEMENT
description: SHEET vinyl flooring is popular because of its appearance, relatively easy installation and durability. But vinyl floors require cleaning and polishing, and precautions must be taken to avoid damage from heavy furniture. Vinyl flooring can be repaired. If done skillfully, the repairs are often invisible.

title: Pacific Enterprises reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago quarter and 9-month results included $16 million, or 25 cents a share, from the sale of Los Angeles property.

title: Get Me Rewrite, Comrade
description: An isolationist columnist once so angered Franklin Roosevelt that the President bestowed an Iron Cross on him, implying that he was pro-Nazi. Richard Nixon's enemies' list bulged with journalists. In this light, Mikhail Gorbachev's outburst against Vladislav Starkov can be viewed as one more example of the unending adversarial tension between president and press, regardless of system.

title: Banta Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included income from discontinued operations of $9,861,000, or 7 cents a share. c-Included income from discontinued operations of $460,000, or 3 cents a share for the quarter and $1,418,000, or 11 cents a share for the 9 months.

title: Giants Seek to Regain Competitive Edge
description: The San Francisco Giants, who worked out for two hours today while workmen continued to repair earthquake damage in Candlestick Park, reported that they were getting back their competitive edge for the World Series and wondered why the Oakland Athletics had flown all the way to Phoenix when the sun was shining over the Bay Area.

title: Striking It Rich in Japan
description: A Japanese insurance company sent prices on the world art market soaring when it paid $40 million for Van Gogh's ''Sunflowers'' a few years ago. Now a Japanese media giant has pushed up the price for former Presidents of the United States. Ronald and Nancy Reagan are reportedly being paid a breathtaking $2 million for their current visit to the land of the lustrous yen.

title: 2 School Districts Accused of Phone Abuses
description: Workers in the schools and offices of two New York City school districts ran up nearly $90,000 in unnecessary phone charges, including hundreds of calls to lines that provide pornographic sex conversations, a commission investigating educational corruption charged yesterday.

title: Emerson Radio Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an extraordinary credit of $199,000, or 1 cent a share, from utilization of tax loss carryforward.

title: Transactions
description: Baseball

title: Baker's Point Spread
description: Observe the Middle East point spread:

title: DiMaggio to Go Home
description: Joe DiMaggio, who was forced to leave his home when the earthquake last week heavily damaged the Marina district of San Francisco, said today that he had finally been cleared to return to the house, where he has lived since he was born here nearly 75 years ago.

title: The Setting Glitters Like the Jewels
description: FOR two years, Constantin Wickenburg and Marco Carrano have been partners in their own architectural firm. Recently they have been proudly showing off their newest joint venture: a small jewel of a shop for Henryk Demner's precious jewels.

title: EG&G Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 1
Bush Would Change Rules On Regulation of Pesticides
description: President Bush is expected to announce proposals on Thursday to allow the Government to remove dangerous agricultural chemicals more quickly from the marketplace.

title: AZT to Be Widely Given Out To Children With AIDS Virus
description: AZT, the only proven treatment for the AIDS virus, will be widely distributed to children for the first time, Federal health officials said today.

title: VETO ON ABORTION IS UPHELD IN HOUSE
description: Opening a season of trench warfare on abortion, the House of Representatives today upheld President Bush's veto of legislation that would have allowed Federal financing of abortions for victims of rape or incest.

title: Article 529089 -- No Title
description: The Zenith Electronics Corporation today reported a third-quarter loss of $24.1 million, with a good part of it stemming from the computer business the company is selling.

title: Beirut Christians Urge 'Flexibility' on Pact
description: The agreement reached last weekend aimed at ending Lebanon's 14-year civil war gained momentum today when a coalition of Christian parties and militias called for ''flexibility'' in dealing with the accord.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; G.M. Spending On TV Specials
description: The General Motors Corporation said this week that it would spend $11 million to be the sole sponsor of several television specials next season.

title: Beverly Hills Bond Offering
description: The City of Beverly Hills, Calif., is tentatively offering $116.4 million in refunding certificates of participation with a maximum yield of 7.19 percent for an issue due in 2016 through underwriters led by Goldman, Sachs & Company.

title: Court Awards $1.3 Million to Inmate Victims of Attica Attack
description: The State Court of Claims today awarded seven former inmates or their estates almost $1.3 million for injuries they sustained in the state police's bloody suppression of the Attica prison riot in 1971.

title: National Intergroup Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss The latest second quarter and 6-month periods included extraordinary items of $9.1 million and $15 million, respectively, for gains from repurchase of subordinated notes at a discount, compared with $800,000 and $5.3 million for comparable year-ago periods, respectively. The 1988 second quarter and 6-month results included $41.3 million of charges and adjustments related to the restructuring of Foxmeyer Drug.

title: Varian Associates reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 29
description: Results for 1988 included a net gain of $9.6 million, or 44 cents a share, from the sale of a division and an aftertax restructuring charge of $22.8 million, or $1.04 a share.

title: Europe Critical Of Trade Plan
description: A United States proposal on promoting agricultural trade drew sharp criticism from the European Community at the latest round of multilateral trade talks. However, many of the 105 countries participating in the talks supported the plan. In a statement, the European

title: Arlington Journal; Prosperity Threatens Refugee Of Vietnam
description: Kham Dinh Do is a survivor.

title: A Benefit for AIDS Ends Paris Season
description: The curtain came down on this Paris fashion season tonight with a benefit party at the Bastille Opera, just hours after the last model had come down the runway in a flower-draped Yves Saint Laurent dress.

title: Richard Sterba, 91, Psychoanalyst, Is Dead
description: Dr. Richard Sterba, a psychoanalyst who was a disciple of Sigmund Freud and practiced for nearly 50 years in Detroit, died Tuesday at his home in Grosse Pointe, Mich. He was 91 years old.

title: More on Down's Syndrome
description: To The Home Section:

title: Ruble Is Devalued in Some Cases; Step to Spur Soviet Economy Seen
description: The Soviet Union today announced a drastic cut in the ruble exchange rate that applies mainly to foreigners in the country and to Soviet citizens traveling abroad. The move, which puts a more realistic value on its currency, is apparently a step along a difficult path toward making it possible for anyone to exchange rubles for other world currencies.

title: Consolidated Freightways Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Uncle Scrooge
description: Washington sets the pace for contributions to international aid agencies, and once again it is dawdling. The International Development Association - the World Bank agency that lends to the world's neediest - needs another refill. But the Bush Administration can't seem to find $100 million in next year's budget to keep I.D.A. lending at current levels. Stalling in the face of starvation sets a sorry example.

title: Bid for Arby's Of $205 Million
description: Richard and Steven Buckley, the 40-year-old twins who took Nathan's Famous Inc. national, said yesterday that they had offered to buy Arby's Inc., the fast-food chain, for $205 million in cash.

title: Louisiana Land & Exploration Co reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary charge of $2.8 million on the early retirement of debt, and included a $12.5 million after-tax gain from a first quarter real estate sale. c-Net loss and after a $54 million after-tax restructuring charge. d-After a gain of $36.9 million from the cumulative effect of a change in accounting for income taxes, included the $54 million restructuring charge, and an $11.7 million after-tax charge to provide for possible losses in connection with certain litigation.

title: Harsco Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Reflects defense contract-related loss provisions of $58.6 million recorded in the first 6 months of the year.

title: Clark Beise, 91; Headed Bank of America
description: S. Clark Beise, retired president and chief executive of the Bank of America, died Saturday at his home in Hillsborough, Calif. He was 91 years old.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; People
description: * Francis C. Powers Jr. has been named international advertising director of USA Today.

title: INSIDE
description: Wave of Assassinations Threatens Peru Elections Leftist guerrillas in Peru have mounted the biggest terror campaign in the nine-year history of their insurgency in an effort to disrupt municipal elections scheduled for mid-November. Page A6. Damages for Attica Inmates Almost $1.3 million was awarded to seven inmates hurt in the suppression of the 1971 prison riot. Page B1. Quake Relief Bill Passes Congress voted $4.15 billion in aid for victims of the California earthquake and Hurricane Hugo. Page B8. Bush Wins on Abortion Bill The House upheld the veto of a bill that would have broadened Federal financing of abortions. Page A20.

title: 8 Acts to Join the Rock Hall of Fame
description: The Who, the Four Tops, the Four Seasons, the Kinks, the Platters, Hank Ballard, Bobby Darin and Simon and Garfunkel have been selected for induction to the Rock-and-Roll Hall of Fame Jan. 17.

title: HEALTH: Psychology; Doctors Find That Surgical Patients May Still 'Hear' Despite Anesthesia
description: To the dismay and disbelief of many surgeons and anesthesiologists, new studies have bolstered the idea that patients who are completely anesthetized can still register some of what goes on around them.

title: Noble Affiliates reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a gain of $8,825,000, or 20 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.

title: 'Junk Bond' Shift Hurts Columbia Savings
description: The Columbia Savings and Loan Association said today that its third-quarter earnings would be reduced by $130.2 million to reflect provisions of the new savings and loan legislation. One effect is that most ''junk bond'' holdings must be carried at market value.

title: Telerate Criticizes Its Parent, Dow Jones, for Offer
description: Telerate Inc., a computerized financial data company that is two-thirds owned by Dow Jones & Company, tried to denounce the business media giant yesterday in an advertisment in The Wall Street Journal, the Dow Jones flagship newspaper. However, the advertisement was withdrawn before publication.

title: President of Equifax Adds the Job of Chief
description: Equifax Inc., a leading provider of credit information, yesterday named its president, C.B. Rogers Jr., to the added post of chief executive.

title: AMP Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Grace (W.R.) & Co (N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $468,000 and $1,890,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. c-After a loss of $90,000 for the quarter and income of $16,636,000, or 20 cents a share, both from discontinued operations. The company said the income from discontinued operations of $16,636,000, or 20 cents a share, included $6.3 milion of income relating to cash received as partial payment on notes purchased in connection with the sale of Bermans and $10.9 million after-tax gain on the sale of interest in Home Quarters Warehouse Inc. Year-ago 9-month net income of $158,064,000 included $4,854,000, or 6 cents a share, from an accounting adjustment for FAS 96. The latest third quarter and 9-month income from continuing operations of $98,359,000 and $173,264,000, respectively, both included a total pretax gain of $114.4 million on restructuring of natural resource operations, the sale of Grace Equipment Co., the initial public offering of Grace Energy Corp. and the adjustment in the carrying value of certain natural resource assets that are not part of Grace Energy Corp. Corrected from Friday, Oct. 20.

title: Books of The Times; Ugly Racial Feelings and Murder in a Not-So-Idyllic Vermont
description: A Stranger in the Kingdom By Frank Howard Mosher 421 pages. Doubleday. $18.95.

title: Chairman May Bid For Cineplex
description: The Cineplex Odeon Corporation, the movie theater company, said yesterday that its chairman, Garth H. Drabinsky, had offered to buy the company at $16.40 a share (Canadian), or about $14 in United States currency, if he is able to raise the money for the deal.

title: FINANCE/NEW ISSUES;
description: The West Virginia Parkways, Economic Development and Tourism Authority is offering $143 million in tax-exempt parkway revenue bonds with a maximum yield of 7.279 percent for an issue due in 2019 through underwriters led by Paine Webber Inc.

title: Ultimatum for Panel as Vote for N.F.L. Chief Stalls
description: Seven months after announcing his retirement, Pete Rozelle named a five-man committee tonight in yet another effort to choose his successor as commissioner of the National Football League.

title: China-South Africa Deal
description: China, which has traditionally shunned ties with the white supremacist Government of South Africa, is buying coal from Pretoria, a private Dutch group said today. The first of 10 shipments was unloaded in the southern province of Guangdong in June, according to the Shipping Research Bureau, a body that monitors the oil and coal trade. The bureau said the Chinese order, handled by a Hong Kong trading house, was shipped through Maputo and Mozambique. China also bought a coal gasification plant from South Africa for about $4 million, it said.

title: Searchers Find More Bodies At Texas Plant Explosion Site
description: Investigators searching for the victims and the cause of a huge explosion at a Phillips Petroleum plastics plant here faced ''a very hazardous situation'' in the rubble of twisted metal and concrete left by the blast, an official said.

title: Panhandle Eastern Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included gain of $6,465,000 after a $18,961,000 gain on the sale of coal properties and a $12,496,000 charge for interest and other costs related to liquefied natural gas activities. c-Net loss and included for the 9 months a loss of $179,666,000 after a $64,290,000 gain on a securities transaction and the $243,956,000 quarter charge to resolve the costs associated with a take-or-pay settlement and contract reformation plan. Revenue represents operating revenues. Results for 1989 included Texas Eastern Corp.'s operating activity since April 27, 1989, except for capital expenditures, which are included from Jan. 1, 1989.

title: American Barrick reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
GM Hughes Electronics Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Latest quarter included a charge of $24 million related to a portion of a plan to reduce employment levels by at least 6,000 people by year's end. The company said its latest net income including $37.2 million of purchase accounting adjustments was $110.6 million; Year-ago income including $37.2 million of purchase accounting adjustments was $142.4 million. The company also said 9 months net including an $11.6 million purchase accounting adjustment was $486.6 million; Year-ago 9 months net including the $11.6 million adjustment was $521 million. Year-ago 9 months net included a $18.7 million, or 5 cents a share, gain from an accounting adjustment; and an 18 cents a share gain from sale of some stock holdings in Nippon Avionics Co. Share earnings figures are based on outstanding General Motors Corp. class H shares. The purchase accounting adjustments are related to amortization for goodwill related to General Motors Corp.'s 1985 purchase of Hughes.

title: CLOSE TO HOME
description: IT'S sitting on the sideboard, the pumpkin I bought for Halloween, waiting for a new face. I bought it for my daughter, actually, my hand reaching out in automatic response to the pyramid of orange globes at the farm stand. For a moment I forgot that she was years past trick-or-treating and cutting up sheets for ghost wear.

title: Fischer-Dieskau, Ill, Cancels More Concerts
description: Dietrich Fischer-Dieskau has canceled two recitals at Carnegie Hall, Nov. 3 and 5, and an appearance with the Cherubini String Quartet on Nov. 9 at Alice Tully Hall. The baritone, who had previously canceled concerts with the New York Philharmonic, has a severe case of the flu.

title: U.S. Trust Promotes Officers to Top Posts
description: The U.S. Trust Corporation, a bank company that serves wealthy investors and institutions, yesterday named H. Marshall Schwarz chairman and chief executive, effective Feb. 1.

title: Fuqua Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a loss from discontinued operations of $805,000. c-Included income from discontinued operations of $3,953,000, or 18 cents a share for the quarter and $10,288,000, or 47 cents a share for the 9 months.

title: Bush on Capital Gains: A Matter of Experience
description: Like other mortals, Presidents have only so much time and so much energy (although George Bush spent his vacation this year trying to disprove that self-evident proposition).

title: Corrections
description: Because of an editing error, an article in The Living Section yesterday about Paris fashion shows misidentified a designer who showed a collection on Tuesday evening. He is Valentino Garavani, known professionally as Valentino; he is not Mario Valentino.

title: Richard Norwood, 73, Lawyer and Executive
description: Richard Harland Norwood, a former executive with Rockefeller Center Inc., died Tuesday at Monmouth Medical Center in Long Branch, N.J., after suffering a heart embolism. He was 73 years old and lived in Bay Head, N.J.

title: Iraq's Criminal Credit Line
description: LEAD: Recently, lobbyists for Iraq, a government responsible for grave crimes against its own people, went into action on Capitol Hill. The U.S.-Iraq Business Forum, a group that promotes trade between the U.S. and Iraq, galvanized its members to deluge Congressional offices with calls and cables against a measure sponsored by Sen.

title: Crack of the Bat First Sounded in Hoboken
description: To the Editor:

title: Orange & Rockland reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
BONN GIVING POLES AID OF $1 BILLION
description: Chancellor Helmut Kohl's trip to Poland, delayed by a dispute over the amount of economic aid he will offer, is to begin Nov. 9. Mr. Kohl will arrive in Warsaw with more than $1 billion in aid to help rebuild a devastated economy, according to West German officials.

title: Morgan Products Ltd reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
The California Quake; Disaster Relief Aid Poses Delicate Deficit Problem
description: Congress and President Bush have been unable to agree on how to bring this year's budget deficit down to the level required by the budget law, a process, they agree, that requires less spending. Meanwhile, more spending keeps getting added to the pot.

title: UST reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Share earnings have been adjusted for the 2-for-1 stock split distributed on Jan. 27, 1989.

title: Nuclear Reactor in Spain Catches Fire
description: A turbine at Spain's oldest nuclear reactor caught fire last week, increasing concern over the country's nuclear safety standards and giving fresh impetus to what had been a background issue in the campaign for Sunday's general election.

title: Commerical Metals Co reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
description: b-After extraordinary charges of $358,000 for the quarter and $359,000 for the 9 months. The company said 1988 figures were restated to reflect the results of a stock split in December 1988. The company also said the extraordinary credit was an accounting adjustment.

title: Does the G.O.P. Really Want Me?
description: LEAD: On Inauguration Day, Republican National Committee Chairman Lee Atwater unveiled a whole new plan for selling America's youth on the G.O.P.: He played the blues. On stage at the Inaugural Ball, and eventually on David Letterman, Mr. Atwater's guitar playing was apparently meant to convey that ''it's hip to be square.

title: Rorer Group Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Third-quarter results included $23.3 million from the sales of assets, including Asilone, an over-the-counter antacid in the United Kingdom, and Thrombinar, a topical hemostatic. The company said the sale of those assets offset a 44-percent decline in operating income in the quarter. Share earnings for 1989 were calculated after payment of $765,000 in preferred dividends in both the third quarter and 9 months.

title: As Bavaro Mends, Giants Waive Shaw
description: Mark Bavaro, the Giants' outstanding tight end, was listed today as doubtful for the big game here Monday night against the Minnesota Vikings.

title: Bethlehem Steel Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included losses of $23 million from unexpected blast furnace outages and unauthorized work stoppage for both the quarter and 9 months, and the 9 months also included $105 million in restructuring charges. c-Included extraordinary credits from early repurchase of debt of $3,800,000, or 5 cents a share, for the quarter and $11,400,000, or 6 cents a share, for the 9 months. d-Included a charge of $9,000,000 from disposal of equipment.

title: MEDICARE CUTBACK EXPECTED TO ADD TO PRIVATE RATES
description: Insurance experts and members of Congress say millions of older Americans will face higher health insurance costs if Congress repeals or cuts back the Medicare program that pays for the catastrophically high costs of a major illness.

title: When Straw Responded To Jim Frey
description: rrIn shuffling Davey Johnson's coaching staff, the Mets found it simpler to dismiss Bill Robinson than to trade Darryl Strawberry, at least for now.

title: Edward J. Fahy, 79, Retired Navy Admiral
description: Rear Adm. Edward J. Fahy, a World War II submarine officer and later chief of the Navy's Bureau of Ships, died of cardiac arrest yesterday in Delray Beach, Fla., where he lived in retirement. He was 79 years old.

title: Jets' Lineup Against 49ers Is All If's
description: After half a season, Coach Joe Walton still is not sure which players he wants performing for him.

title: Hannaford Brothers reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain of $1,874,000, or 10 cents a share, from an accounting adjustment.

title: Note and Bond Prices Up in Sluggish Trading
description: Prices of Treasury notes and bonds inched higher in sluggish trading yesterday, as dealers placed bids on $4.5 billion worth of 30-year bonds issued by the Resolution Funding Corporation.

title: Smith's Food & Drug reports earnings for 13wks to Sept30
Ngema Discussion Rescheduled to Nov. 9
description: A discussion with Mbongeni Ngema, the writer, director and co-composer of the musical ''Sarafina!,'' has been rescheduled from today to Nov. 9 at 6 P.M. at the Bruno Walter Auditorium of the New York Public Library at Lincoln Center, 111 Amsterdam Avenue, at 65th Street. Mr. Ngema was called out of town, a library spokesman said.

title: Mississippi Is Urged to Reopen Evers Case
description: More than a quarter-century after the black civil rights leader Medgar Evers was murdered here, the City Council has asked the state and the county to reopen the case.

title: Spiegel Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Arab Gets Life in Israeli's Killing
description: Judges in Tel Aviv sentenced a West Bank Palestinian today to life in prison plus 20 years after he pleaded guilty to killing an Israeli construction worker and trying to careen a crowded public bus into a ravine last month.

title: 49er's Status Uncertain
description: Jeff Fuller of the San Francisco 49ers is less seriously hurt than originally feared but it is uncertain whether the defensive back will be able to play in the National Football League again, the club said yesterday.

title: Personal Health
description: As the influenza season nears, doctors are issuing their annual warnings that people at risk of life-threatening complications should get flu shots. But the vaccinations can also be valuable for otherwise healthy people.

title: Millipore Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Reagan Sees Virtue in Sale of Studio to Sony
description: Former President Ronald Reagan told Japanese audiences today that he welcomed Japanese investment in the United States and that Sony's recent takeover of a big motion picture studio might even ''bring back decency and good taste'' to American movies.

title: Saab Gets Plane Order
description: Saab-Scania A.B. said this week that the United States carrier Express Airlines 1 had placed an order worth 2 billion crown, about $310 million, for 25 of its commuter aircraft. The Swedish company said the order was for 15 Saab 340's and 10 Saab 2000's, with an option for 10 additional 340's. Saab said Express Airlines 1, part of Northwest Airlink, was the first company to place a firm order for its 2000.

title: Alleghany Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The latest quarter share earnings included an after-tax loss of 2 cents a share on investment transactions, and the 9 months' share earnings included an after-tax gain of 99 cents a share. The year-ago quarter and 9 months share earnings included after-tax gains of 15 cents a share and 16 cents a share, respectively. Year-ago revenues for the quarter and 9 months are restated to reflect the retroactive adoption of Financial Accounting Standards Board Statement No. 97 in the first quarter of 1989.

title: Market Place; Coniston Stymied In Its TW Deal
description: IF all had gone as planned, Coniston Partners' acquisition of TW Services Inc. would have left the partnership controlling the food-service company after taking out every cent it had invested in it.

title: Syrup Pitchers of Yore
description: HE had been in the antiques business for 22 years, but Jim Bishop was taken off guard when he discovered a cache of vintage small appliances and kitchen accessories in their original boxes in a warehouse near Scranton, Pa.

title: France Buys U.S. Butter
description: France has bought 5,000 metric tons of United States surplus butter at cut-rate prices, the United States Agriculture Department said Tuesday. The salted butter was sold to Fromageries Dischamp of Sayat, France, a privately owned dairy products company, for $1,620 a ton, an average of less than 74 cents a pound. The Agriculture Department's Commodity Credit Corporation said the surplus butter cost about $1.40 a pound to acquire under the Government's dairy price support program.

title: Anheuser Cutting Its Beer Prices
description: In a move that may spark a beer price war, the Anheuser-Busch Companies said yesterday that it would begin cutting prices on all its brands, including Budweiser, the nation's best-selling beer.

title: Computer Sciences reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 29
FINANCE/NEW ISSUES;
description: The Farm Credit System Banks yesterday priced three consolidated systemwide bond issues totaling $2.45 billion. The bonds are being offered through the FFCB Funding Corporation and various securities dealers and banks.

title: Kelly Services Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 1
L. J. Hooker Sells Merksamer Stake
description: The L. J. Hooker Corporation said it had sold its 80 percent stake in the 79-store Merksamer Jewelers chain to a group led by Sam Merksamer for an undisclosed amount. L. J. Hooker, the American unit of the Hooker Corporation of Australia, bought its stake in Merksamer in 1986. Since then, Hooker ran into financial difficulty. It is now in Chapter 11 proceedings.

title: Greenspan Supports Anti-Inflation Legislation
description: Alan Greenspan, the chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, said today that ending inflation in the next five years might lead to higher interest rates and lower economic growth temporarily, but would not lead to recession.

title: Witco Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included the cumulative effect of an accounting change of $20,289,000 and a reduction of $11,440,000, or 46 cents a share, related to the writedown of investments in foreign affiliates and reserves for environmental projects and plant shutdowns. Latest-quarter results included adjustments to the 1989 estimated effective tax rate calculated under the provisions of FAS 96 which reduced the third-quarter effective tax rate 5 percent.

title: The New Republic Tries to Stay Young at 75
description: When the editors of The New Republic were making plans for a special issue to mark their 75th anniversary, they invited Alfred Kazin, a former literary editor and occasional critic of the publication, to write an article expressing, as one editor put it, ''his intellectual grievances against us.''

title: American Fructose reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Cowboys' Fans Keep Too Tall's Streak Going
description: Caving in to the pressure exerted by phone calls from more than 200 fans, Jimmy Johnson, the coach of the Dallas Cowboys, has relented in the matter of Ed (Too Tall) Jones.

title: Review/Dance; Choreographers' Benefit
description: Steve Gross founded the Field in 1985 to offer moral and financial support to promising new modern-dance choreographers. Some of the results were seen in ''The Best of the Field,'' a benefit on Saturday night at the Dia Art Foundation in SoHo. To judge by the general level of work, Mr. Gross and Emily Schottland, his co-director, are on to something valuable.

title: Compaq Computer Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company said latest quarter and 9 months figures included a pretax gain of $13.7 million from an increase in the carrying value of its investment in Conner Peripherals Inc. Year-ago 9 months included a gain of $9.7 million related to the value of the Conner investment. Additionally, the company said its latest third quarter included a gain of about $7.6 million from the sale of one million of its Conner shares.

title: L&N Housing Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss

title: Q&A
description: Cement on Quarry Tile Q.I cemented down some tiles that had worked loose on the landing outside my front door, but I failed to clean up, and left streaks of cement on the surface of these tiles. How can I remove these streaks without loosening the tiles, and is there anything I can apply to make them shiny after they are cleaned? A. I assume you are referring to quarry tile or clay tile.

title: Noland Co reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Index-Participation Appeal Declined
description: A Federal court in Chicago has declined to hear an appeal of its decision that the Securities and Exchange Commission was wrong when it decided that a new type of financial instrument traded on several exchanges was a security and not a futures contract.

title: Honeywell Sells 16% of Yamatake
description: Honeywell Inc. announced the sale of 16 percent of the outstanding common stock of its Tokyo-based partner, Yamatake-Honeywell, for $280 million. The interest in Yamatake-Honeywell was acquired by a group of 10 Japanese financial institutions and industrial corporations, Honeywell said.

title: Kennedy Center Chairman To Leave
description: The board of trustees for the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts, dissatisfied with the performance of the chief executive officer, Ralph P. Davidson, announced today that it will not renew Mr. Davidson's contract when it expires in February 1991. But a search is already under way for his successor, and Mr. Davidson may leave as early as next summer if a replacement is found.

title: Los Angeles Project Aids Illegal Aliens, In Challenge to U.S.
description: To the dismay of the Immigration and Naturalization Service, Los Angeles has established a formal program to help find jobs for day laborers, many of whom do not have the documentation to work legally in the United States.

title: League Backs Wolves
description: Gary Bettman, a senior vice president and general counsel of the National Basketball Association, said yesterday the league would assist the Minnesota Timberwolves in any legal action that the expansion team took against Rick Mahorn, a former Detroit Piston.

title: Profit Up 19% For Du Pont
description: E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Company reported today that its third-quarter profit jumped 19 percent despite a stronger dollar and weaker housing market.

title: Leadership Shuffle Likely in Turkey
description: What do you do with a political leader whose personal approval rating is put by polltakers at 28 percent? Whose party finished an embarrassing third in local elections earlier in the year? Whose candidates won only 22 percent of the popular vote and, opinion surveys indicate, would be lucky now to scrape together 14 percent?

title: Dinkins Unveils TV Ad Enlisting Aid of Kennedy to Assail Giuliani
description: David N. Dinkins continued to wrap his mayoral aspirations in New York City's warm affection for the Democratic Party yesterday, telling business executives that Rudolph W. Giuliani is ''a loyal servant of the national Government'' and unveiling a television commercial that features Senator Edward M. Kennedy.

title: Next Step for Ruble
description: Yesterday's dramatic reduction in the exchange value of the ruble for Soviet citizens traveling abroad reflects both the continuing trials of shaking the Soviet economy out of its lethargy and the Soviet leadership's willingness to act boldly in pursuit of the goal of integration into the world economy.

title: Wm. Wrigley Jr.  Co reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain of $3.2 million from the settlement of a U.S. income tax case.

title: American Precision Industries Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Transco Energy Co reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Results for the latest quarter and 9 months included a $69.4 million gain from the initial liquidating distribution paid by a Transco affiliate. The 9-month results also included a $13.7 million gain from the sale of 50 percent of an interest in certain power generation projects. Results for the current quarter and 9 months also included gains totaling about $25.9 million. c-Results for the earlier periods included a $9.3 million aftertax charge for sale of three coal operations. Additionally, results for the year-ago 9 months included a $15.8 million charge for the settlement of litigation. Year-ago third-quarter share loss is due to the payment of $3,539,000 in preferred dividends.

title: Israeli Restraint Allows Uprising to Drag On
description: To the Editor:

title: 'Tis Better to Laugh At the Darkness
